Reviews.Title: “Great option for Vancouver stay”
Reviews.Author: shreddie97
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Fairmont vancouver on business. Staff were amazing. Hotel is very conveniently located in the downtown. For me a workout option is important on vacation. The workout room is available 24/7 and the concierge station is very helpful with jogging maps if you want to go on a run. Room was very clean, bed was very comfortable. Hotel was quiet. Had a chance to try out the fairmount lounge on the 10th floor and the service there was wonderful as well.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay”
Reviews.Author: BforBoy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night after my meeting at Fairmont Waterfront. I was originally booked for an extra night at the Waterfront but I wanted to stay closer to downtown. The staff at Waterfront were very helpful at switching my reservation to Fairmont Vancouver. The quality of service was way better at the Waterfront property. It's not bad here but the staff weren't as friendly for some reason. The rooms are a bit dated and the spa is not part of the willow spa chains. Anyway, it's still a decent hotel but I'd recommend staying at the Waterfront or pacific rim property.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and convenient to the Conference Center”
Reviews.Author: AnitaLovesTravel
Reviews.Content: The positive: The hotel is beautiful and the staff are warm and helpful. Our check-out bill was rather complicated but the staff figured it out correctly the first time. The location just a short (downhill) walk to the convention center, and there are a range of restaurant choices within just a few blocks. Being an older, historic hotel, the bathrooms are on the small side, but they've included multiple shelves to hold all of the things modern travelers seem to require in the bathroom. And I was pleased to find not one, but two luggage racks in the closet, along with two comfy hotel robes. The negative: Wireless internet is comparatively expensive ($15.95 per day) and the connection, at least in my room, was incredibly weak, slow, and unreliable. I found that I was compelled to do any actual internet-based work while at the Convention Center because the wifi there was so much more stable and strong. Also, I somehow found the entrance to the parking garage to be confusing. Although the hotel address is on Georgia Street, the actual driveway is around the other side, which was tricky to navigate during rush hour with one-way streets. Parking was $30 per day (self park) which is not surprising for an urban area, but still stings.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, great location”
Reviews.Author: KDVictoria
Reviews.Content: The service is excellent. Rooms are lovely but there is no A/C and no fans in the bathroom. The 680 wing of the 6th floor is very quiet and there is no sound from adjoining rooms. Beds and pillows are very comfortable. The hotel is only about a 10 minute walk from Rogers Arena. Valet parking was reasonably priced (for Vancouver). Bathrooms need some upgrading and there was a small amount of mold on the tile. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Terry P
Reviews.Content: The entire staff was friendly, very helpful, and efficient. Both checking in & out was fast and easy. The Fairmont has provided electronic check in & out via email should you choose to use it, very nice option. Our room was well appointed and very comfortable. Wireless internet access is available thoughout the property.The food was excellent. Location is very good, easy walking distance to the harbor, restaurants, ect. This was our first stay @ the Fairmont. In past trips to Vancouver we have stayed at other properties, from now on we will always choose the Fairmont. Terry & Lynn P.

Reviews.Title: “Love The Hotel Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: WCSteel
Reviews.Content: The great bar brings you back to the era of time when people dressed up to go for a drink - lots of history. Staff great especially the gold floor and I love the dogs - I highly recommend the experience. Feels like family

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Fairmont Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: chrissy50
Reviews.Content: This review has taken a bit to get done as I stayed there in March 2008, It is a beautiful hotel and though old the History of the Fairmont Hotels in Canada more than make up for any little problems one might have. The location is fantastic, you walk out your door and you are almost in the Middle of the city, this of course makes getting around very easy and unless you have a problem walking most is within walking Distance

Reviews.Title: “Not family friendly, good location”
Reviews.Author: Chumpstick
Reviews.Content: Checkin was fine, friendly staff mostly. Good central location. No where to sit with the kids and have a drink having been out and about all day. Bar reserved for adults only, even in the middle of the day for a coffee. Mind you plenty of places near by. Didn't spend the $22-28 on breakfast at the hotel, go out to the Italian round the corner... Lovely atmosphere and a food. The rooms were a little old and colonial if you like that sort of thing, but functional. Designer shops like Louis Vuitton boutique in the lobby... Little pretentious, and speaks volumes about the hotel. Again if you like that kind of thing. (we waited 2 hours for our coach pickup and not one person went in the shop).

Reviews.Title: “Pure opulent class!”
Reviews.Author: Richard T
Reviews.Content: We came here for a re-union of old friends. This is far from the first time I have stayed here, and it will certainly not be the last. In a World of hotels where each one seems as bland as the last, and most have all the character of an accountant on tranquilizers, this place stands out as a beacon of old World class and service. The entrance lobby is a quiet haven situated over the length of a city block right in the heart of Vancouver , filled with posh shops for the rich and shameless , and bars and restaurants for those with more medium sized wallets. The staff will attend your every whim, and one of them (Beau the dog) will even let you scratch his ears. His mistress, Debbie, and her partners on the concierge desk seem to be able to accommodate any wishes a guest may have, even when they appear to be besieged by tourists demanding their flights be booked and baggage sent to the airport. The rooms are quiet and tastefully decorated and have all modern amenities. What makes this place stand out in one's memory is the beautiful decor and the friendliness of all members of staff, from the cleaners to the Bell hops , from the bar staff to the aforementioned concierge. They all seem like they genuinely love being there. There is also none of that dreadful elevator music which is designed to relax but actually enrages. I intend to stay here again at every opportunity. Great value for a World of old fashioned class.

Reviews.Title: “Go for the Gold!”
Reviews.Author: Derek A
Reviews.Content: The Gold floor staff provided superior service while staying at the Hotel Vancouver for a conference. Concierge staff made great dinner and sightseeing recommendations. What a great atmosphere. Rejean was super!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding experience (beware the pricey add-ons!)”
Reviews.Author: mshbnyehud
Reviews.Content: Great room (very quiet), outstanding service, wonderful banquets/conference meal, and beautiful amenities. But, I always am concerned to pay $16 for Internet per day, and $42 (including tax) for valet parking per day. But that seems to be routine for Vancouver 5 star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Relic of a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: amennyc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week on business. Lobby and public areas were great. It's just some of the rooms were outdated. Mine in particular. Made me wonder if they had remodeled for the Olympics. Then went to see a co-worker in her room to find that some rooms were remodeled. My client had a suite and that was unbelievable. You get what you pay for is the issue. Not all are the same. ALL employees were super nice and professional. Would most likely stay elsewhere as the feeling was, "been there done that. Very central to all. With great restaurants nearby. No one will be disappointed at the Fairmont, but there are options.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: David A
Reviews.Content: We were visiting from Australia, and had never stayed at the Fairmont Hotel Vancouver before. The whole hotel experience was memorable. We especially appreciated the help of the concierge staff on the ground floor and the 9th floor; and also a staff member called Melany, working on the President's Club desk, was extremely helpful when we checked in.

Reviews.Title: “A real treat.”
Reviews.Author: Skins59
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location. Close to good shopping areas and not far from the bay. We stayed on the Gold Floor which has it's own breakfast area and private lounge with great views to enjoy down towards the bay. All the staff were very helpful and knowledgeable and nothing was too much trouble. The welcome dog was very very friendly, if a bit of a surprise when he sat down next to my table at first breakfast. Bought a nice friendly relaxed feel. Breakfast food was excellent and lots of it (by English standards). Room was lovely and clean, spacious with good quality furniture. Very large and comfortable bed. Certain lifts go straight to the Gold Floor when pressed which was a little embarrassing the first time as others watched as it by-passed their floor, but quite nice after that. Not the cheapest hotel in Vancouver but like other Canadian Fairmonts we've stayed in, worth that bit extra especially for that special occassion. A real treat.

Reviews.Title: “If Vancouver had a Face, I would totally make out with it....”
Reviews.Author: TxSig
Reviews.Content: Staying a week at the Fairmont Hotel Vancouver on Georgia Street has been one of the best experiences for me....I've traveled to all continents including Antarctica, and this hotel and the staff have been the best place to stay with the kindest, most professional staff. Special thanks to Neil at the Concerierge Desk who happily changed my day trip excursions--he told me I was flexible, but it was his ease of changing as my plans changed....he was more than helpful--he was a friend. The best of the best? Tyler Smolen--a great conversationalist and so proud of the Fairmont Company, his job, his future here. I had a horrible situation---major storms and tornadoes had devastated my hometown in Texas and I could not reach my family. My aunt's home was destroyed and she lost her beloved dogs....Tyler helped cheer me up in our conversation--oddly I am from Tyler, Texas, and a Fairmont employee named Tyler was a Godsend. We spoke of travel, and fun topics and he helped me through a personal anxiety that I could not do anything about--over 1500 miles from home and this kind young man gave me hope and made me a better person for meeting him. Also, Paul Dixon with In Room Dining was the highlight of the day. I only met him over the phone and he made sure I was cared for in top notch fashion--with his amazing voice and professionalism--ordering room service was never better. The guest attendents/housekeeping staff was wonderful and always asked if there was anything else I needed. As a person with a disability (prosthetic leg), I was helped when I needed it; respected with every request and offered help and friendship when I needed it most. It was as if I was staying with friends who sincerely cared about me. I love this hotel. I am here for a professional conference on fundraising; but Fairmont Vancouver is the expert in FRIENDraising....I am also a writer and writing two stories on travel; one specifically about travel from the US to Vancouver....YOUR hotel will be my one and only recommendation for every traveler to stay. Special thanks to the staff--the manager of the hotel deserves special thanks and recognition--his leadership is evident in every employee contact....I have stayed in hotels around the globe but never as positive an experience as Fairmont Hotel Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Best Concierge Ever”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan G
Reviews.Content: Neil Maclean was amazing. He answered each of my five questions in succession including where to get a Cowichan sweater. He not only recommended the store that sells the authentic Cowichan's, he actually called up the store to see if they had any in stock and check the price. Neil was also helpful in recommending great restaurants in the area, suggesting places to rent a bike (specifically through the Fairmount President's Club which is free), info about storing bags at the reception during checkout, and the real lowdown on East Hastings. Wish I had asked him stuff earlier, he probably could have recommended some good bars and cafes in the area as well as other local Vancouver intell.

Reviews.Title: “Step back in history with this beautiful Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Havesabagwilltravel
Reviews.Content: Spur of the moment trip led us to this wonderful hotel. Beautiful hotel with lots of personality. Stayed on the gold floor and worth every penny. Concierge made us feel welcome from the moment we stepped off of the elevator. In any newer design hotel the size of room we were assigned would have been considered a suite. Pillow menu made a good night's sleep possible. The hotel has so much personality that it was just fun to wander around, look at the architecture and think about it's history. The location to almost everything was within walking distance. We walked to Canada place and the next day walked to Granville Island. Shopping every direction.

Reviews.Title: “Afternoon Tea in the 900 West Lounge”
Reviews.Author: BCTravelAgent
Reviews.Content: I took my mother for afternoon tea at the Fairmont Hotel Vancouver to celebrate her birthday in mid March and as expected we had a fabulous time! I called the week before to make the reservation for a Saturday at 1 pm, but they did not have any openings until 1:45 pm which was fine with us. We arrived about 10 minutes early and expected to wait, but were instead shown to a lovely table at the railing with two wing back chairs-so comfortable! Our waiter came over to give us the tea menus and fill our water glasses. Once we decided (Fairmont Earl Grey for me and Fairmont Orange Pekoe for her) our tea pots were brought to the table filled with loose tea in a strainer and very hot water-if the water isn't hot enough the tea will not be as good, and after a short time to steep we poured our tea-perfection! The china is very colouful made especially for the Fairmont Hotels and coupled with the silver teapots and cream and sugar service makes the experience even more special-Victorian elegance worthy of such a grand hotel! The staff were very busy and walked smartly between tables, but we did not wait long for our tiered tray of goodies! The staff was very efficient without being rushed and brought hot water refills regularly for our teapots. The sandwiches were excellent-smoked salmon, ham and Brie croissant, curried chicken salad, watercress and cucumber-delicious! The scones were still warm and moist when cut open, heavenly with the clotted cream and jam!! The final pastries were a mini chocolate cupcake, lemon tart, and two others which I can't recall. We were hungry due to skipping breakfast (on purpose so not to spoil our appetite!) and we ate everything! The amount of food was just right for us, but many people had to have some of the treats packed up as they ran out of room! The service throughout our meal was excellent, and I felt the cost was very reasonable at CAD 36.00 + tax per person. I have been to tea at many places around the world and tea at a Fairmont Hotel is always a great experience. We are lucky enough to live in Vancouver and can come for tea often, but is always a "special event". A do not miss for locals and visitors alike!

Reviews.Title: “Attentive Amazing Gold Floor”
Reviews.Author: Travis R
Reviews.Content: Location, perfect. Each staff member we interacted with was really friendly and anticipated anything we might need; very professional service. Our Gold Floor stay was made even more amazing by an great team. Rejean is a star. We stayed for four days and knew we were in very good hands. Continual recommendations on where to go and see. In the lounge we were treated to great food (and drinks). So clean. Everyone attentive. Amazing! Nice to have those little extras including turn-down service, and Gold Floor check-in/check-out. So many great perks to our stay: the bicycles available for use on the sea wall, Mavis the hotel dog, and coffee available at every turn (room, lounge, with wake-up calls)... kept us fueled for doing it all. The Fairmont Hotel Vancouver really does have a classic, stately feel to it. We will definitely return. Truly great service. Amazing stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Dame!”
Reviews.Author: heggarty
Reviews.Content: Worth the trip to Vancouver to stay here. Centrally located and just about everything is within walking distance. Lots of local restaurants to satisfy any palate. Nothing like coming in after a day and having a cup of tea and relaxing in the lounge. This hotel reminds you of what it used to be like to travel, where you are a valued guest. My only negative was the front door staff who did not take my luggage out of the taxi. Other than that.... lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Alarming lack of fire emergency preparedness, customer response”
Reviews.Author: Human44
Reviews.Content: I did not stay at this hotel, but reserved (and paid for) a room for a colleague from out of town who stayed there from March 19 - 23. For two consecutive nights of his stay, the hotel's fire alarm system went off - without a fire, during the middle of the night. The first night, my colleague spent an hour in the lobby between 2 and 3 a.m. along with many other guests. The staff were unprepared for this alarm and did not know where the keys were to provide the Vancouver fire fighters who responded with access to the alarm system. Nor could the hotel staff properly direct guests to the correct stairs to return to their rooms (since this is an old hotel there are many staircases that go to different parts of the building) when the elevators were shut off as a result of the false alarm. As bad as the immediate response of poorly trained staff was, the total absence of any acknowledgement to guests staying at the hotel was simply unacceptable. Not even a note of apology was prepared and distributed to guest rooms. This was repeated the next night, between 11 pm and midnight. Again no acknowledgement! Were the hotel management all on holiday? I have always booked our VIP guests into the Hotel Vancouver, but will have to reconsider based on this experience. Somebody needs to take the responsibility for emergency management and service recovery much more seriously than was the case in this snafu.

Reviews.Title: “Time for a Modern Makeover for this Classic Building”
Reviews.Author: SeabournFan
Reviews.Content: The Hotel VAN is showing its age - but not in all the good old ways that could have been preserved to keep this iconic building an old FAV. Service is slower than ever, rooms are small , stuffy, furniture outdated, bathrooms are really outdated, and the whole property is in much need of some modern technology. Noise from the streets surrounding the hotel will ensure an 'early' wake up call. Even our "Signature Class" room was tired. Hotel restaurants are mediocre - but your in VAN which has so many good restaurants - so eat our anyway :) The Blue Water cafe is a must! The Hyatt across the street is a much better choice (same location, with all the modern technology and comforts of 2012 and better views).

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carolina C
Reviews.Content: This hotel has every thing you could wish for in a hotel ! First of all the rooms are very comfortable and in a generous size. The building it self is an experience and beautiful. Very reasonably priced. It's in the middle of downtown Vancouver making it very handy and easy to go to the best shops in town that are just around the corner. The staff is extremely helpful and genuinely nice - very quick to help. Had breakfast and dinner at the restaurant and food was good and well priced. High tea is available in the piano bar and looks very fancy ! My choice of stay in Vancouver

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: thelamster
Reviews.Content: We've been coming to the Fairmont Hotel Vancouver on and off for the past 12 years. This is one of the classic hotels in all of Canada and was once owned by the Canadian National Railway. The entire hotel exudes a feeling of class and history. Our stay this time was on the eighth floor overlooking Georgia Street looking west. It's far enough above the street that one can hardly hear the hustle and bustle of what's going on at street level. The rooms are large and very comfortable with all the amenities you would expect from such a prestigious hotel. The pool area is large and the fitness studio has a complete set of machines for most workouts. At the lobby level, there is Griffin's restaurant that serves complete breakfasts as well as buffets. The lounge is extremely comfortable and has live music nightly. And don't forget the dogs. There are two yellow labradors named Mavis and Beau who are the unofficial ambassadors for the hotel. They roam the lobby level greeting the patrons. You can even take them for a walk if you feel the urge. All in all, it was a wonderful stay (again) and we look forward to our next visit to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, mediocre service”
Reviews.Author: Shahzadeh
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend to celebrate her 30th birthday. The front desk staff is very rude and even tried to get an older gentleman ahead of me in line when I was clearly the next person in line. Thankfully, this gentleman was courteous and told the female staff that he wouldn't allow queue jumping. Anyhow, the service was mediocre at best. Location was fantastic. Nick at concierge was wonderful. Beds and pillows were sooo comfortable. Service at the lobby bar was atrocious. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Even better second time around”
Reviews.Author: DogJudge
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont Hotel for a second time in December, the hotel was done up a treat for Christmas with trees and lights. I had a very similar room to last time and still feel it was a tad small. Apart from that it was great. The staff were friendlier and far more helpful this visit. And you cannot criticise the location as it is an easy walk anywhere, including down to Gastown to the pubs and restaurants and right on top of Robson Street. You can't knock a hotel that has two great dogs on staff. I am planning my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: JourneysTraveler
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night but thoroughly enjoyed the stay at the Fairmont Vancouver. I am a travel agent (Journeys Around the World) but was in BC for vacation. Had a deluxe room with great view of the city (Burrand and Georgia Streets) and a peak out to the water. Room was very spacious with a nice sitting area & fireplace. Keurig coffee set up was appreciated. Of course, nice robes but no slippers. Bathroom is a bit small but very functional. The hotel is very classy with a beautiful lobby and piano bar off the lobby. Although we were on the 3rd floor, we heard no noise from the busy streets below. The location is wonderful. I am a big fan of Fairmont Hotels and this was no exception!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Laura R
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Hotel Vancouver is a well equipped and well maintained old fashioned style hotel. The bedrooms are clean, modern and comforable. The meeting space is suitable, if not a bit over luxurious! Food is great plus there are amazing views over Vancouver skyline from the top floor. Location is fantastic too, around 10 minute walk down to the waterfront, and just around the corner from Graville Street with shops / bars / restaurants. Thumbs Up

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location, interior feels a little tired”
Reviews.Author: toky302
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont hotel is located in fantastic location in Vancouver and the building itself is very impressive with very nice original features. However once you leave the grandeur of the lobby and downstairs restaurants the hotel starts to feels a little tired. The rooms are very comfortable and offer all the amenities you would expect for the price and such a well know chain of hotels. I feel at the price being charged by the Hotel there are better alternatives on offer in Vancouver..............with friendlier front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay again”
Reviews.Author: willowpuppy
Reviews.Content: It's was an overall good experience. Location is great. The concierge was fantastic at seeing our limo was organized and it was an all around good trip. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, Excellent Facilites, requires some room upgrades”
Reviews.Author: westcoast_canada
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property for one night before heading to Portland. Was provided with a gallery view room, two queen beds. The exterior of the hotel is nice and offers a great central location to shopping and attractions although the room itself was a little bit of a let down. I understand that the hotel is a heritage property although the furnishings in the guest room were marked and scratched and in my opinion required upgrading. The little stand holding the refreshment center was very small and I was afraid to open the door to the bar fridge with fear of being charged for something that I did not want. The bathroom had a different layout being a heritage hotel although the shower pressure was fine and I liked the marble floors. I found the attendant who checked us in to not be overly friendly although the one at check-out was a lot better. The pool facilities were excellent including the hot tub area and the lobby lounge offered exceptional service and food, at a reasonable price. I am happy I stayed at this property and would recommend it to others although for my taste I would rather choose a more modern style hotel such as the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Great Room. Great Staff.”
Reviews.Author: macsally
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with our adult son, stayed at this wonderful hotel over Christmas. We could not have asked for a better holiday. We were on the 9th floor and the lounge was fantastic. Everything about the room was spectacular. We had friends in to visit and they were as impressed as we were. The bathroom was small but really, how much room do you need in a bathroom? The room more than made up for that small thing. The separate living room / office was just wonderful. The breakfast was more than good. It was magnificent. Mavis was the best hostess in the world!!! We will go back again and again!! The hotel was so incredibly decorated for Christmas - we did not feel like we were missing anything. The cookie basket left in our room was a bonus!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Fairmont Vancouver hotel”
Reviews.Author: margie393
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel with all the amenities. Stayed on the gold floor and was treated like gold! The concierge were so helpful with everything from internet connection to arranging for flight check in. Loved the pups and they loved the dog treats I keep in my pocket for my dog walks at home! A beautiful grand hotel and very friendly staff, beautiful large room and very fast room service. I would highly recommend this hotel in the heart of Vancouver and near enough to the harbour to enjoy a brisk walk.

Reviews.Title: “A very special hotel”
Reviews.Author: Curt99
Reviews.Content: This is a remarkable Grand Lady of a hotel. At one time it dominated the city landscape with views from English Bay to Vancouver Harbor. Now it is surrounded by skyscrapers, and it is hard to catch a view of the mountains or ocean. Nevertheless, it remains a wonderful hotel in the heart of the city. Bonuses: - Wonderful lobby, attentive staff - Spacious rooms with high ceilings - Great health club with a good pool to swim laps - only a block from the Canada Line for easy access to and from the airport - good desk for working - great bed with comfortable pillows Negatives - Desk chair is not great for working - Daily housekeeping was excellent, but my room was in need of a thorough cleaning with major collections of dust bunnies behind the furniture. - There were some issues with the card readers in the elevators as myself and others had trouble getting our cards to read properly and would end up getting whisked away to another floor

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont GOLD is exceptional”
Reviews.Author: Robb T
Reviews.Content: Ann, Darren and the entire concierge team of Fairmont gold go out of their way to make each guest feel special and royally accomodated. The appetizer and deluxe cont bfast selection and presentation in the fairmont gold lounge are truely exceptional. There are even two dogs in the lobby you can visit and take on a walk. Fairmont Gold guests are even treated to a complimentary shoe shine. Every detail is thought of.

Reviews.Title: “I keep going back to this wonderful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: bostontraveller56
Reviews.Content: Third or fourth time I've stayed at this hotel - love it. It's not perfect - it being an older hotel, our sink didn't drain so well and we had a hard time getting the water to be very hot in the morning - but the atmosphere of this place is wonderful. It is a grand old style hotel, with impeccable service. Despite its size, it is quiet, and has a great lounge on the main floor for drinks and tea. It is on West Georgia Street - very convenient for heading up to the mountains and just a few minutes from Stanley Park and the aquarium. Restaurant on the main floor has a wonderful buffet for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “High Tea”
Reviews.Author: Geeeeeee3
Reviews.Content: Fantastic experience. Beautiful Hotel. Friendly staff, very accommodating. Waitress even offered to take our pictures without us asking her to. Restaurant was full of customers. Nice ambience.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, fantastic, first rate .”
Reviews.Author: Muriel K
Reviews.Content: The personnel that I had the privilege of meeting during my stay were extremely kind, thoughtful, Caring and delightful. I particularly want to mention Yuri Fournier and Rejean Cliche who truly made my stay on the gold floor memorable. All of the Hotel staff that I had any contact with are to be commended !! Including the bellman and the doorman who wished me " happy birthday " by name. My congratulations on an extremely well- run operation

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: ceb58
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after flying in from the UK on our way to Whistler. Staff helpful, room very comfortable. Excellent breakfast in Griffins restaurant. Downsides quite a bit of traffic noise but thats the price you pay for being in the heart of the city. Overall would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Always Great”
Reviews.Author: Sandra175
Reviews.Content: Hotel Vancouver gold floor is like coming home. It is always wonderful to see the fantastic staff and catch up with everyone, the service is impeccable and every want is seen to immediately. I cannot say enough good things about the Hotel and especially this floor.

Reviews.Title: “Additional charges”
Reviews.Author: Publisher1254
Reviews.Content: $15 per day charges for WiFi for my IPad and the same for my wife's Blackberry is a total rip-off!

Reviews.Title: “Frosted windows”
Reviews.Author: dreamonixx
Reviews.Content: I had 2 big windows in my room and they were covered in an adhesive window treatment so the view was 100% unavailable. The three inches I could open the window showed me that there was a great city view. How unusual. It made the room feel dark and there may as well have been a brick wall behind the curtains. Bathroom sink had cracks in it and rooms are supposed to be classic but just feel dated and dusty. It's like staying at Grandmas house. Staff are all very nice and professional which is an absolute asset to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Gold treatment”
Reviews.Author: Gael M
Reviews.Content: I love the traditional ambiance of the Hotel Vancouver and I especially enjoy the extra perks on the gold floor. The premium is great value for an exceptional breakfast, conceirge service and attention to detail. While my work no longer requires me to be in Vancover, the staff still manage to remember me when I show up for a weekend getaway...and they never forget to bring up a yoga mat just for me. When I was travelling for work I tried several other hotels, including the other Fairmont Hotels in downtown Vancouver, but I always came back to the Hotel Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: nytrodave
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two night stay on the Fairmont Gold floor in Vancouver and i am just amazed at the great service I get when staying at Fairmonts. The Gold floor is a really nice touch, they seem to get it right every time. This was our first stay at this location, it is right in the middle of everything we were in Vancouver for. Check in was a little slow, we arrived at 1pm and there was a large group checking out but once i got to the counter they sent me up to floor 9 where gold floor has there own check in/out counter and it was all good from there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bev M
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Vancouver for the first time. This Hotel was in the middle of downtown with excellent shopping and restaurants near by. The rooms were spacious, clean and offered great views. Everyone was super friendly and helpful. A big extra thank you goes to the Lobby Manager, Scott. He made us feel very welcome and comfortable. His recommendation of a few "must see's" with his "personal favorites" included translated into a wonderful weekend. We also enjoyed Tea Time while visiting the Hotel Vancouver, it was first class service and a wonderful treat for us. We highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “staying in your own town”
Reviews.Author: tedsexcellentmusic
Reviews.Content: We had a function at the hotel which was amazing, so we decided to stay overnight. Great room, service and happy to recommend. I enjoy staying at Fairmont Hotels as the experience is always good.

Reviews.Title: “Very elegant-great pillows”
Reviews.Author: Aussie066
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night on our way to Whistler. But a memorable stay. Just a fantastic, relaxing plush environment. Just wonderful to walk around inside the hotel. Fabulous service:- from the doorperson, check in, concierge. Room had great ammenties. Very comfortable bed and just loved the pillows.-Head slowly sank to a very comfortable point. At times did notice noise from with airconditioner But a certain recommendation. Location very convenient. About 10-15 minute walk to the water front note- Some shops inside and the upmarket ones close by just outside may hurt the wallet if you weaken.

Reviews.Title: “Another Excellent Stay At The Fairmont Hotel Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Craig1963
Reviews.Content: I visit Vancouver a couple of times each year on business, and have stayed at the Fairmont Hotel Vancouver before. Knowing what I was in for, I had no hesitation booking a junior suite for my most recent trip, which required me to stay downtown for three days. Sometimes things change with time, and there have been occasions when I returned to a favourite hotel only to be disappointed. Not so here, as the Hotel Vancouver once again exceeded all of my expectations. As I've written in previous reviews on this hotel, the location cannot be beat. With its central position right in the heart of Vancouver's downtown core, everything from Stanley Part to BC Place stadium and GM Place to Robson street shopping is within easy walking distance. It's also an easy half-block to the Skytrain. The Hotel Van is a heritage building, and you cannot help but feel the tremendous elegance that envelopes you as you walk inside and look around the lobby. The hustle and bustle of Vancouver disappears, and you've stepped back in time - not just to a world of marble and brass, but to the type of friendly, graceful and efficient service that seems altogether too rare today. You're treated like royalty from the moment you approach the door, and made to feel like you're the one and only customer the hotel has ever had. How wonderful that feels after a long day of traveling. The hotel's restaurant (Griffins) serves a varied menu, while you can also get snacks and drinks in the open lobby bar. I dined at both - sood was great, service impeccable. My room was utterly spotless, well furnished, and with perhaps the most comfortable hotel bed ever. I have no idea what the thread count on the linen might have been, but it was soft as can be and appeared to be new. Multiple pillows of different density is always a nice touch, and I truly appreciated the nightly turn-down service, complete with a small bottle of water waiting at my bedside. A trip to the bath revealed enough towels to dry a small army, all of them thick, plush and soft as the linens. My room had a walk-in shower, so I really enjoyed all the space. I did make use of the hotel's health club, and found it to be quite good. The equipment is all in new condition, perfectly maintained, and the towel racks were full. Several other guests also made use of the facility while I was there, yet no one seemed to get in anyone else's way, so the layout and allocation of different machines seems good. I didn't use the pool. The hotel has two beautiful and extremely well behaved Labrador retrievers who hang around the concierge desk, waiting to take guests for a walk. Make the time to take a spin around the block with one (or both) of them. It will be the best five minutes of your day. Finally, I have to say it again - the service is what really sets this hotel apart. Yes it's a great building, yes it's crazy clean and tidy, but few places leave you feeling as valued as a customer as the Fairmont. It's truly in a league of its own.

Reviews.Title: “Vancouver British Columbia”
Reviews.Author: ddie
Reviews.Content: This is an old world elegant hotel. The rooms are beautiful but old world with high ceilings, draperies and you feel like your in a different era. The hotel is centrally located a few minutes from Robson stree (huge shopping area) with stores from Chanel to local tourist shops. The restaurants are endless. You are in downtown Vancouver minutes away from the waterfront and Gas town. You are close to Stanely park, see capilano swinging bridge, lunch in Yaletown. You can see Granville Island and many other attractions. Its expensive to park your car in the adjacent garage. The restaurants are pricy but there are McDonalds and pizza joints nearly. The hotel is a 3 minute walk away from City square with a museum and a shopping mall. Go to Second beach and walk along the park. Eat at Milestones, Earls Cactus club. It does rain a lot but you can enjoy lots of indoor activites and fun for the kiddies too

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: leslie026
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (both early 60's) were treated fantastically from the moment we drove up for Valet parking until we left. Based on other reviewers comments, we opted to pay the extra $2 ($30 self park or $32 valet park, both with in/out privileges, and parking until 5 p.m. the next day) plus tip for the convenience of Valet parking. We arrived at 2 p.m. and they weren't busy at that time, so my door was opened for me, our luggage was hauled out for us and we were off to the reception desk in no time. Note that you drive to the 'back' of the hotel through a drive-thru to get to Valet parking. Don't go to the front of the hotel on the main streets (Georgia St. or Burrard St.). At Reception, we had no line-up at all and went straight to the desk clerk. I asked about 'upgrading' as we were booked in a Fairmont Room and, based on other reviewers feedback (Thank You!), we decided to spend the extra $100 and upgrade to the Fairmont Gold floor, corner room. It was a great decision as the room couldn't have been better. We got complimentary appetizers in the evening (5-7 p.m.) before dinner, and a wonderful hot/cold breakfast the next morning - with a nutritious assortment to choose from. They have a DVD player in the room and a complimentary assortment of DVD's to choose from in the hospitality suite. Internet is free on this floor (which we didn't use), plus many other amenities which we didn't need. This is the 9th floor of the hotel and we found the traffic below to be a muted noise - although you will definitely hear any sirens going by. My husband used their gym facilities and was quite pleased (they are 24/7). There were 4 treadmills with built-in T.V.'s, 4 elipticals, and, sadly, only one weight room cubbyhole big enough for 1 person. So, he decided to use their kinetic weights - which he had never used before - and enjoyed them more than using his regular weights. Also they had stationary bikes, etc. Very well-equipped and better than all the hotels we've ever stayed in he said. We used their 900 West Lounge once in the afternoon and once in the late evening. Service was superb. Be expected to pay more for your drinks here than you probably would someplace else, but the ambiance is really wonderful and felt the whole experience was worth it. There is a local pub on Burrard Street about 2 blocks up and on the same side of the street as the hotel (going west). For shopping, you couldn't ask for a better location! Robson Street, with mostly upscale shops is only a 1/2 block away. The huge Pacific Centre Shopping Mall is only 2 blocks away. There are many boutique shops in the area. Lots of restaurants around with all the different choices of food that you could even think of. All in all, every staff member we spoke with was friendly and efficient at their job. They made our whole experience a wonderful time to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: WL_traveller
Reviews.Content: Great location - bang in the middle of downtown.Loved the pool and the healthclub facilities

Reviews.Title: “Excellent as always”
Reviews.Author: cmf000
Reviews.Content: LOVE this hotel! This was our third stay in the last six years, and we had the usual terrific time -- it seemed to us that the desk staff and the wait staff in the restaurant were even better than before. Also, my husband smokes, and there was no problem getting a room with smoking permitted. I was attending a workshop on the other side of the downtown area and I knew I would be taking cabs. So we thought about staying at another hotel a bit closer to the workshop. But then we realized that the cab fare would be close to the same regardless, and the one hotel in downtown Vancouver where early morning cabs can be virtually guaranteed to be waiting is the Hotel Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Old Hotel, Perhaps Time for a Touch-Up”
Reviews.Author: drgmobile
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Vancouver on business. It is a beautiful old hotel in a great location in Vancouver. The hotel is starting to show its age a bit though and could stand for a bit of an upgrade -- nothing dramatic, just a bit of polish to keep the place competitive in a very competitive hotel market. My one aggravation was the elevators. You need to use your key to access the floors but often it wouldn't take on the first try and several times the elevator started moving in the wrong direction before I had a chance to get the key in.

Reviews.Title: “Service Not Where it Should Be”
Reviews.Author: SteveMedicoff
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont Hotel Vancouver for 3 days last week, and i have to say that it was not up to Fairmont standards. Firstly, when i went to check in, there was nobody at the reception desk, quite odd. After a few moments, somebody appeared and helped me out. The real hassle came when i tried to log onto Wi-Fi, which i should get complimentary for being a Fairmont Presidents Club member. For some reason, I couldn't connect. I was transfered around between guest services and front desk for it seemed like forever, and nobody seemed to want to own the problem, which upset me. Finally i was transfered to some Internet Support division, and they stated that they did not have me identified as a guest at the hotel. Somebody else was registered in my room! Well back to guest services, and finally they admitted to a "glitch" at check-in, and they did some magic and registered me in properly. This process wasted an hour of my short day. Then a couple of days later, my room key would not work in the elevator or my room. I went to the front desk, and they replaced my key, without an apology or anything resembling a sense of concern. My biggest problem with ths hotel is that the staff don't seem to really care about the guest experience. From the many times i called the front desk and they called me by another name (remember the glitch) when i told them it wasn't me, to the general lack of ownership, I think that the management are riding the Fairmont name too proudly. The guest experience should be very similar to the Fairmont Pacific Rim down the street, which sadly it doesnt even come close. And what about the lobby, virtually no place to sit and relax while waiting for someone! Pass on this place. Don't be fooled by the name.

Reviews.Title: “The grande old lady has class”
Reviews.Author: flamesfan24
Reviews.Content: The staff and the renovated rooms make this a worthy experience.. The hotel is a fixture within a great downtown area. Walking distance to every conceivable venue and/or function - sports/art/drama/ shopping/ relaxation. Never disappointed, especially when the gallery room across from the Art Gallery is assigned.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: Colleen55
Reviews.Content: Made a reservation throught a 3rd party discounter and will never do that again! We have stayed at the Hotel Vancouver in the past and had a great experience. Not this time, I didn't know they had such tired rooms with below grade bathrooms. The first room we were assigned was very dirty which included marks in the toilet (need I say more) hair in the bathtub and a general grubby feel. I complained and got another room of the same quality but slightly cleaner but with same general grubby feel. After a few hours the hotel phoned and asked if we wanted to upgrade free of charge but at that point we had unpacked and did not want to go though the hassle. Had they done it right away, it would have been appreciated. They did pick up our lunch tab downstairs which was great as the lunch was not good enough. Shirmp sandwich with very little shirmp and a very tired side salad. The price you are paying for the foods demands top quality. Clearly this exerpeince was surprising because we have always had good food there. We will probably not stay at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional - Director Front Office Opperations”
Reviews.Author: TownsvilleBrendan
Reviews.Content: This is certanly a first rate Hotel - location, staff, service and hotel amenities are excellent. The stand out feature for us was the exceptional service and professionalism show by Vince " The Director of Front Office Operations". We ran into a slight problem when the hotel pool became unavailable due to an unexpeted maintanance issue. The provision of gym and pool facilities were one of the main reasons we picked the Hotel Vancouver and when we discovered the pool was not available,we were most disappointed. Vince then did his utmost to assist and exceeded our expectations with his service and genuine HOSPITALITY. Well done Fairmont Hotels you have not only got yourselves a first rate hotel but more importantly a staff member who listens to his guests and does his best to remind all of us what hospitality is all about. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Venue with class.”
Reviews.Author: PandSMadison
Reviews.Content: This was our second Fairmont hotel and it certainly kept up the style and service levels we had been promised. We loved the hotel dog - especially as we were missing our own! Concierge was fantastic here - gave us good suggestions and even marked parts of a city map to avoid after dark which we appreciated. They organised dinner reservations and were very friendly. The bar staff were friendly and efficient. THe rooms are classically decorated and very clean and compact. The old world charm goes from teh entrance to exit and everything in between.

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: knowledgeofman
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel a number of times. My last stay I was in town to catch a Hockey game. Me and my wife checked in a little later than we wanted due to traffic. Because of the game taxi's were hard to come by and so the concierge, to keep us from being late, brought us to the game in thier presidential club car. Gorgeous car. Great service. Rooms are always spotless. Front desk staff always helpfull. And have always accomodated any special requests I have ever had

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sylv_melb
Reviews.Content: They accommodated us with an earlier check in which was great after a long flight from Melbourne. Beautiful hotel, centrally located to so many things and easy to get around town from here. The room was very clean; we had 2 double beds for 2 adults and 2 young kids. The pool and spa was wonderful on our first night, however, unfortunately, from the next night to about 6 weeks, they were closed for servicing. Anyway, it is a great place for stopover to get over the jet lag before our skiing holiday. HIghly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Olde Worlde Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jen K
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights as a family of 2 adults and 2 teenagers (all the in the one room). The hotel was wonderful and the staff were very polite and courteous. We arrived just before the Christmas decorations were taken down and the lobby looked like a sparkling jewel. It is in a great location and the lobby bar (with the pianist) is a lovely place to stop for a drink. Great value for money - 5 star service without the price tag! We loved the 2 resident dogs that 'help out' at the Concierge - Mavis and Beau - a big drawcard and a nice friendly wag of the tail at the end of the day!

Reviews.Title: “very attentive staff, gorgeous christmas display”
Reviews.Author: BJAMoo
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here (two adults and two young children and mother in law) in co joining rooms. The check in staff were so incredibly attentive after a very long flight from Australia, and remembered everyone names, when ever we walked past the desk. The christmas display (candy cane house) was lovely and the dogs, were both a source of great enjoyment to our children. We had a great deal, with a family rate booked online. The location was perfect and one block walk to the subway, if you choose to catch it to the subway. Resturant good value, with under five eating free. We also ordered room service and it was a wonderful meal also, better then the resturant

Reviews.Title: “Felt like I was at home”
Reviews.Author: AngieK_75
Reviews.Content: I stayed on the Gold floor of this hotel in October 2011 while I was in Vancouver for an extended business stay. My stay was wonderful - the staff on the gold floor were incredibly attentive and friendly and I felt like I was among friends the entire time I was there. The hotel has 2 dogs who are very friendly and engaging and I loved having breakfast with Mavis while she sat at my feet. Newer flashier hotels are available in Vancouver but this hotel gave me a feeling of warmth, community and home that I was incredibly grateful for.

Reviews.Title: “Local Getaway”
Reviews.Author: agiustino
Reviews.Content: Return trip at Christmas time with our two kids, age 4 and 6 years. We enjoy the decorations in this hotel as well as nearby gingerbread displays and trees at the Four Seasons. Hotel provides a comfortable home base. Restaurant caters to children with colouring and free food for kids under 5. Indoor pool is highlight as well for all since its heated and has a small wading pool. Downside was two room suite we booked that was outdated. Green carpet was ripped and pulling up and the room has seen better days. We all slept fine but I'd say its one of the more outdated fairmonts.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: dcrose
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at the Fairmont Waterfront but chose this one due to the indoor pool. Our one bedroom suite was huge except for the bathroom which was quite small with little counter space. Even though the hotel is a classic, the room was updated and very nice. The indoor pool was great for this time of year and the exercise room had decent equipment. Room service dinner was excellent and the buffet breakfast was very good too. The location is perfect for shopping and not too far a walk to the seawall. The highlight of the stay for our kids was the dog at the concierge desk. It was so friendly and we couldn't walk past it without them stopping to pet it. Overall, a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, a bit disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: JulD
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. I stayed there for a conference with colleagues and we had a good conference rate. For the money I paid, it was definitely worth but I'm not sure I would stay there again without that rate. The beds were really comfortable but the room was somewhat small, compared to other places I stayed in Vancouver. I was disappointed with the service. We didn't have the right number of towels in the room and it took us 2 days to get them, despite calling multiple times.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, grand hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pumbelchook
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife and two teenage children for 3 nights in December. This is a lovely, landmark hotel positioned perfectly in downtown Vancouver. We caught the train in from the airport then walked the one block to the hotel - a very easy commute. We had two connecting rooms and were very happy with their cleanliness and the comfort of the beds. No room safes, which is unusual these days, but the hotel does offer free safe deposit boxes at reception. The labaradors at the concierge's desk are a really nice, unique touch. All in all, this hotel was an excellent base for exploring Vancouver on foot.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Gerigenie
Reviews.Content: Wonderful downtown Vancouver location with excellent service. However, having stayed elsewhere in downtown Vancouver, this does not strike me as good value-for-money. It is an expensive hotel to begin with and, on entering your room, you realise that ''everything is extra'', even to the extent that there is a little ''Fairmont Teddybear'' which you can buy, water at $Canadian8 per bottle and I was ''warned'' on checking-in, not to even attempt to touch the fridge if I didn't want anything in it, as I would be charged! For the per night room rate, I don't believe for instance, that water should be charged for as an extra. The one buffet breakfast I ate there was excellent, as was the service but the choices for eating breakfast elsewhere for much less were too great to eat there every day. Wifi was also EXTRA and quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel makes it right”
Reviews.Author: D C
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a very busy Friday afternoon one week before Christmas. Having requested early check-in long before, we were disappointed that our suite was not ready at 2:30. With our elderly mother in tow, we were asked to wait in the lobby lounge. When our room was not ready almost an hour later, we caught the eye of a manager in the lobby who handled things exceptionally well, picking up our tab in the lounge and taking us directly to our suite. He even made a dining reservation for us in the very busy hotel restaurant at a very nice table. It turned out to be a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing historic hotel, great location, parking is a challenge”
Reviews.Author: gloabl
Reviews.Content: I love staying at Fairmont hotels, the service is unrivalled no matter where we travel. We have stayed at all of the fairmont hotels in western canada and there was something really special with the Hotel vancouver. The city has really built up around this hotel and the location is within steps to amazing shopping, vancouver art gallery, endless restaurants and walking distance to the scenic beaches of vancouver. The hotel staff were really friendly, and upon check in, we recieved a free upgrade to a delux suite at an amazing rate. We enjoyed a massive hotel room with a peekaboo ocean view and classic marble bathroom. The only downfall of the huge room was the very tight bathroom space. We also enjoyed the lobby lounge with amazing desserts and drinks at a reasonably extravagant treat, but the ambiance and relaxation and service make this lounge a great place to unwind from the hustle and bustle outside the hotel. The only real issue with this hotel location is the parking & traffic. Our taxi driver missed the driveway at the back of the hotel and after being caught in a standstill in traffic, we unloaded at a bus stop on the front side of the hotel and hauled our suitcases up the steps, there are no bellman on this side of the building, or luggage carts. I am not sure where the vehicles are stored overnight for guests with cars as there is no parking on site. The food, ambiance, service and location are amazing and i highly recommend it for a luxury city retreat or shopping weekend getaway.

Reviews.Title: “A must in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: PhilthetravellerXI
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference held at the Fairmont in Vancouver, Canada, which was very well organised with great conference facilities and catering. Stayed at the Hotel in a fine old style room, very nice facilities, and a pleasant view over some city streets and the harbour in the distance. One of the chain of hotels that cross Canada and came as a result of the railway crossing that nation. A beautiful old building with lots of memorabilia and photos of the old days. The Concierge desk were always helpful with tour suggestions and advice, and the two labradors delightful - they apparently are part of the heritage of the hotel. Great dining, well located to walk the city. I would certainly stay there again when in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort Like Home”
Reviews.Author: Tricky00
Reviews.Content: Very clean and comfortable . The staff at this hotel are very friendly and helpful which makes a stay here extra special.

Reviews.Title: “It worth your choose值得选择”
Reviews.Author: carolechen05
Reviews.Content: I booked a suite at Fairmont hotel vancouver for my boss for 2 nights last month.He said it was great,rooms,staffs,direction, all of this hotel were made a deep and good impression. 上个月我帮我老板订了2晚这个酒店，他很满意。酒店的房间，员工，位置，都给他留下了好印象。

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Triplechocolate
Reviews.Content: First time staying at the hotel and we loved it. Traveled with my 4 yr old. I recommend the Fairmont Gold experience. The lounge was relaxing and a great place to recharge between activities. Rejean had a plush robe and slippers brought to the room for my daughter. You would have thought it was Christmas for her. The pool was a nice temp. The shallow pool is perfect for little kids and warm enough that parents aren't going to freeze while sitting in it. The main pool was also warm compared to other pools. Great location. Will be staying here again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont - Hotel Vancouver - AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: trvlynwilburys
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to recently stay 2 nights at the Hotel Vancouver this past weekend. I had an incredible corporate rate with our staff holiday party being at the Hotel and I was upgraded to the Gold Floor by one of my friends collegues. Let me say this was the best hotel stay I have had -- and I usually stay in 4-5 star hotels. The service was fabulous, the room was huge but the furniture could have used an update but that's probably me just being used to a contemporary style room opposed to a room with an antique feel. The Gold Floor lounge was perfect and offered lovely hors d'ouerves and breakfast in the morning. Thank you Darren, Gilles, Mavis and the rest of the Gold Floor team.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite the grand hotel they claim it to be.....”
Reviews.Author: pingpongb
Reviews.Content: This hotel is touted as being one of Vancouver's finest, so against my better judgement, I ignored previous reviews, and booked a room using a travel agent over the internet. We arrived by taxi, and as we got out, at the main door, the doorman seemed so engrossed in speaking with someone else, that we were totally ignored. What annoys me, in North America, is that chasing a tip often comes above serving the customer, and that was certainly the case here. We managed our bags ourselves, and at reception later, I was asked if I needed help with our luggage. Quite why hotels ask this question, when any decent establishment would already have taken care of it, is a mystery to me. The lobby of this hotel is bustling with activity, and I had a short term urge to ignore what had happened upon arrival, and just enjoy being there. A choir of young children was performing, and they sang beautifully. Although Christmas is some way off, it certainly put me in the mood. Check in was quick, polite and easy. I was offered an upgrade 'for a little extra' money. I refused, because when you book a room, at a prestigious hotel, you expect your room to be good enough. I should have heard alarm bells ringing in my head, when the receptionist said, 'You're with Expedia sir', as if that made me unworthy. I hadn't booked through Expedia, so I was a little surprised to hear this. In future, I will take this as being a secret code for 'you need to upgrade'. We stepped out of the lift on our floor, and I suddenly knew that we we'd made a mistake. The floor we were staying on seemed barren and bare, and somehow unloved and neglected. Our room was I'm sure, in its day, very nice. But that was a long long time ago. The Fairmont intro channel on the tv made no sense, advising us to keep our personal effects in the in-room safe- There wan't one...! We were warned that if we removed anything from the mini-bar we'd be charged for it. I couldn't even open the fridge door. There were no slippers, no plants or flowers, and the room was very dusty. The bathroom wallpaper was beginning to fall off the walls, and spots of mould grew in the ceiling corners. The plus point, was that the bed itself was very comfortable. I cannot think of any other things that were worthy of a positive mention, bar the hotel's location. This hotel could not be better- Five minutes from the waterfront, two minutes from the Pacific Centre, surrounded by good restaurants, and the hotel also houses some of the best shops in Vancouver. I have a simple policy, if the room meets expectations, spend in the hotel. If not, don't. So we never tried out any of the dining choices, so I'm unable to comment there. We did however use the swimming pool. It was dimly lit, and nobody using it seemed to know that through the gym, there were changing rooms. There were no staff around to tell people this, and because the surrounding area to the pool was small, many people changed in a somewhat embarrassed way, by the side of it. It did seem funny that people were arriving in shoes and boots, but then again, like us, I suppose they found no slippers in the wardrobe. I wouldn't stay again, but I suppose that goes without saying. Staff at this hotel, when you can get their attention, are very friendly, as are most Canadians. Great city.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the middle of it all !!”
Reviews.Author: ricski64
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay on the GOLD floor at this property and had a wonderful stay. GOLD staff were very accommodating to our questions about the city and providing us with dinner and car reservations. Good breakfast and evening hors d'oeuvres served in the lounge which has a nice quieter area just off to the side. I think Mavis loves this room too !! Our room was done in Fairmont style which also had a nice big flat screen as well. Enjoyed the pool area and sauna facilities too. The location is close to Granville and Robson streets so there is plenty to see and do. Pacific Centre Mall is very close by and has many shops to visit. We flew into Vancouver and found taking the Canada Line a very convenient way to get to the hotel (Burrard Street Station) about 20 min and like $8. And let's not forget the bed ..aahhh the bed, like sleeping on a cloud. Will be back to this property as we really love the historical feel here.

Reviews.Title: “Wew....depressing....”
Reviews.Author: BacchusB
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights....great location and amazing bed but horrible room everything looks old and used........ very fleemarket-ish! Bathroom was extremely small and gross looking....my collegue said it was discusting.....indeed.....I would NEVER go back.

Reviews.Title: “Completey satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Bruce b
Reviews.Content: We had the occasion to stay on the gold level for 6 nights. The staff could not be more accomodating - whatever was needed was arranged for immediately with a follow up confirmation by paper. This included a baby sitter, a rental car, a sedan to the airport, and restaurant reservations. We could not have asked for better service.

Reviews.Title: “Great historical hotel”
Reviews.Author: caldasgirl
Reviews.Content: We love the Fairmont chain of hotels and this one didn't disappoint. The room was spacious and the bed very comfortable. The reception clerks were extremely when I got sick and needed medication. The hotel bar is a great place to people watch with exceptional service. The concierge was very knowledgeable and was always able to answer our questions. The hotel is looking tired and could use some sprucing up especially in the hallways but overall is it clean and tidy.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Bed”
Reviews.Author: TripMax55
Reviews.Content: There is nothing better than a truly comfortable bed, unless it's a great hot shower--- the bathrooms are first class and the view, marvelous. Let's keep this one a secret...

Reviews.Title: “Classic elegance, exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: PanaramaRidgeCouple
Reviews.Content: I love staying at this hotel and have stayed there often. I was there again last week for a couple of days and I was once again reminded of why I love this hotel so much. It has a great location, unmatched service, and so many rooms to chose from. My hint, if you are offered a room that does not quite meet your expectations, just ask to look at another room. This is a large hotel which can usually offer many types of rooms for you to choose from. As a business traveller I booked into the gold floor (which has a lounge for guests). The lounge was very well stocked with food, liquor, books, DVDs, etc.

Reviews.Title: “You just want it to be better.”
Reviews.Author: NWWineGirl
Reviews.Content: Two night stay; weekend away with my husband. It's not horrible. It's in a great location. They just need to pour some money into it for renovations; the hallways are on the edge of "dumpy" and the lobby bar attracts a lot of grey hair with its "cruise ship" entertainment. We had a super-large King room with a massive sitting area. Didn't need it, but it was nice.

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed staying right Downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: CanadianTourFamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights with 2 kids. Not really a kid hotel, far too posh! it was nice to be right downtown though. We rented bikes to bike around stanley park and walked to the Aqaubus to visit Grandville Island. We could walk everywhere and watch the city from our window. The pool was wonderful though the hot tub was GROSS with a horrible smell. The fitness room was well stocked with machines and free weights. I would happily stay again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont hotel - Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: TILLYFARLAR
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel right in the middle of things but very quiet. The staff were all busy but attentive. The bed was to die for and blackout curtains for a good lie in. Excellent facilities would stay here again if we ever went back to Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Traditional Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rdabca
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay at the Hotel. Our room was comfortable and traditionally decorated. The Club Lounge was lovely and helpful, friendly staff. The location is perfect, smack in the middle of downtown Vancouver. You can walk practically anywhere in the central area from here. Loved the hotel dogs.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great place to stay! Central location in Vancouver, BC”
Reviews.Author: Pat C
Reviews.Content: We checked in Nov 5/11 to attend a football game. We enjoyed a Fairmont 1 bedroom king room. Spotlessly clean (all Fairmonts are), with great amenities. Absolutely no smoking--thank heavens! Enjoyed drinks at the 900 Lounge. Check-in was seamless, valet parking has an extra charge, but all hotels in the middle of a city do. Staff was very friendly and accomodating. The hotel has an amazing history and is very proud of it. There are 2 service dogs at the Concierge desk, always ready to go for a walk, and greet guests with a friendly wag. One of our favourite hotels to stay in the middle of downtown Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic setting and delivery of an amazingly superior product!”
Reviews.Author: Stump_fiddle
Reviews.Content: My wife accompanied me on a business trip which called me to Vancouver just for a single night. Rainy weather, but an amazing experience, even for one night. Gracious valet greeting, tremendous room service meal shortly after arrival, and wonderful staff at every turn. Breakfast in the restaurant was tailored perfectly to my business guests' requests, and was expertly served. I was impressed with this place's five-star delivery of a great stay. Thank you, Fairmont staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Hotel Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Stephen W
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay at the grand dame Fairmont in Vancouver. We were there October 24 - October 26. Our room on the Gold Floor was cozy but very nice, another comfortable chair besides the one there would have been nice rather than having to utilize the desk chair for TV watching. The Gold Floor lounge was well staffed and the food offered more than adequate and quite good. We enjoyed high tea in the first floor lounge. The hotel is located in the shopping district across from the art museum. We will stay there again next year and hope this helps making your decision to stay as well.

Reviews.Title: “Gold Floor”
Reviews.Author: baby526
Reviews.Content: The Gold floor team is the best!! They are professional but very fun to be around. It is definitely my "home away from home" Many thanks to all of you. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: missxanthropy
Reviews.Content: Easy to get too by transit. Take the Canada Line (from the airport) to Vancouver City Center stop. Its literally 2 blocks away from the station. The hotel is surround by a shopping district, close to restaurants, bars, coffee shops. There are two friendly dog ambassador's that hang out by the concierge desk. Fairmont's are very consistent with service and incredibly helpful with directions. I've stayed at both the Fairmont Vancouver airport and Waterfront and I prefer the downtown location more.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in the heart of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Tasi
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel, the room was superb, the beds luxurious and the staff fantastic. We arrived early from Calgary, at check in the lady at the Fairmount Gold check in (we were not Gold) went out of her way to ensure that she found a room for us that would be quiet for our four night stay. It did not disappoint, the twin queen beds were devine, the room was beautifully appointed with tea and coffee supplies topped up daily, the TV was large and worked well. The bathroom was lovely (not much shelf space but that's okay) and there was a huge wardrobe. We were told that if we required a fridge to store anything that housekeeping would only be too happy to provide one; we were also told that if we removed anything from the existing room fridge it would immediately be charged to our account. (We had not been made aware of this at previous hotels in Canada). During the four days and nights we spent at the Fairmount we found the staff to be very helpful,nothing was too much trouble. This applies to reception, bar, restaurant, concierge and porters - thank you for great service! AND the beds were fantastic, we just sunk into them each night and we were asleep in no time - the best yet! Of course I cannot finish without mentioning Mavis and Beau, just receiving a warm lick from one of these two gorgeous canines was magic as I was missing my two dogs so much after 4 weeks of travel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and great location.”
Reviews.Author: Yanchepian
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Fairmont Hotel Vancouver on 2 separate occasions during our 4 week holiday in Vancouver and Canadian Rockies. We stayed for 4 nights in September, on our arrival to Vancouver and loved it so much we returned for 3 nights at the end of our stay in October. The rooms were spacious, nicely presented, clean and contained all the amenities we required. Relaxing music quietly playing throughout the room on our arrival along with some edible goodies and a welcome card (personally signed by the concierge's) was a lovely touch. The bed was comfy and a "pillow menu" allows a selection of pillows to suit you. The bathroom was clean and spacious and rooms attendanted twice daily. We stayed on the private "gold" floor and must give credit to all the staff, especially all the Concierge, who really went out of their way to make us feel welcome, assist us and made us feel special. The lounge on the gold floor offers a great smorgasboard of fresh fruits and other yummy things for breakfast, a cocktail hour in the evenings as well as fresh coffee/teas for morning/afternoon tea. The hotel is well located in the middle of town, within walking distance to the train station, Canada Place, shopping arcades and restaurants. We dined at Griffins Restaurant (located within the hotel complex) twice during our stay and had the most delicious meals. The prime rib was to die for. Service was excellent and friendly. Would definately recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “A great weekend at a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mike R
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel done over meticulously, with all the modern amenities you could want. Great pool and hottub, very well appointed fitness center, open 24hrs, pool until 10:30. Beautiful spacious rooms, friendly and helpful staff everywhere. Cute yellow labs for if you miss your own pets at home. Great service any time you need it. It doesn't get much better than this. Location is right in the heart of downtown, with Robson street, Pacific Center mall, Granville street and all kinds of shopping , restaurants and attractions right outside your hotel. We live in Vancouver, and love to stay here as a getaway for a night.

Reviews.Title: “Two stays totalling five nights............”
Reviews.Author: EAZELIFF
Reviews.Content: Only an individual traveler like me comes up with my wacky itineraries, but I drove in on October 1 and stayed two nights, drove to Seattle and then Portland, where i left the car at a friend's home, and then returned to Vancouver by train on Oct. 8. I will say I was generally pleased with my stays, and I realize that this is a big city landmark hotel, but I am a little tired of seeing these large bills before my eyes. I remember eating dinner there in 1986 and the main dining room was called the Timber Club. When I dined there again in 1999, it was something else, but apparently the layout has been changed since then. I enjoyed my meaks at Griffin's, but the trend seems to be toward more casual dining in these places, rather than catering to the old ladies with blue hair. I guess that makes sense. As a matter of principle, I refuse to use those hotel minibars. $9 for a Budweiser? I don't think so. The rooms I had were spacious and comfortable, and I agree with others - more shelf space is needed in the bathrooms. I made use of the exercise room and pool. Now this item is something that I am a crank about, but I appreciate good music and the " contemporary rock " or whatever it is called is banal and offensive to my ears. I did mention this to one manager, and I don't expect it to necessarily change because of my comment, but I wish they would just turn that crap off! Also, on my second stay of three nights, one night's worth of valet parking crept into my bill - this was when I had arrived by train. It was promptly removed without any discussion, but stuff like that is annoying. I am in Jasper, Alberta at the moment, crossing Canada by train and will stay in a few days at the Fairmont Royal York in Toronto, but porposely did not stay at the Jasper Park Lodge, as I do not wish to look at another huge bill. I did enjoy lunch there yesterday, but elected to stay in a nice B&B. The location of the Fairmont Vancouver is fabulous, as I came to hear the Symphony and attend the Anglican Cathedral, which I could have hit with a rock from my room!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Holiday in Canada”
Reviews.Author: rallydriver
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fairmont for 3 nights. Amazing Hotel. Staff helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A grand dame with an innovative twist”
Reviews.Author: petewanner
Reviews.Content: An old hotel that has been meticulously done over, then staffed with tremendous people. Very comfortable bed but the rest of the room furniture is original - so working or reading is quite uncomfortable. For a traveler, you have skype to talk to the kids, cell phone to stay in touch with the wife, texting for the grandkids - but if you miss your dog, too bad. At this hotel, they have 2 dogs that are there to really make you feel like home - what a fantastic idea and truly appreciated. All this said - my next trip will not be to this hotel - they are simply too expensive and the value for the money is not there. I can get business class across the street for less money with more features Wireless was extra - and this on the Gold floor - and the service was spotty at best Thanks for the memories

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown location”
Reviews.Author: scubashe
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a work trip, great location, beautiful hotel - usual Fairmont elegance.

Reviews.Title: “Left feeling a bit tired...”
Reviews.Author: maritime_uke
Reviews.Content: We just finished a five night stay at the Hotel Vancouver. We were upgraded to a wheelchair accessible room which was perfect as we had an 18 month old traveling with us. The room was very nice and well maintained. The bed was very comfortable.
