Unfortunately, our room had many "mechanical" noises which kept us up at night, including the hammering sounds in pipes and some sort of valve opening and closing. We were awakened by these noises starting at about 5 am each day. There were also a few housekeeping issues including our toilet paper not being replenished despite speaking to the front desk about it twice. We did enjoy seeing Mavis and Beau. In general, the staff was very friendly. The dinner food at Griffins was terrible but breakfast was fine. The hotel was very well located and we were able to find good places to eat nearby.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful, elegant hotel, central and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Ryans72
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here several times before, and have always had a great experience. It is a Fairmont, and their hotels are very hard to beat. Extremely comfortable bed, lovely linens, comfortable room. It is a great central location, has a wonderful lounge where you can have afternoon tea, or drinks and light snacks. Two great restaurants, and lovely shops. A great hotel for a lovely Vancouver getaway. It's a little pricey, but has a great corporate rate if you can get it.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in a grand property”
Reviews.Author: DogJudge
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying here. Well located, classic hotel, plenty to see nearby, lots of dining options, quiet, comfortable and a great view. The staff could have been friendlier and more helpful, the partking fees were on the high side and there were too many Aussie tourists (OK only a problem because I am an Aussie) :-) The room was smallish but comfortable, I slept well. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Major Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Sabre823
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 nights at the Fairmont & were very disappointed overall. The Good- Mavis & Beau the 2 dogs at the Concierge desk that greet guests, the location is right in the middle of downtown, free umbrella for your use ( you will likely need it), front desk was efficient The Bad- bed was uncomfortable leaving us both with sore backs, bathroom has no space to set your toiletries and yet they could easily have a shelf for this, absolutely poor service in lounge, couldn't get service and once you did, trying to get a second order was just as difficult, drinks were very expensive, tried main restaurant, food okay, service was efficient. For a fairmont Hotel, this one doesn't measure up (unfortunately)

Reviews.Title: “Vancouver nostalgia, downtown”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryArchitect
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right in the heart of the city, close to the shopping, fine dining and the sea wall. The character is unique and the service is what you would expect at a higher price. The rooms are clean and the bedding is fresh, with all the amenities that you will basically require. We have stayed here every year for the past four or five and will keep returning.

Reviews.Title: “A fine experience”
Reviews.Author: digby40
Reviews.Content: Not our original booking, and more expensive than we had planned, but excellent quality. Didn't use the restaurant in the evening on either day but the breakfasts were excellent and the bar was too. Very well located and very nice rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Vancouver - Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: luluStjohns
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fairmont Vancouver during a conference in Sept. 2011 for 5 nights. Upon my early arrival, my booked room with King bed was not ready however I was immediately offered an upgrade to a Junior Suite with a queen bed. The suite consisted of two rooms with an archway between the two. The hotel itself is a throwback to the 40's. Very grand and elaborate, however, certain things are dated and border on worn out and tired looking. The furniture and curtains in the suite were very dated and the carpet had a worn out look to it. There was actually a very old tap that had been painted over that was sticking out of the wall in the sitting room! Bed very comfortable with crisp, new linens. You have to use your room card to use the elevator and there appeared to be a number of people unaware of this. A number of times, the card did not work and on one occasion both my room cards would not work in elevator or my room. Had to go to front desk to have cards re-set. There is a daily charge of $15.00 for internet, however as I was with a conference, it was built into the conference room rate. The Conciege service is excellent. All staff were very accommodating and helpful. Did notice the lighting in the room was not the best - only 3 lamps lighting the two rooms. There is a very nice modern fitness area which is very much up to date. Good location - close to all downtown areas - Waterfront, Canada Place Robson Street (shopping area), Pacifico shopping center & Gastown.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great staff, efficient and a touch of home”
Reviews.Author: Eff_Pea
Reviews.Content: A couple of weeks ago, I had the opportunity to stay at the older Fairmont establishment. While fully renovated, I personally love the old fashioned/historical feel of the hotel to the other 2 more modern Fairmonts in the area (Try the Fish and Chips in the lounge area of the Waterfront hotel, yummy! Best Ive ever had! The desserts are great too!). Apparently Queen Elizabeth the 2nd was at the opening of this hotel. Anyway, the staff was classy and helpful. The Concierge personnel are great! Really nice and friends and they take the time to really speak to you and not rush you off because some bozo is standing impatiently behind you peering in wanting his/her turn like NOW. They really add a personal touch to all of their interactions with guests no matter what room type they take or if they are on a govt rate as we were. Two precious dogs, Mavis and Beau, await you if you wish to pet, visit or walk them (their schedule is usually flexible :)) They are yellow lab/golden retrievers and are soooo cute and kind. Really well-behaved. Mavis gives you a paw to greet you and both can do tricks! Hehehe. Really nice dogs. Their owners are super nice as well! What is great about this is, if you miss your pet, you can have a bit of the comfort of having one while on vacation. The rooms were clean and perfectly spacious. We were in a double queen size room and then switched to a King Deluxe room due to adding an extra day and availability or some such. The King room was huge! Ha! The Queen room was a regular sized room and perfect. Tip: Use your card in the elevator to go up, especially at night. We werent told by the check in lady, so we looked pretty stupid haha. It happens to a lot of people though. Also, try the pool/hot tub after a long day on the town, it is really nice and usually not too busy. Finally, do call ahead to book High Tea reservations, you will be greeted and served by super friendly staff who allow you to take silly pictures of yourselves or just the food. Heheh. The sandwiches and scones were to DIE for and the Maple Maple tea? Just fabulous with sweetner and honey! I fully recomment this hotel for the above reasons and also for the location. Located on West Georgia and Burrard...and Burrard and Robinson (takes up a whole city block) you are close to the pier, Robson, Shopping center, Granville Street, Gastown, etc. It's simply perfect! Also, if you hav e a weakness for LV and Gucci, look no further than your lobby ;) PS We slept like babies, I loved duvet's! Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2traveles
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Hotel downtown Vancouver for two nights. I think my big complaint was that while we received a good rate, and it was my fault for not asking, the parking came to $43 CDN each day, blowing my budget. No one ever volunteers this information. We have stayed in all the Vancouver Fairmonts, as well as Chateau Whistler, and I can't say this is my favorite one. Loved the dogs in the lobby, Beau and Mavis, so cute! I even bought the stuffed version in the room; yes, they got me! I used the fitness facility, and it was just a short stroll to the Starbucks to get my coffee. Back to the fitness facility - the second morning, two women and a toddler were in there, the child was screaming and wandering about while they were semi-working out, and it was not good, not to mention dangers and a liability for the Fairmont. I reported it via phone, and a young girl stated she had no problem with this! (I have encountered several very young employees at Fairmonts with somewhat flippant attitudes). I then interrupted my workout and went to the concierge, (she takes Beau home at night--smile) who was very nice and did not like what she heard and stated she would ensure the manager was aware of this issue. Other than that, the hotel was okay. Fairmonts are generally quite good. Good location, comfortable bed. Great dogs!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Sydney-Sider50
Reviews.Content: This Fairmont is a grand hotel in the Fairmont tradition but well up to date with it's rooms and services. I don't know if all the twin rooms are as good as ours was, but ours was particularly spacious and comfortable. The only criticism I could make is that it would be good if there was a little more lighting. Arriving in the evening it is very hard to see inside one's suitcase and read anything necessary. I love the free Internet and wifi when you sign in as a Fairmont President Club member and anyone considering a stay at a Fairmont should sign up over the Internet or at the hotel on their arrival. It is free and fast. And of course the concierge service is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “wi-fi not free”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany S
Reviews.Content: I was surprised to find that the internet would cost me $15.62 per day to use. I would have booked somewhere else if I knew that in advance. I found it annoying that something I can get for free at a Motel 6 was going to be a pricey extra fee.

Reviews.Title: “An ageless favourite”
Reviews.Author: flamesfan24
Reviews.Content: This iconic hotel in the middle of downtown Vancouver has an ageless character that is a favourite of ours.. We will stay here 5-8 times a year and always marvel at the history laden property.. The property was renovated a couple of years ago, without disturbing the historical ambiance. One of the main draws for us is the staff, beginning with the reservations team, to the outstanding doormen, onto the check in desk, and onto the housekeeping, dining, and lounge staff. The majority of them have been with the property for a number of years and continue to provide top rate professional service. We enjoy the lounge, for either a single drink or for a meal and a drink. A great place to relax and enjoy the evening music. Griffins restaurant is also a great place to eat with fresh local food and top notch chefs. The hotel is not as upscale as the other Vancouver Fairmont hotels but it does have the pluses of great service, great staff, central location, and well maintained rooms.

Reviews.Title: “some issues”
Reviews.Author: Morty4
Reviews.Content: We reserved 4 rooms over 3 months in advance. We travelled with our children and extended family. I had requested connecting rooms for two pairs of rooms since there were 6 children in total travelling with us. when i checked in i was told the two pairs of rooms were connecting, unfortunatly neither pair of rooms connected. In one case the rooms were not even next to eachother. Another issue was the breakfast. We had a package that allowed for 2 people in each room to have breakfast included. We were given a card on checkin for 2 for breakfast .This card was to be presented at the restaurant. One morning my husband and i wanted to eat at different times as we were both going on different outings. The waiter in the restaurant told us that we both needed to be present at the same time in order to use the voucher and I was charged $31 for breakfast. We were able to straighten this out in the end but this was very inconvient . I recommened if you do have the breakfast package to check into this. finally, the check in was quite difficult. There were many people checking in at once and only one person on the desk. this is a large hotel and i found this to be extremely frustrating. it was almost like checking in at the airport as well we are presidents clud member and have been at many fairmonts, the service here was quite poor. on a good note the location is fantastic the rooms are dated but lovely and clean the hotel has held up well over time and is really quite beautiful the price was good ..if you can get in at a good rate i would recommend staying however if the rates are high..don't bother

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: travelling_Doodle
Reviews.Content: This is a very large hotel in the heart of the action, directly beside the art gallery. The rooms were large but a little dated. Surprisingly, these rooms were not even equipped with personal safes, which was somewhat inconvenient. The front desk clerk was inexperienced and assigned us to adjoining rooms that didnt adjoin. She had forgotten the vouchers for breakfast (which were a problem anyway because the whole family wanted to eat breakfast at different times). On the whole the value was great and as long as Fairmont keeps the prices low for this hotel, I will look at it again for my next trip to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Fairmont...”
Reviews.Author: BigTipper
Reviews.Content: I’ve stayed at the Fairmont Hotel Vancouver a few times before (as well as other Fairmont locations). Not a huge fan of the rooms at the old Fairmont locations, including this one. The rooms are ok, but the small, dated bathrooms don’t hold any charm for me. I’m more a fan of the large, modern bathrooms you’ll find at the Fairmont Pacific Rim, and the Westin Wall Centre. Other than this, the hotel has great service, due to great staff. I asked for the parking and room to be invoiced separately, which they seemed to do, but the charges ended coming as one, on my credit card invoice. This presents challenges for our company expense procedures, so that was a little hiccup I would have liked to avoid, but overall the hotel handled everything else great. I’ve had business dinners, some conferences, etc. at this hotel, and the staff always do everything they can to make a great experience. As I travel a fair bit, I enjoy hotels that have their own dog, in the hotel lobby. The Hotel Vancouver is one of these locations. It helps me miss my own dogs a little less. I never have time to take their dog out for a walk, but I always have time for a quick “Hello” and a pat on the head. Restaurants and bars are all very good, albeit a tad on the expensive side, but not more so than other downtown Vancouver hotels. I get a great corporate rate here, so when I have an event at this hotel, or nearby, I tend to stay here. There are a few other downtown hotels I prefer, but definitely not disappointed in the Hotel Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - services like Internet and Room Service are really expensive”
Reviews.Author: Paul M
Reviews.Content: I was in Vancouver the last week of August on business for the entire week. The corporation that I was doing work for recommended The Fairmont given their corporate rate ($145/night) with the hotel and proximity to their office. The service from the staff was everything you would expect from a Fairmont Hotel. My room was spacious with an extremely comfortable king bed - turndown service offered every evening also. The concerns that I had are with the internet and room service. Regarding the internet, they actually charge for this service! For a "premium" connection it is $25 per 24 hours - yes, $25 per 24 hours connected....I found out afterwards that if you become a Fairmont member internet access is free. However, I was there 7 nights and had to pay $175 to use the internet in the room - absolutely ridiculous as far as I am concerned... The room service prices are just as ridiculous. $38 for a club house and diet coke; $30 for spaghetti in meat sauce and a diet coke; the club house was a good size however the spaghetti portion was really small. Really nice hotel, however you'll need a 2nd job to afford to eat and work in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Lived like a Queen for a great price”
Reviews.Author: Julia K
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Hotel Vancouver is historic and the ultimate luxury hotel in Vancouver! It is absolutely gorgeous as soon as you step on it's streets. I went with 1 friend - we got a 2 bedroom through http://vancouverhorizons.com - they gave us a wonderful package that included spa amenities, golf and more. I highly recommend eating at Griffins hotel inside the Fairmont at least once - especially for a late dinner and then walking around the city. I also recommend experiencing the luxury tea and treats at the Fairmont. Nearby on Hornby street enjoy the Art Gallery, several Italian cafes - Cafe Artigiano is the best. I was stuck in there all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Faded elegance?”
Reviews.Author: robpoole1
Reviews.Content: Staff and service is generally friendly, though not always helpful. Rooms, ours on the 7th floor, was old and needed upgrading urgently. The carpets made for uneasy barefoot walking, brown in colour and look mid 20th Century in date. The shower, over the bath, dates from the same time, trickles water, I didn't fancy sitting in the bath itself. The mattress in our bed was half collapsed from years of use, creaked and kept us awake all on its own. Lucky we got a discounted rate but still feel cheated.

Reviews.Title: “Our first experience of the Fairmont brand which was fantastic”
Reviews.Author: OzTrav1
Reviews.Content: We arrived very late after airline connections from LA to Vancouver did not work out and were a bit stressed by the time we got to the Fairmont. The reception staff and concierge were very sympathic and got us to our room very qiuckly and even though we were ready for bed, the room was a great haven with its king size bed and all the fantastic trimmings that the room had. This was a great start to our futrue stays at the other Fairmont hotels during our trip

Reviews.Title: “How can a bottle of water cost like 2 gallons of gasoline?”
Reviews.Author: moressi
Reviews.Content: Good hotel and professional staff. Rooms and decor show signs of time but are still acceptable and clean. The downside is definitely the price, both for the room and for the services they offer. Spent approximately 330$ per night without breakfast, which they offer for about 30 dollars per guest. Don't be surprised though, because they charge an outrageous 8$ for a bottle of water if you inadvertently choose to drink it !!!

Reviews.Title: “nice but not much included”
Reviews.Author: LCNtraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night as a treat. Check-in was efficient and polite, rather than warm and friendly. My “Fairmont Gallery room” looked out onto the Vancouver Art Gallery across the street. Room was comfortable though not large. (The cost of the room shown on the back of the door was a ludicrous $2,010 per night! It’s really more like $358.) Nice, soft sheets on the king-size bed. Nice flat-screen TV. The bar fridge and goodies tray charge your bill automatically if you so much as move any item. So you can’t use the fridge for your own things. A bottle of water costs $8! The only complimentary things were the makings for three cups of coffee and a few tea bags. Silly single-cup coffee-maker. Dusting is needed: the bottle of red wine in the cupboard, the desk top, the TV remote, furniture, etc., were dusty. Industrial-style toilet. No local phone book in the room. No microwave. No free internet. The concierge desk has local maps and $1-off coupons for the Art Gallery.

Reviews.Title: “Very beautiful old hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: TOwriter
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at this hotel, which is well-located within walking distance of downtown shopping, restaurants, the art gallery, and the beautiful Vancouver waterfront. Like the other old CP hotels in the Fairmont chain, this one is very elegant and beautiful. The rooms are not large but they are very nicely appointed and decorated and extremely comfortable - also very clean. Our room had a huge walk-in closet and windows that open to let in some fresh air. And two lovable dogs take turns greeting guests at the concierge desk - a nice "homey" touch in a big hotel. The staff were also friendly and helpful. While we stayed at the hotel as part of a tour, I would not hesitate to choose it again the the future.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it!”
Reviews.Author: 1frequentflyer
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Hotel Vancouver after a very long day's drive from Banff and were pleasantly surprised to find that we had been randomly selected to be upgraded to a suite on the Gold Floor! What a beautiful suite! We were met with a very comfy king sized bed, the most comfortable pillows, a good sized bathroom and a living room, separated from the bedroom by 2 sets of double french doors. The Pillow Concierge allowed us to select our preferred kind of pillow from a selection of about 7 or so - nice touch. The complimentary breakfast was superb as always on the Gold Floor and the evening h'ordeurves were delicious, crab legs, shrimp, oysters etc. Our gold floor concierges were extremely helpful and friendly. We dined at Griffins on the Lobby Level and had perhaps the best meal of our 10 day road trip. The server was one of the best we have ever encountered, unfortunately we did not get his name! Top notch service from start to end and amazing food! The valet service was extremely fast and efficient, we appreciated not waiting around for our vehicle! The location of this hotel is perfect, just one block from Robson St. Shopping area, featuring premiere stores and restaurants blocks and blocks long! Also walking distance to Gastown, Yaletown, Chinatown, Granville Island Ferry and more! You will not regret choosing this hotel and we will definitely return again!

Reviews.Title: “Vancouver's Grande Dame was Grand!”
Reviews.Author: alphabetkid
Reviews.Content: Though I'd been to, and in, the Hotel Vancouver before (in fact, my high school grad party was held there), I'd never stayed there. We weren't disappointed: we had a lovely room on the 12th floor with a high ceiling and plenty of space, as well as a window looking west over Robson Street and even as far as English Bay. Our four-night stay was very pleasant, and you can't beat the location -- convenient to everything both downtown and elsewhere, as it's very close to both Skytrain routes. Room amenities included iron, hair dryer, robes, minibar (fee), and coffee/tea (no fee). I really liked the secure feeling I got in the hotel: we had to scan our room key to use the elevator, all times of day and night. We requested a quiet room on a high floor when we reserved, and hypoallergenic pillows, and got exactly what we wanted: kudos to Fairmont, and the President's Club. Service at the front desk and the restaurant was excellent; the only employee who didn't smile at us was the resident dog, who was sacked out after a long walk. (Perhaps we should have offered him treats...) Would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “very good location”
Reviews.Author: LondonColombo
Reviews.Content: Had a nice stay, large rooms, very good breakfast, wifi is very expensive. Rooms look tired and need a refurbishment. Concierge need more staff as we had to wait there far too long each time to get some informations. Loved the two dogs.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: NumberEleven11
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a 5 day family vacation. We typically stay more modern hotels, but this is the classic grand old hotel and we really enjoyed ourselves. We stayed in a suite which had loads of room and worked well for our two kids with a separate bedroom, the pull out sofa and a cot. Service was great, hotel was great, and location was great. As you would expect in this hotel, the concierge was very helpful. It was my wife's 40th birthday and they helped order a perfect flower arrangement. The hotel is in walking distance of everything we wanted to see and do.

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Old Lady of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GoFlyNZ
Reviews.Content: There are fantastically appointed hotel rooms here and some very good ones too and a lot in between. This hotel is from a different time, so be prepared for lots of history, and genteel-ness about the whole place, and soak it up.... This ranks up there for me with another grand old dame the Moana Surfrider in Honolulu. I have stayed here for business 4 times in the last 13 months and have enjoyed my stay every time. Sometimes the front desk can be a little abrupt, but always polite, even if it is not the answer you wish to hear .... Griffins restaurant is extremely well priced for a hotel of this calibre, and high tea at $36 is one of the cheaper ones around, and so much to eat!!! David on the concierge desk is the most helpful and knowledgeable person I have ever come into contact with in 15 years of staying in hotels worldwide every 2nd week. Nothing is too much of a problem, he knows EVERYTHING or so it seems, and is always happy. This man is worth his weight if you are new to Vancouver, or only have a short period of time to enjoy here. Only downside is you pay for the internet here, unless you join the Fairmont Presidents Club (which is free) and then it is complimentary wireless throughout.

Reviews.Title: “Only place to stay in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Candonjan
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Vancouver is one of my favourite hotels in the world. The combination of character, comfort, service and location in the exciting heart of Vancouver is hard to beat. There are more luxurious hotels in Vancouver, but few with the same sense of history and elegance. Nicely added pool and workout facility. Fairmont seems to be able to have created a genuine culture of caring, pride and ownership, and at the HV, this comes together in a lovely hotel that is a pleasure to stay at whether on business or for fun. Oh, yeah. Now with the new airport Skytrain link, you are a short walk to the downtown station and then 28 minutes to the airport. Amazingly convenient and inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but a tad stuffy”
Reviews.Author: MrTrig
Reviews.Content: You simply can not beat the location of this downtown hotel. We did have some trouble with a breakfast not arriving for 45 minutes but they took care of it OK. Some attitude with children spoeaking at Concierge and generally ot being respected as guests. Will definately try one of the other 2 Fairmonths in Vancouver next time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderul Staff, Grand old hotel, especially our room”
Reviews.Author: MMSANDFCS
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an extended stay at The Fairmont Hotel Vancouver. Pros: - Debbie and David at the concierges desk were wonderful and booked us great adventures. - Nathan and Mary in the 900 West Lounge gave us outstanding service, Nathan got us food when we were starving and the kitchen was already closed. - The welcome committee, two Goldens, were sweet and friendly. -The food was outstanding in both the lounge and resaurant as well as at our conference luncheons and coffee breaks. - Great location, close to the Canada Line train to the airport, shopping, and everything downtown. Cons: - Very expensive hotel for the small hotel room provided, $41 added to each day in taxes. - Our room had very dirty carpet with old furnishings. - Our room had a folding table with items for sale on sensors so you would be charged if items were removed, one was even a cheesy stuffed animal that we couldn't help but knock over because our luggage rack was right next to the table, ugh! - The bathroom was very dated, while on the commode you can lean on the sink to relax because the bathroom is so small. There is nowhere to put anything except on a wabbly shelf behind the door so when you have your robe or towels hanging on the door it knocks everything off the shelf. - It took 5-10 minutes to get hot water, we took showers luke warm and got scalded when the water finally did get hot. - Fifth floor hallway was also dirty and smelled like sewage or garbage. - Elevator lighted arrows on the floors were burned out so when an elevator did arrive you had to run to catch the door if you were lucky. - Upon arrival our room was not ready at check in time, we had to wait two hours which we were given some comp food and drinks for but we really wanted to get to our room after a long day of traveling. - Bring your own computer, if you want to pay $15+ a day for internet in your room and it costs to use the internet in the business office too. Printers were out of order to print boarding passes, ink empty. - Bathrooms on the conference floor were in need of attention every time I used them.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: MaNg1314
Reviews.Content: I was in Vancouver for a cousin's wedding and stayed at the Fairmont. The location of this hotel was fantastic, but I was dissapointed in the lack of upkeep in the room. When we first checked in, one of the beds was stained with dried blood which we immediately had housekeeping come in to change. Not a good impression on such a famous hotel. Second, I paid the correct amount for the hotel room, however I was charged an extra $800 on top of what I was suppose to pay on my credit card. It took forever to get someone to straighten it out and I was once again dissapointed with the lack of service and care the staff gave me. Apparently, there was a glitch in the system and for some unknown reason the hotel charged me - doesn't make it sound very safe does it? The hotel didn't even apologize for the stress it caused as that dipped into my spending money and the headache to figure out what went on.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel in Canada”
Reviews.Author: GerryMal
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel on a regular basis for the last five years. it has become a home from home and the staff on the gold floor are like a second family. Nothing is too much trouble and their understanding of being a hotelier is outstanding. I was stranded here during the ash cloud disruption last year and the hotel offered a discount because we had not anticipated such a long stay. This hotel is well worth a visit - service, location and cosseting!

Reviews.Title: “A piece of History - conveniently located downtown”
Reviews.Author: Tessa-is-Black
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located in the downtown business area... only a short walk to the harbour and the seawall walking trail. This hotel has been around for quite some time but still is a gem! The room is clean, the beds are comfy and the interior is posh!

Reviews.Title: “Classic”
Reviews.Author: fletch250
Reviews.Content: A beautiful grand hotel in a prime location in downtown Vancouver. We stayed on the Gold Floor which includes a private lounge, breakfast, canapes in the evening and more. Everything served was delicious. Service was very good on all levels. The room was nice but the bathroom for this level could be a little bigger and a bit more updated. Overall the room was nice and the bed was comfortable. Not an inexpensive hotel but no Fairmont is. We would and will likely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Location, Great service, poor soundproofing?”
Reviews.Author: slbe
Reviews.Content: you really can't beat the location. Staff were extremely helpful. Concierge in particular went out of her way. But guests in the next room had brought two dogs which were left alone and barked, and barked both thru the afternoon and evening. Hotel staff did respond and quiet the dogs. But given we heard when the guests returned (at 1 am) with loud conversations, i do think there may also be some issue with soundproofing of the rooms. One rough night but overall a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with our choice”
Reviews.Author: FreemoFun
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Fairmont Hotel Vancouver for 2 days prior and 2 days at the end of a Rocky Mountains bus trip.We were very impressed. Our rooms were very pleasant, unfortuneately on our 2nd visit the people in the room next door were very noisey. We rang the night staff who delt with it immediately and the noise stopped. All the staff we spoke to were very professional and helpful particularly the concierge staff who went out of their way to make phone calls, find the right bus to catch, recommend restaurants etc. Breakfast was included in our package, an extensive selection, very nice. Dinner in the hotel restaurant was also delicious, prime rib just melted in our mouths. This hotel was a highlight of our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: jenlikesmexico
Reviews.Content: We love staying at the Fairmont Hotel Vancouver. The location can't be beat, the lounge is fabulous and the staff is very accommodating. The concierge helped us with both babysitting services and car rentals, both were flawless. Our room was perfect, a beautiful one-bedroom suite - until the first night some rude guest decided to smoke a cigar on our non-smoking floor. The front desk found us another room at 4am (the smell was so awful and strong that it actually woke us up in the middle of the night) and moved us and our small child no questions asked. Considering the smoke was no fault of their own they did whatever they could to make it up to us. We REALLY appreciated everything they did. Would stay here again - although we are also keen to try the new Fairmont Pacific Rim!! A great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Dogs Worth gold!”
Reviews.Author: Travelgems_10
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at this hotel and it was super wonderful. The bedroom was clean, tidy and very comfortable. The beds were soft, but acidentally the lady who cleaned our room sent our fom pillow to the laundry room with the linen and they couldn't find it!!! The breakfast was amazing,very plentiful and there was food to cater to everyone's needs, you could also ask for room service which was elegantly presented and delicious! There were a couple of very fancy stores in the hotel lobby. But for me, walking Beau and watching Mavis step into Louis Vuitton when she was tired of talking to the guests make my stay at this hotel an unique experience!

Reviews.Title: “Grand looking but noisy”
Reviews.Author: 2wheeltraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel as part of the Rocky Mountaineer Train package. The hotel looks very grand and opulent but if you are looking for a nice quiet room to get some sleep this is not the place. The room we had was nice but all night we could hear the family next door and the traffic on the street. As the hotel is old I assume the sound proofing is very inadequate and is in desperate need of upgrading. Beds not too comfortable either - too soft for my liking and seem a bit worn. Overall disappointing for the price

Reviews.Title: “Still my favourite place to stay in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: imabcqt
Reviews.Content: I like to think that I am pretty attentive to reviewing places that I've stayed at, but I've stayed at the Fairmont Hotel Vancouver *more* than my fair share this year and have been neglectful in my reviewing duties because it's never disappointed me. My most recent stay at the Fairmont Hotel Vancouver was on July 10th, 2011 as I was in town on business and needed a great stay. I stayed in Room 1253, I paid for a Fairmont Room but it seemed larger than most Fairmont Rooms I've stayed in. The room has undergone the recent renovations they are going through with lovely colour choices (Royal Purple, Gold and Creams and Whites) which brings it to Classic Modern Elegance. I pulled up late in the evening, valeted my vehicle and did curbside check-in (which I love of course). Upon arrival I was presented with a coupon for 15% dining or 25% off in Room Dining and it was as if they had read my mind. I freshed up a bit and then ordered a simple Prime Rib Burger and Gingerale from the In Room Dining Menu. The gentleman that took my order said it would be up in 30 minutes, at 9:30PM. As if by clockwork at 9:30 there was a knock at my door with a delightful girl with my dinner waiting. Now it could have been that I had an exhausting day and it was getting late, but I swear that was the best burger I have ever had. The spiced fries were very nice as well. With food in my stomach I closed the drapes on the two large windows in the room and crawled into my comfortable bed for the night. Fairmont Hotel Vancouver, you have never disappointed me or not exceeded my expectations. Your staff are always fantastic and professional and you always seem to anticipate my needs. Thank you - I'm warning you; I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: KJGator
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend in May. Very pleasantly surprised that the room was updated and modern even though this is a old hotel. Extremely nice bathroom. Very comfortable bed. Excellent location for dining and getting around city. Excellent view from room. Would definitely stay here again. We saw the dogs in the lobby but did not get the chance to walk one on this trip. But, they were adorable. Parking was pricey but this is the norm for Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel in Great location”
Reviews.Author: GordonA
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Vancouver hotel is a 'grand' building situated in the centre of downtown Vancouver. Like a number of Fairmont hotels it is an ex-CPR hotel built during the railway era with acertain amount of opulence. Entering the hotel, it has an expansive lobby with upmarket shopping stores on site. We found the staff on reception helpful and welcoming. The time and date of our arrival coincided with a Stanley Cup hockey game so hotel and bar area were noisy and crowded. We were given a room on the 11th floor with views over a section of downtown. The room was a good size although the bathroom was on the small side. We found the concierge helpful in booking trips and in detailing how to use the skytrain and bus network which is excellent. The breakfast was exactly as experienced in our stay in the Fairmont Empress, Victoria, excellent, with a choice of buffet or a la carte. The dining room offered dinner at 50% off the a la carte menu before 6pm and a fixed price table d'hote menu for $23. We had dinner on two occasions during our weeks stay, but dined out otherwise in the vast choice of restaurants in the vicinity. In conclusion, if you are looking for a hotel with excellent service, and offering something different from modern concrete towers, then the Fairmont Vancouver is certainly worth considering. If we return to Vancouver on holiday we would certainly stay in the Fairmont Vancouver hotel again, but ensure it did not coincide with the end of the ice hockey season after experiencing the riots and chaos resulting from the final game of the Stanley Cup.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms but a little overpriced for what you get.”
Reviews.Author: travellots61
Reviews.Content: I travel often for both business and pleasure. I stayed a night in early July. I am a President's Club member and was supposed to get a high floor but ended up with a low floor. Not a big deal as the room was the same but they should give you what you have booked. Anyhow, the guy at check in was efficient and friendly. The room is very large (suite room) and has a nice large bedroom. The bathroom is nice but kind of small. Their beds are not very good. Too soft and I would imagine getting a little old. I would expect a much nicer bed in a $300/night room. Next time I will return to the River Rock Resort and Casino across the river in nearby Richmond. It costs about $100/night less and has a casino, nicer rooms and their beds are the best! My overall judgement of a hotel is always about the bed as it is the most important piece of furniture in the room and you have the room to eventually sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Fairmont Excellence”
Reviews.Author: Craig1963
Reviews.Content: A week-long business trip to Vancouver had me stay at the Fairmont Hotel Vancouver, located right downtown in the heart of the city. Check-in was very quick and easy, and I was in the room within just a few minutes of arriving. The room, with a wonderful west view, was larger than expected. I appreciated the very fast wireless internet and the extremely comfortable king bed, with Egyptian cotton bedding. The bathroom appeared to have been recently renovated, for it was absolutely, utterly spotless, with what appeared to be all-new fixtures and a new granite counter. Towels were abundant and very plush. Turn-down service each night came as an unexpected surprise. A number of Fairmont properties have dogs on site, serving as hotel ambassadors, and this includes the Fairmont Hotel Vancouver. Although I did not take advantage of the opportunity to take Beau (a very sweet and friendly yellow lab) out for walks, I did enjoy being greeted by her on many afternoons. What a wonderful touch. The Hotel Vancouver is a very large, turn-of-the-century building and (I believe) a former CP Rail hotel. It looks completely grand and majestic from the street, yet feels new and fresh inside. It is an extremely well maintained property, and the staff excellent. This was not my first stay at the Fairmont Hotel Vancouver, nor will it be my last. Great hotel that could not be better located.

Reviews.Title: “A grand old hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yago1
Reviews.Content: A great hotel that's not afraid to charge. Pricey but very nice. The best location in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Julia072
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 days and really enjoyed our stay. The best part of the hotel is its location. When making our booking, we had requested for a newly renovated room and were happy with it. We had our breakfast every day at Caffe Artigiano which is close to the hotel. Relaxed ambience and nice coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Just LOVE Fairmount Hotels”
Reviews.Author: SusanneSchmidt
Reviews.Content: Terrific luxury hotel with great & super-friendly service plus in my favorite city - hard to beat!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Dowtown Location”
Reviews.Author: Honestray
Reviews.Content: I was doing research work and needed access to the Vancouver Central Public Library. Hotel Vancouver is walking distance to the library, so this was perfect for me. My room was on the smaller side; however the furniture was very classy and luxurious. Room very clean. Staff was very friendly. I noticed from my window that the hotel had many gargoyles. This was fascinating. I will return.

Reviews.Title: “A good place, but looks its age”
Reviews.Author: MRei
Reviews.Content: This is one of the more 'stately' hotels in Vancouver. I've been booked in many Vancouver hotels for work, and was quite excited that I was booked here. The rooms were large and the front desk staff were good, but I wasn't really impressed with the cleanliness or state of the rooms. The cleaning staff did a good job on the bed and bathroom; but the old-style wall sconces were caked with dust and I had a burnt out lightbulb in the dressing area for the whole week I stayed there. The carpets are worn and in need of replacing. I did appreciate the heaviness of the curtains and found my room to be quiet, and the location (close to Canada line) can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: Trudyrand
Reviews.Content: We choose the Fairmont because of it's character and good location; it has both. The manager was more than helpful when we needed a suitcase repair and a staff member (whose name I failed to get) was able to fix it. The concierge staff was helpful, especially Emiko. But housekeeping did not come until almost 4:00 to clean our room (after we had returned from a busy day and were just about to rest and shower.) The drink prices were more New York City which wouldn't have bothered us so much but the drinks were very skimping to boot! With a large number of first class hotels in Vancouver, we will stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Dated but nice”
Reviews.Author: fijihiji
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference in Vancouver and chose the Fairmont Hotel Vancouver due to its proximity to the Convention Centre. The hotel is pricey but dated and the walls are fairly thin - you can hear your neighbors talking quite clearly in some rooms. I got the Convention Centre rate which meant internet access in the room was not free and breakfast was not included. Still, the rooms were clean and large, the staff very friendly and it seemed to be a nice and safe neighborhood with a lot of convenient shops nearby. There is a McDonald's right across the street and the Pacific Centre Mall is pricey but close to the hotel too.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: MumnKeiki
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Vancouver for business June 1-6, 2011 and stayed at the Fairmont Hotel in downtown Vancouver. The room was spaceous, impecably clean and quiet. I got such a great night's sleep on the comfortable king sized bed with crisp linens. The consierge was helpful on a daily basis with walking maps and suggestions for great meals. The hotel is located in the ritzy part of town, with trendy and high fashion shops close by. The mascot dogs in the lobby (Mavis and Beau) are adorable and on loan for anyone wishing to take them on a walk. Bicycle rentals are in nearby Coal Harbor and many streets have designated bike paths. We rode to Stanly Park, one of the world's largest parks. It was an easy ride around the park with great views. I would recommend the Fairmont Hotel for anyone seeking a high end hotel with all amenities and conveniences nearby.

Reviews.Title: “It was fabulous. Very friendly staff. They even have a dog available to take on a walk.”
Reviews.Author: alugirl1947
Reviews.Content: Perfect centralized location. for walking. Close to the Sky Train.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: PatUNC
Reviews.Content: It is close to everything, 3 blocks from Canada Welcome Center, 2 blocks from Robson Street, 2 blocks from Granville St. Perfect location! A 45 min walk to Granville Island, if you like walking like me, Gastown about 10 minutes away. Everything is really close. Friendly staff and the dogs, Beau and Mavis made me feel home, I missed my dog. Thanks everyone! I even took public transportation to Vancouver Island, first metro, then bus and ferry and again bus, all doable for less than 20 $ ! skip the expensive tour operators.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Hotel is slightly dated.”
Reviews.Author: marc_natalie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is smack downtown, near some great restaurants and the waterfront. Only issue is the dated room - yes it has character, but mould in your bathroom should not be happening in a Fairmont. Unfortunately, we left too early in the morning to try any of the amenities. Locals mentioned that the spa in the hotel is one of the best in town.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Old Lady”
Reviews.Author: RaySF84
Reviews.Content: This is a grand old hotel that has been kept up very nicely. Rooms have period furniture that is in good shape. Bed was very comfortable. Bathroom had been recently renovated. Good service. This is not a hotel for people looking for a party and who like modern glass and steel buildings. Great wifi. One of the best wifi systems I have seen in a hotel. Only strange thing that happened is at 6:00 PM the day before our departure we were in our room about to leave for dinner when someone from housekeeping came in and said she was there to make up the room (had already been serviced) because we had checked out. She showed up a list of vacant rooms. I called the front desk and they agreed we were not checking out until the next morning. Wonder what would have happened if we had not been there? Would we have returned from dinner to find out belongings gone and someone else in the room?

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest Staff - very helpful!”
Reviews.Author: ljcomp
Reviews.Content: We extended our vacation with another couple after cruising to Vancouver and loved staying at this Fairmont. Debbie, the concierge, was most helpful and we loved seeing the two resident dogs - Mavis and Beau. Rooms were spacious and Tyler, who brought up our bags, went out of his way to help us with recommendations on where to eat. We ran into him a couple of times in the lobby and he always gave us suggestions which were all excellent. Great location in downtown and charming atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest Staff”
Reviews.Author: 5489katie
Reviews.Content: As a Fairmont Club Member I have stayed at this hotel chain all over North America. The Hotel Vancouver is not only special in regards to historic value but has the friendliest, courteous staff I have ever experienced. I have many options in Vancouver but always choose this hotel. The rooms are very spacious and comfortable and the hotel is situated close to shopping, art galleries and beautiful walking trails along the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Very gracious hotel with TWO dogs!”
Reviews.Author: ksween
Reviews.Content: We normally do not stay at more luxery hotels but this location and a specialer rate were to good to pass on. We received an upgrade to a corner room on the 12th floor with a grand view and it haqppened to be the 10k sun run weekend. What a sight. Wonderful bar and bar menu. A little pricey but decant portions. As hockey fans it was cool to be in that city. Many snack and dining spots nearby. Good for walking and people watching. Then there were the dogs; Beau and Mavis. If you have pets traveling without them is hard. Their wagging tails were a daily welcome sight.

Reviews.Title: “not sure it's worth the money”
Reviews.Author: parisvoyagista
Reviews.Content: For $200+ a night, I'm not sure this hotel cuts the mustard. Our room was understocked and way too warm (you could only lower the temp. to 65, which is plenty cool. But it never got down to 65 in there). Internet connect was $16/day extra, which is ridiculous. And at one point during our stay, I got off the elevator on the 2nd floor and instantly started choking/gagging. Turns out, the area had been maced! When I told the front desk person, she was decidedly nonplussed (a woman who has clearly never been maced). I didn't expect anything more than a little concern and perhaps a promise to get that area cleared out asap. But all I got was, "Oh yeah, I heard that had happened." I don't know... it wasn't a horrible stay, not by any means. And in fact, the concierges were fantastic. But for that kind of money, you expect a little more. I won't go back. Next time, I'll try the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with a rich history, a great spot in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: williamsc29
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Vancouver is a classic old hotel that is rich in history. I had an outstanding stay there recently and would highly recommend it for a businesss or leisure trip. Great staff and beautiful building make for a great combo. Like many hotels, the doors open and shut very loudly in the hallways, so you might have a little trouble sleeping in if you hope to do that. Otherwise, an excellent spot.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service - on all levels”
Reviews.Author: CaptainCanada1
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for a conference this last february. Due to a back condition I take my own pillow with me for these trips. Unfortunately, I left my pillow behind after checking out and didn't notice until I returned home in Victoria. We contacted the hotel and they found the pillow and were to ship it out to our address but after several weeks it never arrived. During this time I was sent a survey asking how my trip was. I explained about the pillow section and within minutes received an email back from the Director of Housekeeping (Paul Kingsbury) informing me that if my pillow did not arrive soon they would send a new pillow out at their expense. They sent a very luxurious Xanadu pillow shortly after. Talk about great customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bostarch
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Fairmont. Its central location was perfect for sightseeing, restaurants, and walking tours. The staff was friendly and helpful and the food was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Grandeur”
Reviews.Author: Bluechip78
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights while in Vancouver, the hotel is centrally located close to all downtown areas in a landmark location. I have to say i was a little disappointed overall though im finding it hard to justify to myself why this is the case, Perhaps i had excessive expectations given the reputation of the Fairmont. The reception and lobby areas are well maintained and portray the grandeur of the hotel. The rooms were a slightly dated but were clean and comfortable and maintained in the overall style of the hotel. The staff were friendly and professional, though i found their demeanor very business like as opposed to some hotels where you can feel genuine friendliness in the staff. The only real complaint i have is that there was filming going on in the lounge on our second evening and we normally returned for a drink before bed. The manager in charge was pleasant but pushy and wasn't keen on letting us in until the director came over and said it was okay that they weren't ready yet . The whole issue could have been avoided if we were informed on check in that the filming would be going on and the bar closed on that night and we could have made alternative arrangements. Overall it's a decent hotel and if you are getting a good deal on the room then it's worth a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice average hotel but outdated rooms”
Reviews.Author: casamoir
Reviews.Content: Just an OK hotel. Rooms were comfortable but on the smaller side and in need of an update. The walls were thin and I could hear everything in the room next door. Check-in and check-out were a bit slow.

Reviews.Title: “The Fairmont was great!”
Reviews.Author: tgctravels
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located and in walking distance to Gastown, the waterfront, the ferry to visit Granville Island and the bar scene. The rooms are bit dated, specifically the bathrooms which have only one sink and little shelving- a little odd for a hotel of this caliber- but it does fit with its regal image. The beds are simply magnificent, the best night of sleep I've had in ages. The concierge was most helpful, they provided good recommendations for dining and we took Mavis out for a walk. The pool was a bit dirty, could use a cleaning, however it was in a nice solarium filled with natural light. The hotel had a great jazz singer in the lounge and there was a handsome group of college students from Cornell University performing a cappella during our stay- very enjoyable diversions.

Reviews.Title: “Big Disappointment - Bad service, poor rooms, and not the usual Fairmont touch”
Reviews.Author: BC-Reviewer
Reviews.Content: We had a two night stay at the Fairmont Vancouver in early December. Both my partner and I are President's Club members, regularly staying in Fairmont hotels and staying in Vancouver in general for business. This stay was a huge disappointment, and we both vowed never to stay in this location again (instead we will stick to our usual first choice location at the Waterfront, or the new Pacific Rim which is a great place). The room was incredibly hot and stuffy, even when we set the temperature to low, and tried opening the window: unfortunately the windows have been 'locked' to only open a few inches (apparently the hotel said this is to stop people throwing things out the window?). In the morning we called to complain and were told that the thermostat didn't actually work, as the hotel has an old heating system and can only be set overall to either hot or cold - not set on an individual room basis. Consequently, we got virtually no sleep either night. Whilst the hotel did provide a fan (ineffective) they had no other suggestions and did not provide complimentary water. On Saturday night we called and asked to use the complimentary (for President's Club members) car shuttle: after 5 minutes the concierge called us back to say that while they had a car available for that purpose and it was a service they should offer, they didn't have anyone with a valid driving license available to drive us, adding that this was a common issue and they rarely had anyone with a driving license. He instead told us to get a taxi - which is what we had to do. Finally, when we checked out on Sunday (which we looked forward to doing) we were told that we should have asked and they would have moved us to a different room: not helpful as when we asked after the first night they said there was no point in moving as the whole hotel was on the same heating system. Overall, the facilities and moreover the staff were very disappointing and did not live up to the Fairmont standard.

Reviews.Title: “Faded glory but friendly staff in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Londoner303
Reviews.Content: Having recently spent a combined 6 nights at the hotel one is left with two lasting impressions. The first is of a hotel that is showing its age and the second of a very helpful and friendly set of staff. Unfortunately for the hotel the efforts of the latter cannot wholly compensate for the former. There is also a feeling that the hotel may be a little short of cash (??) as the interiors and rooms are in need of refurbishment and the standard rooms are still not equipped with any form of in room safe leaving you to need to deposit any valuables in the safety deposit boxes behind the reception (for which woe betide you lose the key as the replacement will set you back $200!) The feeling of the hotel working with less than optimal staffing is also suggested by the fact that on two separate arrivals and departures we only spied a member of the bell desk on one occasion. The plus side is that you save the tips but the downside is lugging your bags what can be a considerable distance to the room. So what stands out from the trip is 1) A good looking facade to the hotel and some character within. Decent sized rooms but very rudimentary/small bathrooms. 2) Good downtown location (especially for shoppers) 3) Friendly and efficient staff 4) A very average breakfast (there are cheaper and better cafes/restaurants nearby) 5) Expensive internet The overall experience was not a bad one but neither was it anything better than average and so unless doing better than their 'best rate' it is not a good value proposition as it sits uncomfortably between the experience of higher class 5 star hotels (which would cost more) and the likely decently cheaper 3 or 4 star hotels nearby which would provide the same in room experience.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Emily1970
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont for 6 nights to attend a family wedding. We had the best time, housekeeping was immaculate, the room was large and comfortable and the concierge staff are the most helpful and friendly people ever, especially Neil and Debbie. Mavis and Beau absolutely made my daughter's holiday and we were honoured to take both of them out for quite a few walks which was fun The leisure centre and swimming pool were great and not very busy at all. When we were there we had the pool to ourselves most times. It is a beautiful hotel on a par with The Landmark in London but without the snobbiness and a lot more friendly, although we found that service in general in Canada is 100 times better than in England. Only negative was that we had to leave after 6 days.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect City Centre accommodation”
Reviews.Author: MandarinBlairgowrie
Reviews.Content: A superb room in this luxury hotel with an ideal location for explring Vancouver. Attentive staff and great facilities. Excellent, although rather limited, restaurant facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Born_to_Travel9
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, decent room, very good service, but above all, in an excellent location for business downtown, 1 block from Robson street, proximity to variety of restaurants ranging from McDonalds and Tim Hortons and up. It is 2 blocks away from Vancouver central station for train ride to/from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: aphillips55
Reviews.Content: 1st trip to Vancouver. Loved it ..... Fairmont Hotels are the way to go ....second time we stayed in one and definetly the best....shower had broken in the room so had a free upgrade to a suite....and 100 dollars to spend in the hotel they just cant do enough for you . Griffins resteraunt for Thanksgiving was delicious . Vancouver has lots to see and do . Dont miss the Trip Whale Watching if you do go with 'Wild Whales Vancouver from Granville Island ' they guarantee a second trip if you dont see whales on the first one but you go with trained Marine Biologists and they know what they are doing.. we saw a pod of 15 whales !!! Awesome !! Also do the day trip sea to sky highway saw black bears in thier natual environment !! Totally awesome holiday .... dont think u will beat it ..... i having trouble deciding on next years cause this one was amazing !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Landmark - Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: sam_and_jaime
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here a bazillion times ... Coroporate rate and room-upgrades for frequent stays instantly makes this place a cut above in terms of value. Staff throughout the hotel are friendly, prompt and courteous. The place knows what the business traveller demands, and exclusivity weeds out noisey hockey teams from Kamloops. Rooms are classic and spacious. Might just be me, but I have never had a good night's sleep here ... Thermostats don't go low enought and traffic noise can be a problem. Sneak up to the upper floors and poke around the reception room, and the Royal Suites ... It's spooky late at night. The lobby bar is great ... You can avoid the obnoxious trenderati in the small area behind the main foyer ... But they need to get rid of the monsterous TVs - Tacky in an otherwise classy joint. Don't bother with Griffins ... Better restaurants for any taste are steps away (Shabusen Sushi, Italian Kitchen, ...).

Reviews.Title: “Friendlist Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrsAntiTourist
Reviews.Content: The hotel is one of the best that I have stayed in. Housekeeping were incredible when I accidentally split red win down the creme coloured wall and the mirror (the cork was bad) so beautiful when I flagged them down in the hallway for help. Rare sight to see the housekeeper and guest on a chair washing the wall down! Concierge would have to be the best that I have encounted - they recommend all the places that they use themselves and went out of their way to assist me in every aspect you could imagine ie drop-off laundry, attractions, restaurants, cheap eats, booking ahead on their family & friends rates and they always had time for a chat. It does help that they have 2 labrador dogs that you can take for walks or just go and pat. If you are ever staying at a Fairmont then do join their President's Club - you get get free internet in your room and wifi in the foyer and free local calls which i found helpful - especially if you have a calling card. The very modern Fitness Club & pool is also complimentary for President's Club members We got a great conference rate and the property is in a great location. I stayed on after conference and just didn't want to leave. It felt like a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: toves
Reviews.Content: Joined my husband who was staying at the hotel for a conference. I am very OCD about cleanliness and this hotel did not disappoint. Rooms were very clean and comfortable. It is definitely an older hotel, but very elegant. Beds were beyond comfortable. Slept better than I did at home. In addition, the Concierge assistance was unbelievable. We were given prompt service and great recommendations on places to visit and restaurants to dine at. All in all, an excellent experience and would definitely stay here again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “A Dream for Travelers”
Reviews.Author: BigOrion
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were finishing a train trip from Toronto at Vancouver, BC. Never having been to the area, we were not sure what we'd find. To our happy surprise, this hotel was wonderful in all respects. The food was topnotch, served hot and cold (when appropriate), wait persons were at our elbow at all times and all the dining was clean and well-appointed. The building was immaculate with clean floors, uniformed attendants everywhere and the doormen were magnificent. The room was reasonably sized, very clean with quality furnishings. Everything mechanical worked with facilities for working guests such as computer ports, etc. The bill for services was correct. The location was excellent, near quality shopping and leading downtown landmarks and services. We'd finish by saying the king bed was a dream for us weary travelers. We've stayed in some expensive hotels in our travels but this hotel was reasonable and, all in all, a fantastic stay for us. On the negative side, high speed internet was pricey and the ameneties were, also. At these prices, costs for extras should be lower or deferred.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious and Elegant: Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DenverDweller
Reviews.Content: I have always wanted to stay at this hotel and I had the opportunity when I was speaking at a conference there. It is the kind of hotel that is effortlessly elegant and very gracious. The rooms are big and very comfortable. This is not the hotel for you if you want trendy or edgy but what I want most from a hotel is comfort and style and the Fairmont Hotel Vancouver delivers. Excellent food was served at the conference in the hotel which is always a good sign. In addition, the bar was extremely comfortable and welcoming. This is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Watch the cost of the incidentals”
Reviews.Author: BobbyBunny
Reviews.Content: We recently spent two nights in this hotel on our way to Vancouver Island and a further night upon return. The hotel was opened in the 1930's and has a colonnial style. It very much has an air of elegance and grand old design. The rooms retain some of that style and complement it with the features you expect to find in a 21st century hotel. It's centrally located in downtown Vancouver and reasonably close to the waterfront and Stanley Park. The hotel was very comfortable and we very much enjoyed the experience. However, beware the cost of 'incidentals'. Dining in the hotel is very expensive. The cost of room service and the use of any of the in room offerings is almost beyond the reach of most people. The biggest shock came in the form of overnight car parking charges. We were given a parking voucher to use the adjacent underground car park. I naiively assumed the parking was complimentary. It cost me 82CAD for two nights.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Fairmont Vancouver Very Much”
Reviews.Author: PasCaLady
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at the Fairmont Vancouver following a Rocky Mountaineer tour. We enjoyed this hotel very much. It is an older hotel, of course, but our room was in lovely shape except for a sticky bathroom door. We had a very nice view of the city from the 12th floor. The bed was extremely comfortable. Had dinner in both Griffins and the 900 West Lounge. Both service and food were excellent. Hotel is in an excellent location to walk Vancouver. And their two beautiful friendly golden lab mascots are there to welcome you every morning. How nice!!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Olympics Experience!”
Reviews.Author: SisterMoon_8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were lucky enough to attend the 2010 Vancouver Winter Games last February, and we enjoyed 12 days at this amazing old grand dame of a hotel. The staff are incredible. The concierges can do anything for you, and I DO MEAN ANYTHING, because they got us reservations at amazing restaurants, and made special arrangements for us during the Olympics that you can hardly get in ordinary times. Our room was cavernous and beautiful, newly redecorated, and spotlessley clean with a huge closet. The hotel staff accommodated us in every way, they brought us a fridge for our medications and other items, the room service was excellent, the food at tall the restaurants was wonderful, and the servers were great. Serge was a particular stand out. He was a our breakfast/lunch waiter in the restaurant, and he gave us lots of great tips on where the locals like to go. We had wonderful massages at their lovely spa, the indoor pool was so clean and beautiful, and we went there a few times. Their location, in the heart of Vancouver was great, and we were right in the thick of the action for the nightly parties in the downtown area. BUT, it was not annoying when we wanted to go to bed. We had an interior room, and so you heard the party outside only faintly. So, that was a win/win for us! We have travelled to Vancouver several times over the years, and when we go back to Vancouver, we will never stay anywhere else. The Fairmont spirit is alive and well at this facility, and the Hotel Vancouver is a marvelous hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, classic building but needs some work”
Reviews.Author: JandJAdelaide
Reviews.Content: This is a grand old hotel building in a good central location. Unfortunately the decor is getting tired and the whole feel is that the place is in need of a refurbishment. The reception and concierge service was excellent but housekeeping and room service were less impressive. To illustrate, we had just arrived in Vancouver after a long flight from Australia - the receptionist managed to get us into a room on our early arrival so that we could shower and rest before our relations arrived later in the day. We were very happy with that but less happy when someone from housekeeping woke us up asking when we were going to vacate the room. The rooms were cleaned promptly and well but on several occasions things were not replaced and then we had problems rectifying the situation. For example - the coffee machine in the room is a lovely idea that other hotels would do well to emulate but the brownie points for putting it in disappear when the coffee used is not replaced during the standard room service visit requiring, in our case, four phone calls to rectify. There were problems with our room phone. It constantly showed a flashing light indicating a message when there was none. Also the short cut buttons did not work seeming to send any call to the restaurant. Both issues were reported but no apparent effort was made to rectify them during our stay. Our room was very spacious and the bed was very comfortable but the air conditioning was incredibly noisy. We were located in the original bit of the building and the windows are not double glazed so we also had a lot of traffic noise. Our travelling companions were in a more modern room where this was not an issue. If you need peace and quiet to sleep you may want to check which room you are getting. All in all it was an ok stay but if I was to return to Vancouver I think I would try elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Super Accomadations”
Reviews.Author: RHinBucksCounty
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with outstanding service. I had a need for ice packs because of a knee injury and they moved a second small refrigerator into the room at NO charge. We stayed on the Gold Floor and the personnel could not have been more accommodating! GREAT hotel.....could not find anything negative.

Reviews.Title: “Old and tired. Construction around the hotel makes getting there almost unbearable.”
Reviews.Author: Fanfoot
Reviews.Content: There is currently (Aug 2010) a LOT of construction going on around the hotel. It probably took me an hour to make it the last two or three blocks to the hotel in my car. Dead stop for 15 minutes at a time then move a few inches. Crazy. Until the construction is over I would literally avoid staying at this hotel for any reason. The hotel was once great, but saw its best days long ago. The rooms and hallways haven't been redone in AGES. Internet access is slow. Insufficient power jacks. Service was slow--repeatedly had to leave messages with the operator because the valet or room service didn't answer. Room service was average at best yet very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful stay”
Reviews.Author: MayaJinCA
Reviews.Content: I slept like a baby for the 2 nights we were here. The location was perfect, the room was very nice and comfortable, and the staff was very helpful with the travel issues we were having. I never slept so well in months!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely elegance”
Reviews.Author: FaustinaMaria
Reviews.Content: Great large room in the heart of the city that was virtually soundproof of outside noise. The only noise was occasional hallway conversation. Lots of ambience. Totally convenient in the downtown area. A bit tricky access to valet/drop off. Staff wonderfully courteous and gracious. I wish there had been free internet access from the room though.

Reviews.Title: “Great place if you care to splurge”
Reviews.Author: pkoonce
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Fairmont. It was like a throw back hotel that treated you well with a newspaper in a cloth bag in the morning. Pricy though, but go ahead treat yourself, you deserve it!

Reviews.Title: “Classic Grand Hotel in downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: mcgdas01
Reviews.Content: This is a landmark "grand" hotel in a great location in downtown Vancouver. Our stay was pretty much faultless, as you would expect given a hotel of this stature.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: PGDM-OnTheMove
Reviews.Content: A top-notch lodging experience in almost every way. Front desk staff was welcoming and accommodating, and the room was bright and beautiful, with windows that actually open and a great shower. Also a small fridge that I requested. Conference breakfast and lunch were outstanding. Great location for walking in the area and the hotel had an elegant yet somehow "homey" feel to us. Front desk even stored the package of Japanese popsicles my wife and I purchased on impulse before realizing our fridge lacked a freezer section. I was also impressed that reservation taker was willing to give us a significant discount from the conference rate when I inquired about extending our stay on our own dime. Minor deficits: bed & sheets not as comfortable as we expected and there don't appear to be any views of anything from this hotel. But we really enjoyed this grand old hotel and would readily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: EugeneChan
Reviews.Content: My first impression of the hotel was good. It is located very close to Robson Street and adjacent to the Art Gallery. The lobby is large, opulent and contained various designer shops such as Louis Vuitton. However, there was a problem with the lobby. Unless you want to have tea or coffee, there are no seats for guests to sit on. He picture on www.fairmont.com/HotelVancouver/ showing the chairs (with flower patterns) and coffee tables in the lobby is deceiving and completely inaccurate. The sit-down area no longer exists and has been replaced with a watch shop (Omega from memory). I also visited the levels above the lobby and it was grand. Marble staircases, and elegant and classy decorations. Now the rooms. My room was plush, clean and of an adequate size. The decor was attractive and beautifully appointed and it was evident that the hotel staff were extremely attentive to detail. There was a luxurious collection of soaps, shampoos, body lotions etc. but the internet was not complimentary which I think is unacceptable for the amount I was paying. I enquired Into the local attractions and for directions to various points of interest - the staff were very efficient and knowledgeable. When I requested for extra towels, they responded to my request within a couple of minutes. However, I must comment on the lack of assistance of the hotel staff when it came to carrying my luggage upon arrival. There were no porters to help carry my luggage - as a group of twelve, we were all carrying our skis, boot bags and luggage for a 2.5 week holiday. I was unimpressed by this lack of service which I expect from all 5 star hotels. We had to later carry all the luggage to our rooms. Ignoring my criticisms, I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here. It was mostly what I expected from the Fairmont line of hotels and I highly recommend it to people who want to splurge.

Reviews.Title: “Far too expensive - avoid.”
Reviews.Author: vincee198642
Reviews.Content: We spent a night here for our honeymoon - the website made it look far better than it was. The lobby was smart, but as soon as we got onto the corridor leading to our room, we realised it might be a mistake, given the price we had paid, as it smelt musty and had not been decorated for a long time. We entered the room, which looked like it had not been touched since the 1980s, and smelt old too. Probably the bed was the only new thing in there. The showerhead was yellow and a shaving light, which looked like it was made in the 60s or 70s, was hanging off the wall and made of bakerlite (see pics). So the room was far too expensive. Then we decided to make a local call, which we were charged for. In Vancouver, this is free usually. It wasnt a large cost, but it was an addition on everything else. The internet was CAD 10 for 10 minutes, which is an utter rip off these days, and then to add insult to injury the valet parking was over CAD 30 for one night. If you want free calls and free internet - offered as standard at other hotels, you can opt up to a more expensive package (!!)....the only positive was the breakfast in Griffins restaurant which was excellent. The hotel is a tourist trap - we have stayed in far better places in Vancouver for far less money, and if you want to spend any time here, just have the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Classic Historic Hotels with some minor issues...”
Reviews.Author: traveltina
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights prior to an Alaskan cruise; first time ever visiting Vancouver. Our first impressions, arriving around 8pm at night was that the lobby was bustling with activity....folks in the lobby lounge & all throughout the lobby area coming & going to events & out into the city. One odd issue immediately upon arrival was that there was no bellman....I would expect this class of hotel to offer assistance with our baggage...luckily, we were able to handle it on our own but after traveling nearly 12 hours, a little help would have been a better welcome. I will note however, we arrived off the street entrance having taken the skytrain from the airport rather than by car where maybe that is where a bellman would be available--not sure. However, the front desk clerk never offered or mentioned the availability of any assitance. We had a standard room which we were told was "upgraded" to a galley view (I guess it was because the view was of the next door Art Museum? View was ok. There was quite a bit of noise coming from the street when the window was open; but it was quiet quiet when closed. We enjoyed the dogs--Mavis & Beau..when they were on duty.
