We used the pool (indoors) a couple times and it was very quiet & not used by many people. There was a large swimming pool, a smaller one (not sure if it was a children's pool or what) & also a jacuzzi tub. There was also an outdoor area outside of the pool where you could sit & lounge if the weather was warm. We were on a package that included breakfast -- we had the buffet in the mornings. Service was fine. Food was fine. Noticed that the walls next to our table was splattered & needed cleaning. Also on the cleaning issue, I was sitting in the hallway on our floor waiting by the elevator & noticed that the table was absolutely covered in dust. Someone had written in the dust. The following day....it was still there & left the impression that it had been there for quite awhile....I would expect better attention to cleanliness from Fairmont. I liked the location however, if I were to visit again, I would take a very close look at the other Fairmonts down near the waterfront & also the other hotels there. I think I would have preferred staying down in that area, but it was a close walk & it was also closer for us to get to Robson Street for tons of restaurants & all the shops. We did not have a car & used solely public transportation, walking & taxi's to get around--it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service”
Reviews.Author: frequentflyer10
Reviews.Content: Being a Platinum member at fairmont and having stayed at this hotel many times I was expecting the normal excellent quality and service. Upon arriving at the hotel after my child who was checking in before me I was faced with very long lines at check in. Being unwilling to wait and forced to make an emergency visit to the hospital I left immediatly. This, for the first time was a problem and attempted to get my son to fix things. When my son went down to fix it, the staff were rude and unwilling to help. After several phone calls with the hotel from the hospital, I decided to have my son check out early and change hotels to avoid added stress. This caused further issues and after a conversation with the manger on duty my son was embarrased at having the manger both talk down to him and threaten various actions such as an "investigation". THis far from simple solution lead to my family staying at the Sutton Place which was very nice as usual. Although I am a loyal presidents club member, I dont see myself staying at this location in the near future, especially due to the new fairmont on the water.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location”
Reviews.Author: Jeangraf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Hotel only for one night. We stayed at the Gold Level and enjoyed the extra service you get. it's very private. there is a lounge (classic style) where you have breakfast and snacks during the day. The Fairmont Hotel is located just at the robson street where all the main shops are. There was not enough time to taste the restaurants. So I can not give any suggestions on that. The hotel is in classic style but it fits the buildings style.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent old world style Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tonyhar
Reviews.Content: Full of character, excellent rooms, food and service.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: step_ott
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three days, and everything was very good. The rooms were clean, spacious, and well equipped (even the low priced room I had) and everything worked well. Our party with three rooms reserved arrived much earlier than check in time, got a friendly greeting and our rooms very quickly. The front desk, the concierge desk, and especially the desk for tours were all friendly and knowledgeable. The only problem I can think of is that the large elegant lobby is really a bar and shopping centre. There is only space for six people to sit outside the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Good but expensive”
Reviews.Author: ChesterLeStreet
Reviews.Content: I suppose the adage that 'if you can't afford it, don't buy it' could apply, but the Fairmont Vancouver is really expensive on the unexpected items. Tax and tips aren't apparent, but can really rack up after a few days. The room rates are reasonable, but drinks and extras are dear. Our suite on the second floor was vast, but quite dated. Nothing worn out, just very traditional and a little old-fashioned. We were moved to the 'Gold' floor after being woken at 8.30 by building work, which was very much appreciated. There are some lovely 'complimentary' touches, such as free breakfast and evening snacks, but in reality, it's all paid for in the higher tariff. The bar and common areas of the hotel are impressive and it really is spectacular to look at. Location is unbeatable and the staff are efficient, but without any great warmth. There was a very good pianist in the bar, which again was beautiful, yet dated. (the bar not the pianist). In all, I would say that the Fairmont Vancouver is a sumptuous and luxurious hotel, but don't stay unless you have plenty of spare cash for those extras

Reviews.Title: “It is 2010- why isn't there an wireless internet??”
Reviews.Author: yaarit
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice, clean and comfortable. I took from the airport by the skytrain that dropped me a block away from the hotel. It is very central- a walk a way from nearly every attraction in the area. I was very disappointed from the fact that there is no WiFi in the hotel; I connected in the room using a cable (!). It was especially inconvenient when I sat in the lobby and tried to do some work... In my opinion, the hotel is great for a vacation but less suitable for business... ENJOY! Vancouver is awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good, But Needs a Facelift”
Reviews.Author: seniorbella
Reviews.Content: Not anything bad to say about this hotel. It was charming and regal. However, after staying other more modern hotels, I believe and upgrade is needed. The bathrooms are old, if they do anything, it should be with that room. The toilet has no tank, the toilet lit slams shut and the faucets are throwbacks. I know this is the older hotel, but they can keep with the style, but do a few upgrades to the bathrooms. One more thing- room service breakfast is expensive, but they provide large portions.

Reviews.Title: “Sensational Hotel for business needs”
Reviews.Author: StephenQueensland
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was sensational. The location, the beautiful old buliding in good order, but most importantley the amazing service from the staff. We stayed on the Fairmont Gold level...the staff were just wonderful....they made a business trip enjoyable. Nothing was too much trouble. They did everything they could to make the stay a good one. The services on level 9 were fantastic. The complimentary drinks, snacks etc....were of the highest quality.....but back to the staff. I needed assistance with the computer - they helped out....when I booked a wake up call, they sent me a complimentary cappucino....because they were aware that I drank them......outstanding......I can't wait to return for a holiday and bring my family.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has gone downhill - dirty and dated room, bad service”
Reviews.Author: traveller0808
Reviews.Content: i have stayed in this hotel numerous time but have found that their rooms and service have gone downhill. here's why: -before arriving, i especially asked for an early check in. my room was not ready when i arrived -when i got my room, there was a half empty bottle of water by the window, behind the blinds -the toilet was not flushed -i found quite a few hairs on the floor of the bathroom -the ethernet jet on the desk was not working. i have to connect the cable directly from my computer to the jet on the wall -i used their free shoe shine service available to their president club guests. my shoes were not returned as promised before 7 a.m. the next day. i have to call and have them rushed my shoes to me as i had an early meeting that day -they ran out of shower gel in the gym both times i was there (on different times on different days). it seems that no one was there maintaining the gym -they moved their business centre to the basement and they now charge for internet use and printing (they were both free before) the location of the hotel is great - in the heart of downtown, close to robson street, and many stores and restaurants within walking distance. but then you have the Four Seasons and the Metropolitan Hotel Vancouver just across the street. I have stayed in both before and they have much better service (especially the Four Seasons) and are both cheaper. the only positive thing i found is that they have rennovated the gym and have all new technogym equipments (see photos). even so, their gym is still smaller and not as well equipped as the Four Seasons and the Metropolitan Hotel Vancouver Restaurant recommendation: if you like japanese food, try Zest Japanese Cuisine - 2775 W. 16th Ave., Kitsilano, ---------

Reviews.Title: “Pure luxury!”
Reviews.Author: smushie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed two nights at the Fairmont Hotel Vancouver in a club level room and it was an amazing end to an amazing vacation. This hotel is fantastic and, like all of vancouver, very pet friendly. If you're missing your pet, Mavis, the hotel dog, is available for walks. The staff is absolutely top notch. My wife and I had a late flight out and the staff stored our luggage all day and then provided us with a room to shower and change before we left for the airport. I can't even begin to explain how gorgeous the building was other than to say that I would encourage people to take the historic tour of the hotel and the surrounding area.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel have lots of History in it, great location”
Reviews.Author: skyone
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel, I will rate them probably 3 1/2 stars, it could go to a 4 stars, but this hotel really need to do some renovation or some serious update 1. Hotel location - Great location, heart of downtown, they're restaurant every where surrounding this hotel 2. Room - The room is very good size, even just a standard room, very clean and roomy, but old, need to update 3. Restaurant - This hotel serve very good breakfast buffet, and if you're up early and don't want to go out, stay in and have their buffet breakfast 4. Staff - All their staff are very friendly and helpful, and often they called me by my last name, and you know that is a big plus, showing me they care One downside about this hotel is their carpet, I believe is really old and really need to change it, when I stay in this hotel, I woke up every morning with red eyes, I believe I'm ellagic to the carpet because is so much dust inside, other then that, this is a really nice hotel If you're looking for luxury hotel, this is not for you If you're looking for a good night sleep, shower and enjoying your trip and stay, I will go for this for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Worst fairmont property ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: versa309
Reviews.Content: My hotel experience started with the front desk trying to upgrade me with $100 extra per night. There was no greeting, no smiling at all. I was shocked to see that as I always see friendly smiles from front desk at any other fairmont hotels. When I went to the room, I found mould in the bathroom on the tiles and walls just like other guest found. The tiny window was covered with bird droppings. Toilet makes loud noise when you flush. It was very depressing to be in the room. I prefer sleeping on a hard bed, and the hotel bed was way too soft for me. Upon check out, I asked to add my "fairmont club membership number" on my reservation to the front desk manager (she was happend to be there), and this never got done so I had to call the customer care center to request. Again, there was no greeting. The one thing I enjoyed during my stay here was to play with hotel dogs. They were not active dogs, but at least they acknowledged me with big smile. They were very cute. I would never stay this hotel ever again. If I am paying similer rate, I would rather stay at the Fairmont Waterfront or the Fairmont Vancouver Airport. Both properties are GREAT!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Vancouver - Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Kryptonite-Dove
Reviews.Content: Great suites, amazing views and professional staff. You will not be disappointed! Situated in the center of the Downtown area the location is perfect for bars, food and shopping with one of Vancouver's biggest malls (The Pacific Center) across the street. Recreationally you are about a 10 min walk from the cost and around 20 mins from Stanley Park. Expect rain in the winter months and a more temperate climate in spring and summer.

Reviews.Title: “can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: jasonzegreat
Reviews.Content: Didn't really care that the room decor was out dated. The bed is extremely comfortable, bathroom was clean and luxurious, and most of all it's right in the centre of downtown Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Great dog friendly hotel in downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: RStokes
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in downtown Vancouver - great for business or sightseeing / visiting vancouver Comparable to four seasons nearby in amenities with more reasonable pricing Some really great things about the hotel: - Nice swimming pool on roof of 2nd floor - You can bring your dog with you - Great location - Joining their frequent guest program gets you free wifi - They provide bicycles to tour the city on request Food is nice and the hotel is elegant and stylish in a turn of the century style

Reviews.Title: “Great position but overrated”
Reviews.Author: TheJeppos
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont provided an excellent and spacious room. Initial and final opinions were marred by poor interpersonal skills by the people in reception, a one-off given that we found Canadians to be the friendliest and most polite people on earth. The Fairmont was in the heart of the city. The room was exceedingly spacious, comfortable and classy, but sensor detectors in the fridge, to detect any movement of contents and an automatic bill whether opened or used or not,, rendered one disinclined to even look for milk for a cup of tea. Constant interruptions by staff knocking on the door during the day were also annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ColumbiaTrekkers
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Hotel Vancouver is a uniquely elegant hotel, and one of the former Canadian Pacific hotel masterpieces. The hotel was excellent, rooms clean, and everything as expected. Although the hotel's standard rates are high, the hotel website offers a number of reasonable rates. If you want a unique hotel experience in Vancouver, try the Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: knutsford1
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in August 2009. It was a really nice hotel but i have no idea how much it cost. It was part of the Rocky Mountaineer Gold Leaf package which included a free night there. We were in room 657 on 6th floor. The room did have an incredibly small window but was a really large room with really good air con and comfortable bed. The Swimming pool was ok but the photos do flatter the reality. Remember to take your room key and dressing gown when you go to the swimming pool. The changing rooms are very nice with lockers with towels. The gym is ok with a few running machines but nothing spectacular There is a small area to sit outside amongst the skyscrapers which is nice with great views. The main hotel lobby is beautiful and the hotel itself is in a really nice part of downtown with lovely shops / bars etc. if you want a cool little bar nearby, try the cactus club only 100m from the hotel. There are 4 exits so not sure which one we took. There are apparently free mountain bikes but we were not there long enough to use. One small complaint is that there are no tea making facilities. apart from that it was a lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but worth it”
Reviews.Author: wucie
Reviews.Content: Great location in the heart of downtown Vancouver + excellent, attentive staff that cater to your every whim (and offer good recommendations too) + spacious, spotless room + attractive off-season rates = a great 3 day stay in 1 of the world's most attractive cities. Would definitely recommend both (and go back of course ;-)

Reviews.Title: “A truly 'grand' hotel”
Reviews.Author: chocolate_teapot
Reviews.Content: We arrived in my son's 12 year old car. The doorman took one look at us, clearly decided "No tip there" and proceeded to ignore us and our luggage. Things could only improve from there. Our room, on the fifth floor was fine, clean and comfortable. On our second day we had a problem using the key cards. On contacting reception we found that our two night booking was under two separate references which was why our cards had been canceled. This was corrected with a minimum of fuss. My major gripe about this hotel was the fees they wanted to charge for everything - fees for car parking, fees for internet usage, $8 for a bottle of water in the room. Fees for all the things that I thought should have been included. In the time we were there we did not buy as much as a cup of tea in the hotel. Far too expensive when there were any number of bars/restaurants nearby. Overall I thought that this hotel was a bit too aware that it was a 'grand' hotel

Reviews.Title: “Will absolutely return”
Reviews.Author: Reaperducer
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. The former grand Hotel Vancouver is part of the Fairmont chain, which always does a good job. I originally had reservations at the Four Seasons across the street, but found a special online for this hotel. I'm glad I did. It was great. The room was huge, the service great, and the location perfect. Even though I could never get the pillows arranged just right, the bed was comfy enough that it didn't matter and I slept great. Here's a hint -- before you make your reservation, sign up for the Presidents Club. That way you don't have to wait in line to check in or out (there's a separate desk around the corner from main check in) and the internet is free. Usually when I travel for business I stay in super-cheap places. I'm glad I stayed here this time. I didn't realize the importance of having a proper desk to do my work and a separate space to sit and read and relax. My productivity was much higher than when I multi-purpose the bed like I normally do. The hotel has a pair of dogs for when you get lonely, but don't count on using them. They seemed to be booked all the time and when they weren't they looked dog tired from all the love and affection they get from the guests. But the dogs are cute and well behaved and if you're lonely they're a lot cheaper than a hooker and won't cut you if you don't give them a tip. The location is very good -- just a block or two from two different subway lines. The only bad thing is that you do get some drunks out on the street at 3am whooping it up on the weekends, but that's not the hotel's fault. City noise is city noise.

Reviews.Title: “I Love Fairmonts!”
Reviews.Author: sperry17
Reviews.Content: I'm lucky enough to have a friend that works for Fairmont hotels and I'm able to get a really great friends and family discount for such a high quality hotel chain. If I could stay in Fairmonts every where I go I would :) Specifically about this location though, the service was top notch some of the best I've ever had. Our concierge made numerous reservations for us and steered us in all the right directions to make our 2 day stay in such a fantastic city memorable and wanting me to go back for more. The rooms are elegant and very classy as is the entire ambience of the hotel. If you're looking for something a little more upper scale this Fairmont is definitely worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Watch for extras!”
Reviews.Author: Paddy53
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great. Walk out of any of the four entrances and you are right where you want to be. After reading other TA revies we were wary of the extras. Internet is $14.95 (ignore the log on charge of $13.95) a night plus tax. You had to be really careful not to knock the "Farimont Teddy Bear" and incur a charge. A large bottle of water is $6, and a bottle of beer from the mini bar is $10!. The front desk staff need some training. When we checked in we were not given our "Rocky Mountaineer" booklet, despite asking if they had it and when we checked out they double charged us for our extras, as we had a free night as part of the train package and they did not tie the two up,despite double checking that they had done so! It took a phone call to sort out, although they did delete the credit card charge pretty quickly when asked. A gold star for the lady concierge. We asked where whale watching bus would colelct us from. They didn't pick up from the hotel (incomentent travel agent), but instead of directing us she immediately picked up the phone, called the company, and made sure the driver would wait, so we didn't miss our trip. A cool effient approach. Overall the hotel is high on grandeur, but a little impersonal and extremely busy at all hours!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: saucyredhead
Reviews.Content: Spent a lovely week at the Fairmont on our first trip to Vancouver. Location is perfect; city central and within walking distance of many of the city's major attractions, (which is a good thing since parking is no bargain). The service is great, (can't say enough good things about the staff), and the rooms are large and well appointed. Griffins Restaurant serves a killer brunch, and the 900 West Lounge off the lobby is pleasant and has good entertainment on the weekends. Oh, and as a bonus they have a couple of big, friendly dogs, Mavis and Beau, for you to pet, walk or just admire, assuming you like dogs. Keep in mind, however, this is an old hotel and, despite having been updated, you might expect a few glitches. For instance, the elevators have been updated to operate with key cards, but they don't always work. Not a major issue, but annoying. The plumbing is another matter all together. It's old, it's noisy and it's cranky. After our toilet stopped up, (honest, it wasn't us), for the second consecutive day, we were moved into a different room so that the offending appliance could be removed and replaced. However, to compensate for our inconvenience we were upgraded to a much larger corner room on a higher floor with a great view. Can't complain. All in all a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, so-so restaurant, shame about the web site & internet access.”
Reviews.Author: xxxxxxzxxxxxxxx
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Vancouver trades on its historic past as Vancouver’s prime hotel for the last seventy years and has a slightly antiquated style which you either like or hate. We loved it. Filling the block between two of Vancouver’s main crossroads, noise from the sirens of passing police cars etc. can be heard – but rarely. Indeed, the relative silence serves to remind one of what ugly, brutish places cities like London have become. Our visit start inauspiciously with a running battle with the Fairmont web site’s booking system, which variously said that we had no booking, that we had a booking and that we had two bookings. A series of tortuous emails were necessary to secure the reservation. In the event, our arrival went smoothly and we were soon installed in a large suite overlooking the Vancouver Art Gallery. The suite was well equipped, with two large flat-screen televisions and good quality furniture & furnishings throughout. A small fridge had been installed at my request, which was just as well as the minibar was one of those evil machines that charges you if as much as a bit of wind brushes any of the contents. Tea and coffee, which was complimentary, was placed dangerously close next to a bottle of water which was chargeable. This being Vancouver, complimentary loan umbrellas are provided. Griffin’s restaurant produces good quality food at quite high prices, but the reliance on buffets for all but main courses comes seems inappropriate in a hotel with Fairmont’s aspirations. The absence of cheese as a desert option was astonishing and the flat refusal of the buffet chef to provide any utterly ludicrous. A significant problem was discovered with the internet service provided by the hotel. Fairmont’s outbound mail server, which appears to capture all outgoing emails (ignoring the sender’s account settings) black-holes a large proportion of messages sent – and provides no warning of this to the sender. The problem was solved by by-passing the hotel’s fire wall. Unfortunately, the extent of the problem – and the solution – only became apparent the last night of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Maisy_AB
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel several times and have enjoyed each stay. We've stayed in the 1 bedroom suite which is always very comfortable. We have a 3 year old who is treated as well as the rest of my family. Everyone loves the pool and the restaurant is excellent as well. We stay only once a year but get greeted by name as though we are regulars. Love this place!! We've also stayed at the Fairmont Waterfront in Vancouver and even though it is newer than the Hotel Vancouver, I still like this one better.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfy room, excellent bikes”
Reviews.Author: cocotwice
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and enjoyed our stay. The room and bathroom weren't that large but were comfortable and had all the amenienties you could need. Bizzarely no creamers for coffee as the previous poster mentioned. Breakfast buffet was good although we found the waiter to be useless - we had plates piled up on our table which was annoying. Rest of the staff were really helpful. One tip, sign up online before you arrive for the Fairmont Presidents loyalty scheme so that you get free wifi, seperate check-in and use of the hotels bikes all for free. Even if your card hasnt arrived they will find your name on the system. We took the very swish BMW bikes out for 3 hours completely free and enjoyed a whistle-stop tour of Stanley Park. I believe it would have been expensive to hire bikes for the three of us. Also when you check-in make sure your child is given a free cookies and milk voucher to order via room service. Our son loved this! Yes the bathrooms are small and not particularly well layed out but they are fine for a short stay. Beds are really comfortable. Location is everything and this hotel is in a really great location. Our son loved meeting Mavis the Lobby dog in reception although she seemed thorough ly fed up! Also check your bill carefully. My son bought the little mavis soft toy dog in the room and we were charged twice as it's on a sensor and he lifted it and replaced the dog twice so it appeared twice on the bill. Parking is REALLY expensive - there are much cheaper alternatives that if you staying longer than two nights you should really explore! We had a lovely family dinner at whitespot which is walking distance and if you fancy a bit of shopping the Pacific Centre Mall is just across the road - GAP, Banana Republic, Hollister etc. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Ero40
Reviews.Content: This hotel is location in the heart of the city, right across the road from the main shopping centre. The hotel is quite grand and has a lot of extra, like apples at reception and two very friendly dogs called marvis and Beau. You can take these dogs out for a walk. The staff are very friendly and helpful. There give informative information and nothing seems to be a problem. This hotel would suit families, elderly, singles and business travellers, in fact all travellers. The room are not large but are quite grand, quite old world styled but with a certain flare.

Reviews.Title: “High Prices and Poor Facilities”
Reviews.Author: Maineguy0001
Reviews.Content: Fairmont Hotels are known as one of the highest quality hotel chains in the world. They are renowned for having the most wonderful properties with elegant facilities and superb service worldwide. Unfortunately none of this can be said for the Fairmont Hotel Vancouver in Vancouver, British Columbia. After arrival at 10:30 AM and what seemed to be good check in service, seeing the actual rooms assigned demonstrated that the room preferences requested during reservations were not taken into consideration. Apparently, although the reservations were made several months prior to the date of check-in, and were confirmed by phone on several occasions prior to arrival, the king size beds requested were not in the rooms that were assigned. While this was not a difficult thing to have corrected, it was an indication that the upcoming service would not be the experience that Fairmont promises in their brochures, websites and other advertising. It was also not what was expected from the very high, premium prices that were paid to stay at a Fairmont property. Being able to see the “wrong rooms” was also telling in allowing me to see the actual quality of more than the rooms assigned to me for the two day stay. Carpet was threadbare and/or dirty. Bathrooms had de-laminating showers and tubs and/or cracked old tiles. There were no vanities or place to put toilet articles and in fact no bathroom counter or shelving at all. Towel racks are ridiculously placed in the shower itself so that towels would be soaked if left there while taking a shower. There was no other place to put towels while showering other than on the floor, in the sink, or on the toilet. This was the case in all three rooms that were seen in the hotel. After explaining that I did not have a king size bed as stated on the reservation I was told I could change rooms. I was also told by the hotel desk to leave my luggage and that it would be in my new room when I returned late that afternoon (after 5:00 PM). Needless to say my luggage was not in my new room when I returned and had been left in the first room I was assigned. This was quickly remedied but there should not have been the need to have it corrected, it should have happened as I was assured it would. The room that I ended up in was stuffy, with air conditioning that could not keep it cool. Although it was never extremely hot outside, and the room was in the shadows, the air conditioning would never bring the temperature down below 72 degrees Fahrenheit, 22 Celsius. Engineering was called and I was told that the air conditioning was working at its utmost efficiency and it would not get cooler. The engineer was honest enough to say that the Fairmont Hotel Vancouver was an old building with old systems and that this was one of the problems with it. I received the same answer when the same engineer worked on the hot water, or lack thereof. Other than being scalded regularly when any toilet in the hotel was flushed, the water in the shower was only luke-warm at any time. I was told that with the risers (pipes) designed as they are in this outdated hotel that it might take time for hot water to get to my room. (This did not make sense as I was able to be scalded intermittently when a toilet was flushed.) Even when the hot water was left running overnight to make sure that there was enough time to let it get to my room, it only flowed luke-warm. Again the engineer said that this was the case with all the rooms on the both wings of the hotels and that there might be a better chance of getting hot water in rooms by the elevators if I wanted to move again. I was offered another change of rooms but having already seen three rooms in the hotel, and being unpacked I did not wish to again change rooms. The purpose of a hotel is to make guests comfortable upon arrival, not by continually moving them from one room to another. Fairmont management was very apologetic for my troubles and lack of basic facilities, like towel racks, bathroom counters, appropriate ventilation, and hot water, but I do not book a hotel for apologies, I try to choose a hotel and pay premium prices for comfortable rooms and quality service. I received wonderful apologies but never any service or comfort. I was promised by management that the Fairmont Hotels I would be staying at over the course of my travels during the next week (Banff Springs, Calgary Palliser) would be notified and that all would be perfect over my next seven days. This also turned out to be more false hope. While the Fairmont's hotel buildings themselves may be beautiful, the accommodations at the Fairmont Hotel Vancouver, Fairmont Banff Springs and Fairmont Calgary Palliser are old, dilapidated facilities of once past glory. They now remind me of 1950 style European tourist class hotels. To put the name Fairmont on these building is the equivalent of putting lipstick on a pig. In both cases you are wasting your time, and you annoy the pig. Here the only one to be annoyed is the hotel guest who has paid premium prices for far less than mediocre facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Grande dame didn't disappoint-elegant, refined yet casual”
Reviews.Author: CDickie
Reviews.Content: Room was large, wonderfully appointed and with a curious small space (luggage, dressing?) and no full length mirror. Check-in was mechanical and not friendly; as I say, mechanical. In-room dining was on-time and delivered with very good customer service. Dinner at Griffins was good, large portions, but staff a bit condescending in manner; 5-star attitude in a 4-star 'buffet' setting. Lounge is comfortable and inviting, live pianist most days. Hotel has 2 dogs you can borrow to take for a walk. I guess this is a nice idea. Pool area is nice but small; can't have 2 swimmers at same time, great array of work-out equipment. I got a fantastic rate and at that price would stay again. At published rate, no. Bedding is great, huge bathrooms, robes-no slippers, good food in large portions. I'd recommend this place to some, not all: get a great rate!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and classic elegance”
Reviews.Author: goblueIrvine
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 days here with family to attend a wedding. We were fortunate enough to be able to use the "friends and family" discount for this stay. Like some others have posted, the Hotel Vancouver is not the most modern place but there is certainly a great sense of classic elegance you feel staying here. The best thing about this place is the location, practically on Robson street where there are plenty of places to shop and eat. It's also about a 5-10 minute drive to Stanley Park , Granville Island, and many of the other charming neighborhoods of Vancouver. Parking is expensive (33/day) but you really can't avoid that with any of the downtown locations. As always with Fairmonts, the beds were very comfortable. The rooms were spacious and felt comfortable. This is definitely an older place but Fairmont does an excellent job of maintaining it's charm and elegance.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand Old Lady still has class.”
Reviews.Author: AJ&ERtravel
Reviews.Content: And a touch of elegance too. Sure, it's not cheap but it's dead centre of all that is happening and but a stone's throw from Robson Street. The Fairmont people do an excellent job of keeping up the traditions of a Vancouver landmark. We were fortunate to be upgraded to the executive floor so had a very comfortable and clean room with impeccable service from the executive desk. The dogs in the lobby, I think the original Mavis passed on, continue to attract returning guests and new arrivals equally. A pat of the dog and you feel like you are home. I like the hotel Vancouver and would recommend it without hesitation. However, if you bring your car, get ready for a big gulp - it's $33 to park it overnight.

Reviews.Title: “Room service is a rip-off!”
Reviews.Author: janebo
Reviews.Content: Well, we live in Halifax, NS and we can buy approx 7 lbs of bananas for the price of a single cut-up banana brought to our room. Ice is $3.00, but if you walk down the hall, and around a corner, there is a well-hidden ice-room that provides free ice. I could not find this mentioned anywhere in the "Services" sheet. Even our room maid was not quite sure where it was. A bottle of water was $8. The mini-bar!!! The cans are hidden by other cans; the bottles are on their sides, and you cannot read the labels. If you take anything out to examine it, a sensor detects that you have removed it and, according to the Concierge, you have 20 SECONDS to put it back, else you will be automatically charged for it. This 20 second "fuse" was not mentioned on or inside our mini-bar. The location is great, and all the staff were wonderful, but you have to eat outside of your room (preferably outside the hotel) unless you have more money than you know how to spend. The pillows are the best I have ever slept on. We have stayed in many Fairmonts, including the wonderful ones at Lake Louise and Banff Springs. They are nicer accommodations, and cheaper for in-room dining and dining rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pricey but elegant”
Reviews.Author: RWAJ08
Reviews.Content: My husband and i had the fortune to stay here for free while he was on a business trip. The room was very nice, quiet, and had a good view. The hotel itself is elegant and in a fantastic location in the heart of downtown. It's very pricey, and the people at the bar downstairs were quite rude to us. The brunch service was excellent and a good value, though the food wasn't amazing, it was good. The location and class made this hotel worthwhile. The staff was friendly and had great suggestions for restaurants and activities. If you've got the money, it's a nice place. I took the bus from the airport, because it was actually easier to find than a cab. It was cheap and took me right to the hotel. Better than a taxi actually, which we took back to the airport. You can walk nearly anywhere. We rented bikes nearby and rode them in Stanley Park. There are excellent restaurants and stores nearby. They also have a business center with computers and printers which was very convenient and a gym. They have internet in the rooms which you must pay for or become a Fairmont Club member (free membership but then they send you loads of emails) to get. The pool and hot tub are nice as well.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rambocious
Reviews.Content: As soon as you walk in I was thinking how beautiful it was inside. The conceirge was very helpful and all who worked there that I delt with were very nice. The pool and gym were nice as well, very clean. The room was comfy and well put together. It was aIso on walking distance to alot of the attractions around. We were able to walk to breakfast and Stanley Park. I was very pleased with my stay there. I would without a doubt stay there again in a heart beat!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great City.......”
Reviews.Author: Shropshireladd
Reviews.Content: We arrived to find there had been some kind of mix up with rooms. We were upgraded without having to ask. Room was great and comfortable, with the best make-your-own coffee I've ever had. Amazing views of the city from our 10th (I think) floor room.Around 7pm on the evening of our arrival A large part of Vancouver suffered a massive power cut, so we walked to a part of the city where they still had electricty. On our return to the Fairmont later in the evening, power had been restored and we had a great evening in their excellent bar. We ate at the hotel the next evening and it was very good indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Stately well maintained jewel”
Reviews.Author: Steeler_Pens_fan
Reviews.Content: This is one of the former CP railroad hotels that where built in major Canadian cities served by the railroad. It still retains its charm and beauty even in the 21th century. The public areas are very classy and grand. The guest room was a decent size (some older hotel have very small rooms) and was clean and well furnished. I did learn right away that this hotel is located in the heart of Vancouver. The first morning I was awaken by the noise of the "Sun Run" which consisted of about 50,000 participants; the starting line with grandstand and music was right under my window. Two days later the parklet by the art museum behind the hotel had a large crowd (in the thousands) protesting for the legalization of pot. The cloud of smoke was unbelievable.

Reviews.Title: “High Class”
Reviews.Author: pinkPhoenix
Reviews.Content: My stay at the hotel was excellent. The room was clean, and well maintained. Bathroom was spotless. The only issue I had was that the lifts sometimes did not want to go to my floor, and when there were several people in the lift wanting different floors it would just get more confused and stop at some of them. So improvements would be to fix the lifts, provide wireless internet and they would modernise the rooms a bit, though I didn't mind the old style charm of the decor.

Reviews.Title: “Grand hotel continues to charm”
Reviews.Author: lattegirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a long weekend in January. Cold! We had a jr suite, booked with a great rate via Fairmont's member club. Over 700 sq feet, perfect for couple and two children. Small bathroom. but not surprised because the hotel is old. The king bed and bedding were delish! Since it was cold, the heat worked nicely. I went to the spa downstairs. Very reasonable prices. One issue for the room - no in room safe. The hotel brunch buffet was okay, very expensive. I recall that it was better a few years ago. One restaurant sign states wine bar, but it's just a regular bar. Wine flights and tastings would be great. Love the dogs, a great bonus for such an elegant hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...and thats about it...”
Reviews.Author: michellebee009
Reviews.Content: The location is great and it is easy to access anywhere by foot or bus. The rooms were nothing special, the decor is very dated but we did not spend much time at the hotel, so it did not matter that much. Overall, it was a decent hotel but I do have a few complaints. Be sure to check carefully go over your bill before you leave, they tried to charge us for items in the mini bar when we never even touched it. The lady at the front desk explained that the mini fridges are electronically monitored and if you even open the fridge you will be charged. We disputed this and the charges were dropped. Another hold up I had with this hotel, is that there was no doorman at the door facing Georgia Street. I took public transit to the hotel, so we did not come in though the back doors (where the bellmen are) It was frustrating an awkward trying to walk into the hotel through a revolving door with my luggage. The front desk staff saw us struggling and did not offer to help, nor were they friendly or helpful during check-in. I am sad to say that the Faimont did not live up to its name.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything- Great Hotel, Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: 1beachroamer
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night. got a great deal using travel agent discount, went to KOBE steak house got half off using Entertainment card, Paid $5 to park down the street from hotel and walked to everything. Hotel is close to Robson street and all of its bustling activities. Great jazz in lobby. Room was spacious and nice. Pool and fitness center ok. They even have a small pool for babies. Fairmont is a great brand and they lived up to thier reputation. Feel free to contact me with questions. Join the Presidents club on their website and get free hi speed internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: Swissdiver
Reviews.Content: I was in Vancouver for a conference and did not book myself the hotel. Actually, I didn't know the Fairmont hotel chain. It was a pleasant surprise. Check in was quite efficient with open minded staff that allowed me to change my room and visit a couple of others to make my choice. Place was quite nice, quite well located. Food was good, with a very lively bar. Internet is available for free provided you register in the Fairmont President Club (free). In short, a quite good choice for a business trip, as probably for a leisure one.

Reviews.Title: “Find somewhere else ... !”
Reviews.Author: nzchick23
Reviews.Content: This place is a huge disappointment ... the only thing nice about it is the location (and the very helpful Housekeeping staff) ... front-line reception staff stuck-up & not helpful ... very average and find the 4star rating questionable ... no refrigerator in the room (we had to ask for one to be brought in - at least it was free) and we wouldnt have known that you could get one if not for one of the housekeeping people .. they also advised us what to touch & what not to touch or else get charged for (the locked sensorised mini-bar & the sensor plate on which stood 2 bottles of overpriced water - you touch you pay) ... no utensils in the room, they obviously think everyone who stays there should eat out .. dog but not people friendly, wouldnt go there again ...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelMad1983
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on the Fairmont Vancouver through Travelzoo at around £80.00 / £129 CAD per night for our two-night stay. The hotel is in a great location, the service is great and the rooms are huge for a city centre hotel. Would definitely recommend this place to others.

Reviews.Title: “whats the big deal?”
Reviews.Author: bungadoo
Reviews.Content: As my cousin works for fairmont hotels, I got a good deal and decided to take my daughter to stay in a "fancy" hotel for her birthday. The front desk people were really nice and they gave my kids toys to keep when we checked in. The room was nothing special. Honestly, Ive had nicer rooms at best westerns than this. The bathroom definately shows the age of the hotel as well. My kids were crawling around on the floor and found old food under the bed. This, I wouldnt bat an eye at usually, because I usually stay at the cheap places, but at a 4 star hotel! The pool sucked too. I figured for the price, they would have a decent pool, but it was old and cold. At least they did have a tiny little kid pool, and I mean tiny. They also tried to charge me $20 extra upon check out because I opened the fridge! I told them I just wanted to put my youngest little ones milk somewhere and I didnt eat anything. They said they would let it go but their fridges have a sensor on them and they charge you if you even open it to look. Mabey my expectations were high, as I thought this would be a "fancy" hotel, but dont let the nice lobby fool you. I was very dissapointed. I think next time we decide to stay somewhere for fun, we'll go back to the rainbow country Inn in chilliwack, that place is awesome and kicks hotel vancouvers pretentious butt! And, they dont charge you $30 for parking!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, as always!”
Reviews.Author: traveldays
Reviews.Content: When in Vancouver we always stay in this hotel. It's great! Clean, elegant, best location in the city! The staff are always extremly nice and most helpful! Make sure you say hello to the two resident dogs, Beau and Mavis. The rooms are spacious and the beds are very comfortable! If you have time take a swim in the great hotel pool!

Reviews.Title: “This is a hotel that gets it right in every way”
Reviews.Author: ConstitutionalLaw
Reviews.Content: The Vancouver Fairmont downtown is a wonderful and charming hotel. Extremely clean, well situated and staff are courteous and expeditious. Fairmont in Vancouver is exceptional in every way and so is the Fairmont at the Vancouver Airport --equally as good as the downtown location. Vancouver downtown is housed in a Victorian elegant stone - copper guilded building which is absolutely gorgeous. And the Vancouver airport is a new state of the art building, noise buffering is excellent. Two very different hotels from an aesthetic perspective but both equally have super service and sanitation is superior.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near restaurants in town centre.”
Reviews.Author: BJSSMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Likes: central location, old world charm, very comfortable bed. Dislikes: off-hand service, large and very impersonal. Electronic sensors in fridge - don't even move something as you will be charged, a nuisance indeed as there was no extra space if you want to chill something else. And $8.00 is excessive for a small bottle of water. Very noisy plumbing when you flush. Long corridors and general ambience reminded me of the film "The Shining" - creepy. Lack of free internet a turn-off as well, given the room rates. The location & comfort were good, but you can probably do better - so not sure I'd recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Rates but only OK service”
Reviews.Author: EastmeetsWestAB
Reviews.Content: We never been to Vancouver. So we have decided to book this Fairmont Hotel to use as a base to explore, particularly, when they are advertising this hotel under the banner of "Great Rates, Great Escape!!!!" . The rate under this is fantastic value. As predicted, the location of this hotel was fantastic and easy to get around. From the airport to the hotel by coach is only 30mins. I have stayed in several Fairmont hotels and I must admit the service of this hotel is only OK not exceptional. Everything seems to be such a rush when you are asking reception any questions. The conceirge service is very variable. Some is fantastic and they will try and let you enjoy your stay in Vancouver using minimal budget. Some will try and entice you to book tours with them. Personally I do not like this as they are not honest enough. The room that we have is massive. Decor is very traditional. However the bed is very comfortable. The wall is pretty thin though!!! The spa that the hotel has is very good. I did have a lovely treatment. However it is not particularly cheap. With the rate that they are quoting, I will definitely come back again. However I do think there are room for improvement in some of their services.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad stay, service, food and room ok”
Reviews.Author: Pepysp
Reviews.Content: Pretty good hotel. The check in service is good, although having to stand in a short queue with only one person on check in with other hotel staff standing around could be done better. The room was good, quiet and well appointed. Bathrooms a bit dated and I really didn't like two trays in the rooms with biscuits and water all wired up with clear instructions when I checked in that I would be charged if I touched them. Three reasons that I thought this inappropriate. Firstly, paying over $300 per night should mean that I would expect a bottle of water free, secondly, as a regular business traveller I didn't expect to be told if I touched the biscuits or water I would be charged. Thirdly, having wooden trays with electric wires hanging from them was unsightly in a five star hotel. Breakfast was good and the service at the bar and in the restaurant was good.

Reviews.Title: “A typical Fairmont experience”
Reviews.Author: jason416
Reviews.Content: A pretty typical hotel for the historic Fairmont hotels across Canada. Centrally located in Downtown Vancouver it makes a good business stay and can be found very close to Robson Street shopping and Canada Place. After work it was convenient because after changing out of the suit/tie shopping and the view of the North Shore was only 5-6 minutes away. If you're an avid runner you will also find that Stanley Park is 2k away and I highly recommend the run along the sea wall of ~8k within the park. I stayed here in a spacious room with a very comfortable king-sized bed with some soft, down pillows. The decor is old but well maintained. The carpet is clearly old but modernity is there when you would most appreciate it - namely the flat-screen Sharp TV (~30 or so inches) and air conditioning/heating console. The washrooms are lined with marble on the floors and sink counters and the walls are tiled like a public washroom. The washroom is also fairly well equiped for the elderly and physically challenged as well with support bars on the wall near the toilet and the bathtub. The shower head is adjustable but could use an upgrade and is showing its age. The service is good. Food is expensive and beyond my company's stipend so I only took advantage of the $30 breakfast once. There are high-end boutiques (Louis Vuitton) in the lobby, a health club, conference rooms, pretty typical for a hotel in the heart of the city as grand as this one, I probably wouldn't stay here on a personal trip because I'd prefer a more modern hotel that caters to a younger generation but I'd say if you are looking for a more classic hotel experience and have the money to spend, then this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Not for me”
Reviews.Author: liljro
Reviews.Content: The architecture of the hotel looked beautiful so we decided to stay here & splurge for one night. The lobby looks really nice with Gucci & Louis Vuitton stores. We checked in early since we drove from Seattle for 3 hours with no problem. They asked us if we wanted a lower or higher level room. We chose the higher level room to view the city. As I walked in the room I was not too impressed. The room look very outdated & looks like grandma designed it since it had flower wallpaper everywhere. I checked out the restroom & surprise someone else forgot to flush the toilet which was gross. The shower doesn't have good water pressure. I was going to complain & make a big fuzz but my husband stopped me. For this kind of money I would expect better rooms & services. Since I was staying at the Radisson in Seattle for majority of the time I prefered the Radisson than this dump. The only positive thing I can say is that it's located in a good location close to shops.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - Not without fair share of headaches though.”
Reviews.Author: globalmikey
Reviews.Content: Lovely Hotel. Grand old Building. Beautiful decor which is in the style of the era it was built. I loved it. Courtesy of staff was high. Well done. :) Efficiency of staff was low. Not well done. :( Travelling with My dad, aunty and Grandma. 4 of us. Ok, the problems - 1) Front Desk - Long Story short. We extended our stay whilst there and front desk stuffed up our bookings and bedding config requests which caused a huge headache when we were checking in. Problem was resolved though however took some time and some huffing and puffing. 2) Over Charging - Due to the error with the booking of rooms we were given 2 extra rooms complimentary. When i got home i noticed i was charged for these comp rooms. Had to huff and puff on the phone and demand it be fixed straight away as i was about to be fobbed off by the reservations call centre. I had to pull out my "Im a travel agentt" line.. which i dont like to do. Problem was resolved and apologies made. I am checking my Visa statment every hour though ;) 3) Had to ring twice to get clothes line in Bathroom fixed.. still was not fixed so gave up. This is marketed as a high end hotel and prices reflect this. Unfortunately i would find it hard to recommend considering the troubles that i experienced. And they even knew i was a Travel Agent for an Airline that they have a strong relationship with. Tisk tisk. Maybe will stay here again in the future. We will see.

Reviews.Title: “what happened to customer service??”
Reviews.Author: southgranville
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel many times before and I love the Fairmont hotels,( especially the Chateau Frontenac - Quebec city, and Empress-Victoria.) We love beautiful historic hotels. We have never had a problem at the Vancouver Fairmont before either. However-. this time we stayed one night in a Junior Suite, after a Christmas party. We weren't in the room that much before our party, but later on that evening when we went to bed we heard alot of talking from the next room to us (thin walls?) and for some reason a service -type door kept opening and shutting across from our room, which we also heard through out the night! Most rooms we have had in the past at any Fairmont Hotel are quiet, no problem. We did notice that this particular suite had the bed as soon as you walked into the room very close to the wall and entrance door, and the sitting area/tv room was a seperate room closer to the window. Maybe the configuration of our room contributed to us hearing noise in the hallway, but we felt the walls seemed thin. Our check in was okay, but the staff were not very friendly except for the valet/car men, who were friendly and welcoming.After check in and on our way to the elevator, we went over to the dog they have in their lobby and the person who handles the dog didn't smile, look at us, nothing....no 'welcome to the Fairmont... the dogs name is..such and such'....nothing! Very unfriendly. We had paid for another couple's room (jr. suite like ours) so we wanted to make sure all charges for them and ourselves were put on to our bill. Upon our check out early the next day,my husband was given the final bill which he paid for, but because we asked the woman at the front desk a few questions about some charges on our bill (which she clearly wasn't happy about) she called out her supervisor who was condescending towards my questions. The charges were correct- no problem. When we went to get our car and leave, the valet man told us that there had been quite a few staff changes the last 6 months. Maybe that is the problem, but their customer service -hospitality needs to be worked on. There are many beautiful hotels in the downtown Vancouver area. The Fairmont is beautiful and if you get a quiet room you will enjoy your stay, but alot of the staff we experienced were very unprofessional for that class of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Oh my god - wow!”
Reviews.Author: Skye82
Reviews.Content: Wow, is the best word to describe this hotel. We ended our two week honeymoon tour of Canada at the Fairmont and it was fantastic. We wanted to end with luxury so booked a Gold room, not really sure what we'd be getting, but it was so much more than we could have expected. The gold floor is situated on floor 9 and you get your own private check-in desk (always friendly and ready to help you at any time), your own private lounge with free access to computer and printer, private kitchenette area where all hot/soft drinks are free (there's an honour bar for alcoholic drinks), canapes served between 5 and 7 each day (very tasty) and breakfast served in the private lounge (very good breakfast). This floor is like a hotel within a hotel. The rest of the hotel is still very impressive and equally friendly, but if you don't want the hustle and bustle you can sit quietly away from it all. Our room was lovely, a huge very comfy bed, robes and slippers and just generally luxurious - a perfect end to a perfect honeymoon really. The main bar area in the hotel was very nice and the perfect place to sit and relax after a days sightseeing, and it was nice to listen to the musicians as well. If we go back to Vancouver we'll certainly be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Vancouver Hotel”
Reviews.Author: scottca075
Reviews.Content: There are about four hotels I try to book when I am coming to Vancouver on business. The Pan Pacific, The Fairmont Waterfront, Sutton Place (and the Sylvia if my parents are coming) and the Fairmont Vancouver. Of them all, this is my favorite. The Pan Pacific & Fairmont Waterfront have more stunning locations and the Sutton Place has a better business feel, but the Fairmont Vancouver is everything I like in a hotel. It oozes Old World charm. It has the grace and elegance I look for in a hotel. Coming here feels like slipping on comfortable old slippers and an evening jacket. The rooms are very comfortable and have everything you expect in a modern hotel. The dining is very elegant, a nice blend of Northwest & French. And Afternoon Tea is oh so civilized. Pleasant is just the best way to describe it.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay....but!”
Reviews.Author: LeedsPaulM
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Vancouver in September for a pre and post cruise stay. The pre cruise stay was excellent, the room being bright and spacious and on a location looking down Georgia and Burrard. Check in was slow and we had the impression that there was "No room at the inn...", however we were allocated a room eventually. Post cruise was a big disappointment, the room was small, dark and needed some attention. Looking at the emergency escape procedure map, our room was the smallest on the floor!! The rest of the hotel was very good. On final day checkout we were given somebodies drinks/food tab to pay, but that was sorted fairly quickly. Had the post cruise room being up to the same standard as the pre cruise room, we would have given it 5 stars, but it wasn't. so it has to be 4 stars, but a very good 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: GazPerth
Reviews.Content: After much uncertainty about where to stay for our first trip to Vancouver we stayed at the Fairmont Vancouver. This is certainly a grand old hotel which is in a great location. Its only about 2 minutes from Robson Street in one direction and the Pacific Centre Mall in the other. Its also only about a 15 minute walk at most, to Gastown. So I'm not sure you could do much better from a location point of view. We had mixed experience regarding accomodation however. We originally booked what should have been a great room on the 14th floor. But found ourselves close to the service elevators that kept us awake all night. Also while the lobby is great, I found the hotel in general a bit "gloomy" given the dark wood everywhere and fairly drab decore. But this is to be expected given the age of the building and on that front I guess the hotel has done a good job in keeping the original feel. But given our experience with the room we moved the next day onto the Fairmont Gold floor. And boy what a difference. Very elegant, well decorated, exceptional servive, light and airy and with very well appointed rooms. So I would have to say that if we stayed in the general area of the hotel, I may have come away a little disappointed. But on the Gold floor I was very happy. I dont think the Fairmont could have been better in terms of location and overall the hotel is elegant. But if you are expecting the rooms to match the elegance of the foyer, I think you would have to stay on the Fairmont Gold floor. But in saying that, this is an old hotel that has been very well cared for to maintain its old world charm. So if thats what you are looking for, I think most would be well pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm”
Reviews.Author: 1tracman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Vancouver before, different name-same Hotel. We stayed in a huge suite on the Queens floor with all the amenities possible. Too much money and enough room for 10 people, we felt lost. The hotel is in good shape but dated, it needs some modernization. The staff were very friendly, but always had thier hand out for a tip. Check in was confusing and we had to go to two seperate desks to check in, no big deal. The location is about perfect for downtown Vancouver, and the room was clean and comfortable. Next time we will stay near the water at one of the hotels there. This place was just too expensive for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Vancouver Addict”
Reviews.Author: Jasper-2002
Reviews.Content: Staying here for 4 nights just before Xmas was a real treat. The room was outstanding and the food and service were very good. Well worth a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Why_leave_a_name
Reviews.Content: Spent a week in August here and have nothing but praise for the hotel. Excellent service and amenities. Staff can't do enough for you. Appreciated the towel and bottle of water concierge handed me when returning from early morning runs - and Beau the labrador, available for walks for homesick dog lovers! Leisure centre and pool a bit small but fine. Hotel has great character after all the dull modern blocks in central Vancouver. Thoroughly recommend the place.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely on the outside, dated on the inside”
Reviews.Author: JuniorBHalifax
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a beautiful structure on the outside and the lobby is lovely. The staff are very pleasant and helpful. However, this hotel needs a major overall in the room department. The rooms are stuffy, extremely noisy and uncomfortable. You can actually hear the person in the next room speaking as if he/she were standing in your own room. This has become an old person's hotel and it is resting on the Fairmont laurels. They don't even have a proper towel washing policy for environmentally friendly guests. I realize the hotel is an older hotel and some renovations were done at sometime, but it is not a place I would recommend to anyone who wanted a comfortable, quiet room. On a bright note, the concierge desk is fantastic, in particular, David and Emiko. Everything they have ever recommended is great. It is also a great central location.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful central and spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: kaybee57
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfectly located for a first -timer into Vancouver. Allowed us the ability to stroll around central Vancouver at ease and never be far from our rest-stop! This was the first of our Fairmont Hotels to stay at on our trip involving 3 of them - would have joined the Presidents Club ASAP just for the free internet access if we had known. Loved the hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury”
Reviews.Author: tdub2000
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed a stay at this property. Spacious rooms, flawless service from the staff, fantastic location (steps away from the Vancouver Art Gallery). Nice pool and whirlpool area too (grab a cup of their refreshing cucumber-infused water on your way out .) As it rained one of our days there, we were thankful for the Fairmont umbrella left in our room. Lots of nice touches all around. Stay here and enjoy....

Reviews.Title: “Too old!”
Reviews.Author: newyorklover123
Reviews.Content: Got upgraded to the Penthouse! Restaurant was not great. Nice location and decorations for Christmas! Service mediocre

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about this hotel -- except.....”
Reviews.Author: TirzahRuth
Reviews.Content: It's a super hotel! Mavis and Beau are very sweet and patient hosts; the concierge desk is most efficient and pleasant. My room was tasteful, very quiet and I had no complaints. Location is perfect for people who like being able to stroll around in a very pleasant urban center. Absolutely the only thing objectionable about this hotel is that the guest is nickeled and dimed to death with $1.95 charge for local and 800 telephone calls, and a $5 for 15 minutes of computer time to check e-mail! During non-business hours when the computer center is not staffed and the guest is admitted by a key card, it can be a little creepy since this room is in a very isolated area. The annoying charges are avoidable, however, by joining the "President's Club", which is free. Next time you stay at a Fairmont, as a President's Club member, you are not charged for these services. If you "collect" historic hotels during your travels, the Hotel Vancouver should be on your want list. It's the newest (1939) of the great railroad hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: edrosanthal
Reviews.Content: Fairmont Hotel Vancouver is the best experience we have had in Vancouver. We have also stayed at the Pan Pacific, Four Seasons, Sutton and Hyatt and even their sister property fairmont water front previously. But of all Hotel Vancouver was the best. Its the people be it at the Concierge or reception or house keeping or Lounge they were outstanding and the old world chram hotel provided us a pleasent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lkat75
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in July 2008. Rooms were clean and well maintained. The concierge was extremely helpful in recommending restaurants and helping plan a day trip to Victoria. We got a good deal by staying 3 nights and getting the 4th night free. Otherwise, the bill would have been a bit much. That being said, I have no complaints and would recommend this hotel. Oh and the dogs are a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “couldn't believe it”
Reviews.Author: 1934 pah
Reviews.Content: Fairmont Hotel Vancouver Wonderful, historic, convenient hotel, however we had a wooden crib with the slats that are unsafe for babies - it was unusable.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: maldivesod
Reviews.Content: This is a very beautiful, grand and sophisticated property. The king standard room was spacious with wonderful details -- very nice peaceful colors. The bathroom looked recently updated and spotless. Quality toiletries and luxurious bed and bedding. Tea kettle in addition to coffee maker was a nice to have. Central location--shopping and restaurants in walking distance. Staff were wonderfully helpful. Well worth the price!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Hotel But Not Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: AlbeyUSA
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Fairmont Hotel in downtown Vancouver for a conference I was attending. The service and location were excellent, however the room itself was only slightly above average. Also, when I arrived on time at check-in, my room was not ready. The beds and bathroom were fine, although the bathroom was not quite as clean as one would expect from a 5-star hotel. The iron in the room was broken. My biggest complaint was the noise level I could hear from adjoining rooms and the hallway. At night I would hear my neighbors talking, and doors closing nearby. I guess I expected more peace and quite in the room, and was disappointed with that. The hotel service and staff were pleasant, and were very helpful at all times. I found Vancouver to be an expensive city, and the hotel was no different. Service fees were attached to almost everything, but I knew that going in. Overall, it was a nice hotel, but I have stayed at much better, less expensive, hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler78NY
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a long weekend at the Hotel Vancouver and can't rave enough about our stay. The hotel is located at the very heart of downtown Vancouver in a gorgeous old building that is a delightful antidote to the usual, modern (read: bland) downtown hotel towers. The service and staff were first-rate. The concierge gave us several helpful recommendations and housekeeping did a great job cleaning our room and even refreshing our room in the evening. Being a historical hotel, the bathrooms aren't as large or luxurious as we have come to expect from modern hotels, but all the charms of the property more than make up for it. I couldn't recommend the hotel more. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay; very good location”
Reviews.Author: Mme_X
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I stayed at this hotel for a conference, and for 5 nights. Again, it was a wonderful stay, and I'd return in a minute. I had a standard room, #575, that overlooked a side street, but not bad when the view is of Tiffany and a Ports 1961 shop. Other than the occasional emergency siren, we were not bothered by street noise. The hotel is well located to shopping, cafes, restaurants, the musuem, transit options (e.g. express bus to the U of British Columbia, as well as the regular bus routes.) It is an easy walk to English Bay, Stanley Park, the ferry to Granville Island, etc. if you don't mind a 15 minute walk. The room was very comfortable and a good size. The beds were supremely comfortable, with 4 pillows per bed (I'm sure you could get other types if you ask.) I am VERY thankful that this hotel includes a top sheet as well as the duvet-style blanket that many hotels have gone towards. This means that I can use a little cover if I feel warm, but not have to crank up the AC as when some hotels try to save money by omitting the top sheet. The room came with two club chairs and a table, and a large writing desk. Very good internet connections. Complete coffee/tea service, i.e. a coffee pot AND an electric tea kettle. Flat screen TV, iron/board, minibar, umbrella, and walk-in closet. What I missed: no in-room safe (surprising for a good higher-end business class hotel.) There was enough room to have two suitcases set out on luggage racks, if needed. It would have been nice to have had more than 3 drawers and the nightstand, but I'm getting picky. Complimentary shoe shine service. Spotless housekeeping all around. Very minor picky points: the maid forgot the bathroom waterglasses one day; coffee for the coffee service another. Otherwise, everthing was fine. ( I suppose I shouldn't complain when I had the nerve to grab the gorgeous orchid bud vase from a past-used breakfast cart in the hall -- how can you send that out when it was in such perfect condition? We kept it in our room.) The bathroom has a generous assortment of toiletries from Miller Harris - shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, body lotion, soaps. Some may not want the light citrus fragrance, but we fragrance junkies love it. The pedestal sink has a good-size rim to catch stuff, and the glass shelves provide a lot of room for your own toiletries. I LOVE the fact that the room comes with 2 robes. The tub is a bit dated, but large. Complaint: the water control is located for someone standing up in the shower, not comfortable for someone taking a bath. The service everywhere, including the shops, was friendly, helpful, and efficient. My guest sharing the room made a lot of use of the concierges, and was able to run all over town and interesting neighborhoods with great aplomb and confidence. Trust the concierges' restaurant recommendations. Other reviewers complained of long waits -- this was never a problem. Vancouver has great shopping, but you might also want to peruse the hotel shops -- hair and body treats in the salon in the lower level, a Snowflake shop for women's clothing, outerwear, and accessories. Try the maple candies in the newstand/gift shop. Gucci, Vuitton, and St. John shops are also on site. The cocktail lounges are lovely in the grand hotel fashion, with a pianist at cocktails, and singer in the evening. Very good cocktails, wines, etc. although the champagne by the glass was a little pricey ($25 CN - such are French imports.) There is also afternoon tea served here. It would be a nice respite even if you weren't staying at the hotel, but if you were shopping in the area or at the musuem, or stopping for drinks. The hotel has a very nice glassed-in pool on a rooftop, changing room, and spa. The pool is not resort-size enormous, but as good as can be expected in town, and you can do laps. The gym seemed well fitted, but I was more interested in walking in the nice weather. We ate all our meals elsewhere. Vancouver is a great food city, and the weather was fine, so we wanted to get out. Also: there are numerous cafes and coffee shops in the area for breakfast. I am a member of the Fairmont President's Club, but did not book into the club level this trip. The amenities for those rooms have been great in the past, but between conference rates and my schedule, we dedcided not to. On the next trip here, I should investigate. Our stay in the standard room was very nice, but the club level has often added to the enjoyment. Did you know that there is a house dog you can walk if you want to feel like a local? Beau or Mavis is available, and beautifully behaved dogs (Labradors.) Fair warning if you are alergic to dogs -- they reside by the concierge desk. To wrap up -- this is a wonderful stay in a wonderful city in a wonderful location. Even with a conference and other guests, the hotel was lively but not overwhelmed by people (six well-functioning elevators and segregated conference floors helped.) The hotel is a large size, but never felt cold or impersonal. I'd be delighted to return.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: MartSan
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel, we stayed here for one night after we arrived to Vancouver. The staff is exactly what you would expect, very (VERY) friendly and helpful. The room we stayed is was a standard room but very spacious and clean and furnished with typicall fairmont. furniture, which I love. We had little time and were suffering from a jetlag, so we didn't swim or anything but overall it was a wonderfull stay. The only downside about our stay was our breakfast. We had ordered our breakfast in our room, but I think we did something wrong because we only had four small pieces of toast and a can of coffee delivered in our room. We were in a hurry so we didn't really say anything and just gave our son the toast. When he was eating we heard a ticking sound on the window ( we were at the fourth floor) When we held the curtain back we looked at a white seagull who was obviously hungry. Our son asked us if he could give him some toast and eneded up feeding him his entire breakfast through the window...(lol) A little later, Just before we left the room I couldn't find my credit card anywhere. I tried to think back and was almost certain the reception still had it. We went down to the lobby and I asked the receptionist if they still had it, as I couldn't remember getting it back. He started looking and ended up by removing all the computers to see if it might have slipped underneath. While he was doing that more employees started helping him and at one point there were five members of hotel staff looking for my card. After and hour or so they appologized to us that they couldn't find it and told us we could make all the international phonecalls we wanted to block our card etc... I'm so ashamed to say that at the end of our holliday I found my card. Tucked away "safely"in a very small compartment of our suitcase.... (blush) Anyway I'm sure you'll get my point, the Fairmont staff to us was simpy the best. Besides looking for silly customers's credit cards they really make every effort to make you comortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience here”
Reviews.Author: PacNWtraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights while up in Vancouver attending some concerts. Location can't be beat. I travelled from Seattle via Amtrak. Tip: Take the "sky train" light rail from the station near the train station to the Burrard station, and walk less than a block to the Fairmont Hotel Vancouver. Alternately, a cab takes about 5-7 minutes and costs about $7. During my stay, I made use of my room, the concierge desk and Griffith's (the cafe/restaurant). Also, due to the toiletries in the room being oranged-based (I have an allergy to orange), I had a special request for alternate toiletries that was handled by the front desk. (Just letting you know what I will and won't be discussing.) First, the room. In contrast to reviews that cited rooms that were dated, a bit worn, or small, I had a nice-sized room with a king bed, dresser (with LCD TV on top), desk, and table and chairs. Everything was in tip-top shape, and the mattress was the kind with a firmly-defined edge (which I really like). My closet wasn't the walk-in kind that one review cited; it had sliding doors. As others have mentioned, the bathrooms are a bit dated, but well-maintained, and frankly, the porcelain pedestal sink idea is trendily antique these days.
