I have an allergy to tobacco and am very sensitive to air quality, and I had no problems in this hotel. I also opened the window about an inch to further add some fresh air "just in case". Second, the concierge desk. They had great information when I talked to them, and seemed to have great information for others. It didn't have the feel of many concierge desks where they steer you to the places from which the hotel gets a kickback, and I appreciated that. The challenge was getting to talk to them, because apparently every other guest knows their staff is really useful as well! Most of the times I wanted concierge assistance, there was a line. In one case, the guest in front of me required 15 minutes of assistance, asking more than a dozen questions... and I had one simple question to ask, that I couldn't ask until they were done (oh, and did I mention that there had been others in the queue in front of them? I waited upwards of 20 minutes that time to speak to a concierge). Once a consultation has gone on for 10 minutes, and includes waiting while guests look over menus and ask questions, maybe a polite stall tactic is appropriate, as in, "Here, why don't you take a look at these menus and gather up some more questions while I see if I can assist the next person in line?". It's tough to balance showing customer service to the current party *and* customer service to waiting parties in that situation. I'm not sure what the right answer is. Third, Griffith's. The breakfast buffet may SEEM expensive, but if you get two sides and two different drinks (juice and tea), you can find yourself spending nearly as much, for much less food. Another reviewer indicated that this felt like a standard hotel cafe. I agree, and I don't mind that, because if it had been more formal, I might have felt out of place in my Seattle polar fleece and khakis. ;-) Fourth, service for my strange special request. Let me say that I don't like that so many hotels are moving to orange-based things (cleaners, toiletries, etc.). Some people (including me) react as poorly to orange as others do to peanut. That being said, my request for alternate toiletries was initially handled by the staff picking some up from the hotel sundries shop, and then later delivering a set of the older toiletries they'd used for their Gold floor rooms before those were replaced by the orange ones. This is my fourth trip to Vancouver. I haven't been impressed by any other hotels I've stayed in here. I'll be coming back to this one, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mm4113
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Fairmont in downtown Vancouver for a business trip. The location of the hotel is smack dab in the middle of downtown and is convenient to everything. Shopping, restaurants, etc. are just a walk outside your hotel. The rooms are nothing special and actually were somewhat run down. After a multi-million dollar renovation I expected more. The rooms are huge and spacious though. Also, the sound of sirens and cars driving by at night kept me awake and I was perched on the 15th floor. One of the best features of the hotel was the two yellow lab/golden retriever dogs that were part of the lobby landscape. These dogs are owned by the hotel and are available to any guest to take on walks or just give a quick pet as you walk to through the lobby. Great feeling of home with that detail. Overall, a nice stay, great location but uncomfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Vancouver - Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: SoCalBC
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Vancouver over Valentine's Day weekend 2008. Upon research, we decided on the Fairmont Vancouver Downtown (based upon reviews on Tripadvisor). The hotel is in an excellent location, it's worth the 4-5 star rating for it's accommodations (see below), but mostly the professionalism of the staff both at the concierge desk and presidents club desk (tip, get a membership in presidents club, it's free, and there are upgrades and perks at the hotel). All of the staff was helpful in directions, places to see, etc. including assisting in obtaining tickets to the hockey game and other entertainment in the city. The hotel is across the street from the Art Gallery, two blocks from the main shopping street in Vancouver, and the underground mall. As well as, five blocks from old town (Gastown area) and China Town, .8 km (1/2 mile) from the Arena and Stanley Park. Inside the hotel there's a Gucci Store among other high end retail establishments, including Tiffany's across the street. Amenities in the hotel are top of the line, the rooms are large, with a small walk in closet, and a full size bathroom and tub.. There is no safe in the room but there's a minibar. There's an indoor pool, Hot Tub, children's splash pool, dry sauna, and full workout facility are complimentary for all hotel guests. There are a few restaurants in the hotel, including room service, we only ate at the lounge (the food was expensive, usual for hotels) but decent. The afternoon Tea Time was pleasant and enjoyable. Overall, the Fairmont exceeded expectations, the staff treated all guests (from what we observed) including ourselves with class and exceptional service, whether a Preferred Member or regular guest. The service was better than most other Platinum/Gold/etc. membership service that other hotels have on site throughout North America from my experience. Upon returning to Vancouver we plan on staying at the hotel again. Additional tips: fly directly into YVR (Vancouver), customs is quick/easy, since driving from Seattle takes 3+ hours each way. Car rentals are inexpensive, but parking isn't downtown (around $25+ a day). Taxi's are the preferred method of transportation, and are inexpensive, around $30 to/from the airport (most taxi's are Hybrids). Public transportation is readily available and goes everyone, walking is safe and easy too throughout the downtown area. There's a coffee shop on almost every corner, on one corner there were two Starbucks across from one another and a local coffee shop on the other. Take the water taxi from downtown to Granville Island ($3.50 each way PP) and Sea Bus to North Vancouver/North Shore.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: urkidn
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night with a friend. Check-in seemed to go well until I got to the room and the key didn't work. As I walked back to the elevator with my luggage a young bellman appeared and tried the door as well. He escorted me back to the reception desk and another key was quickly produced. That was the only hiccup of our stay. My friend is a smoker, so we had a smoking room on a high floor. My friend was quite taken with the Gargoyle outside our window. The room was spacious, comfortable and traditionally decorated which quite suited it considering the age of the building itself. The beds were comfy and being two girls, we appreciated the bathrobes and the mirrored table outside the bathroom. The closet was a huge walk-in which could be roomy enough to sleep a couple of kids! We did not have time to use any of the facilities or the restaurant but I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel. Location can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: dom_nique
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights at the beginning of February. I booked my room through Otel.com. If you're not familiar with this website, check it out. I found the hotel rates were much lower than other travel booking websites like Expedia or Hotels.ca. On top of having low rates, you can collect "dollar points" everytime you book a hotel through them that can be used towards future bookings. Very cool! I paid $135 CAD per night for a Fairmont Room (king bed). I arrived around noon on a Thursday. Check in was quick and I was immediately given a room. The room was rather on the small side but I was by myself so I didn't mind. I thought the furninshings were beautiful and in great condition. The bathroom is average size but could definitely be remodeled. The bathtub/sink/toilet are old and need to be replaced. The tub was so old that it looks like one of those tubs that never quite looks clean regardless of how much you scrub. There was a LCD TV in the room, but the hotel does not appear to have HD cable, which makes the picture kind of distorted (either that or Paris Hilton has put on a LOT of weight!) Overall, the room was clean but could have been cleaner (note comments about the tub and the furniture probably hadn't been properly dusted in a week or two). The bed was VERY comfortable however, I slept well. Overall, I thought the room was very quiet. No street noise and I couldn't hear my neighbours in the room next door. There was some noise in the hallways but that didn't really bother me. The location of the hotel is perfect. I used to live in Vancouver and I know the downtown area quite well. I couldn't imagine a better spot to be in for tourists. Robson street is a block away, the Pacific Centre (big downtown mall is also a block away). The seabus to North Vancouver (towards Capilano Suspension Bridge and Grouse Mountain) is a quick 10 minute walk from the hotel. Stanley park is a 15-20-minute leasurely walk along the seawall from the hotel. There are plenty of restaurants and shopping within a three block radius. And it's in a safe part of town, so no worrie there. You can also take the skytrain at the Pacific Centre, which again is about a 90 second walk away. Food- I ate at the Griffins restaurant one night and had a delicious steak (really well cooked, and I'm picky about my steak). I also had brunch on the Saturday, which was also quite good. But at 26$ + tax + tip a head, I would probably give a pass. There are a few restaurants just outside the hotel that serve a good breakfast for a lot less. Overall, service was quite friendly. I had a late afternoon flight and they let me keep my room a couple of hours after check out at no extra cost. I saw the dogs a couple of times in the lobby. They're definitely adorable but I've never seen dogs so blasé about getting attention from humans. Clearly they're getting too much of it (which is better than not enough I suppose)! Overall, a great stay at a lovely hotel. I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Traditional but exceptional”
Reviews.Author: LilyLarkin
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont is a wonderful, wonderful hotel - especially if you are lucky enough to stay on the Fairmont Gold floor. It is very traditional in decor, but you know for sure that a lot of expense has gone into creating the rooms. Service is exceptional - as we found all over Vancouver, to be honest - and staff make a real effort with guests. We couldn't justify purchasing anything from the mini-bar (very pricey, but aren't all mini-bars?!), but we loved being looked after properly in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, but needs an update”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelerya
Reviews.Content: of course the Fairmont is probably one of Vancouver's finest, but rooms are very dated. It is a traditional hotel, but decor and colours could be updated. Location is good, but with my family we prefer the Granville Island hotel with beautiful views of downtown and the Market with numerous fresh foods to eat. Although there are many good restaurants within walking distance of the Fairmont. Fairmont is a good hotel if you are there on business. Our two year old son did love the dogs and the life size Thomas the Tank engine at the front desk and of course the room service delivered bedtime cookies and milk are a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “So-so suite life”
Reviews.Author: CompressedChi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Hotel Vancouver from September 6-10. We made our reservation through the Fairmont President's Club, of which we have been longstanding members. The hotel, like many others in the Fairmont chain, is a chateau-style grande dame located in the heart of downtown Vancouver adjacent to the Art Museum and near all the tony shops. Our package included suite accommodations and breakfast daily with two tickets to the special exhibit at the museum. The room was very nice, with a large sitting area, though the bathroom was quite small and cramped for two people to be in at once. The hotel thoughtfully sent us a afternoon snack tray with chocolates and fruit which we were thoroughly enjoying until another couple let themselves into our room--apparently they were booked into the same room! After that was straightened out, we managed to enjoy the rest of our stay. The hotel has two dogs, which are lent out to hotel guests to walk around town with--lots of fun, and the concierge was very good at getting difficult to come by tables at great restaurants. The pool and gym and locker room facilities were great and very clean. If you are a member of President's Club, you have complimentary Wi-Fi internet access on your own laptop which came in very handy. Our one real problem with our stay is that after we checked out, we were billed a second time for things that were initially taken off our bill at check out. For example, breakfast was included but showed up on our bill. The receptionist took it off, but then we were rebilled for it later on our credit card. We are still in the process of correcting this with AMEX. It unfortunately leaves a bad taste in your mouth when you think back upon your experience. Other than that, everyone was very pleasant and helpful and we're sorry that we couldn't rate this stay as perfect.

Reviews.Title: “The Fairmont Hillbillies”
Reviews.Author: Fairmontboy13
Reviews.Content: OMG AMAZING have to be my first words,now you maybe wondering why i gave my review this name,its because i come from a lower-middle class family we dont have much money we aren't poor but we certainly aren't "keeping up with jones'es".But when the 3 of us walked through that door into that cinderella castle like lobby our mouths dropped to the floor and we all of a sudden felt like kings and queens,this was a real shock to all of us because we were expecting some cheap knock of hilton but boy was this better than a hilton!SSWWWAAANNKKAAYYY i mean this is were celebrity's stay,the service was amazing anything we wanted we got! There's a day spa,giant pool,victorian restaurant,turn of the century architecture,fancy room service,chefs,butlers,basketball court,and tennis court ,of course you will have to pay for for some of these but im sure its worth it! everything was great we had an awesome time during those 2 days! Now we certainly couldn't afford this normally but there are lots of great deals online are's was we took a AmTrack from Seattle to Vancouver wich was very scenic we also took a car ferry and then bus to Victoria from Vancouver then took a ferry back to seattle on victoria clippers we also got a few other perks like taxi vouchers,food vouchers and other similar freebees all in all if your wealthy you wont need these things and wont be surprised by this beautiful hotel but if your normal you might just get to feel like royalty for a day!

Reviews.Title: “Cranky Security Guard Blemished Good Memories”
Reviews.Author: guest1420
Reviews.Content: I normally have nothing but good things to say about the Fairmont Hotel Vancouver and Fairmont Hotels generally. I live in Vancouver and normally put up my guests there and stay in Fairmonts when I travel. I also like their Sunday brunches and excellent menu at Griffins so dine there regularly but now I am really wondering about that after an unfortunate experience I had there recently. I was surprised by the surly manner of the security guard I encountered recently there. I was waiting for my late guest to arrive in the lobby so we could dine at the restaurant for a business lunch (I am respectfully dressed in a business suit). There is a piano in the lobby which was unoccupied and right by the sitting area. I decided to play a little 25 second tune (a jazz standard - I'm a lawyer and a jazz pianist). I am not a bad player. After I finished, a cranky guard comes up to me admonishing me for playing. He tells me that someone else comes in to play the piano - yet no one was there to play contrary to his advice. He rudely told me "not to touch it" and walked away. In the future, please don't be so rude to long time customers - it isn't good for business. There is a way to handle things if you disagree with what a customer is doing - perhaps you could have offered a newspaper or offered to assist me during my lengthy wait? I will steer guests elsewhere now after being the recipient of such rudeness/indifference which unfortunately is becoming more common in Vancouver these days.

Reviews.Title: “I had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: roxygirl87
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked a get away up to Vancouver for 2 nights and 3 days. It really was a great deal. $170 each including roundtrip trainride from Seattle, hotel stay, and taxi transfers. This hotel was really nice. Everything was really classy and tasteful. The bar was a bit pricey, but included complimentary appetizers and good company. Our rooms included the most comfortable robes ever, and these huge down pillows. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay up in Vancouver. Thanks to the concierge, we got some good nightlife recommendations, too. Since I am only 20 years old, I usually expect some sort of stereotyping that I will be wild, or whatever. I never came across that here. Everyone and everything was just great! Oh, except the pool was undergoing renovations. But, they did arrange for us to use the Four Seasons pool across the street. Lovely.. I'd defintely reccommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very dated”
Reviews.Author: smileNottingham
Reviews.Content: We came to vancouver 16th October and was looking forward to having our first stay at a 5 star hotel. We booked 3 rooms which were on the 10th floor these were very dated there was mould in the bathroom on the tiles and walls. The tables and bedside cupboards were not dusted at all during our 3 night stay and no one used a vacuum at all duuring the time period. The lobby area was very good and staff were great but we had breakfast in the Griffins and it was like having a meal in any cafe there was nothing that made you think top class place. We also used the pool area which was not bad but again needed alittle bit of work doing to the pool tiles. I dont think I would stay here again as during our holiday we stayed in better hotels in toronto niagara and lake louise and for a 3rd of the cost

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: krohrig
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Hotel Vancouver (The Fairmont) right in downtown Vancouver. What a beautiful hotel. It was our birthdays so when we checked in I mentioned it and the hotel surprised us with a bottle of wine and choclate dipped strawberries, what a treat! This hotel is in a great location to the shopping on Robson street and all the restaurants. We arrived on Oct 25th and that same day we arranged some tours. Definitely do the Victoria Island tour. It is not to be missed! Our guide Brent was fantastic! We also did the suspension bridge tour... something you can miss for sure. Maybe if it was spring time we would have enjoyed it more because you actually walk on these bridges through the trees. We walked to the water down Hornsby street so that we could take the water ferry over to Granville Island. This is something you should do. Granville island is this quaint island. We had drinks and dinner at the Sandbar restaurant. Our waitress' name was Yael. Hopefully you can get her as a waitress. She was great. You will find that tours and eatting out is very very expensive. Enjoy yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Old grand style with professional hotel staff.”
Reviews.Author: advcardio
Reviews.Content: From the moment we drove up to the door the constant professional and experienced hotel staff shined during our visit. First impression was the quick service, from the Door man sending our luggage to our room to the fastest record for checking in at the front desk. We stayed with a group for a celebration party and we upgraded to the 10th floor with some amazing city views looking down Burrard St and across the water. (This is the view you should request) This is an old grand dame hotel with an old flair elegance and furnishings. The only thing modern I could find was the digital thermostat in the room. The new bed was one of the best I've slept in (5 stars out of 5) with several choices of pillows and a perfect weighted duvet on top. The room and vents were clean. Yes, as reviewed before the washrooms are older but fits in with the theme of a older hotel. Also in our spacious hotel room was a sitting area with two comfy chairs and a large desk with another chair. The TV was much smaller than expected and would like to have something a bit bigger. The room is not sound proof as you can hear your next door neighbour talking. The gym was a wonderful surprise with updated equipment and a nice little pool for some very quick laps and was adjacent to the whirlpool. The huge disapointment would be the Breakfast Buffet located in Griffin's Restaurant although again the service was good the food was less than average for any major hotel not to mention a Fairmont. (see review on www.dinehere.ca) The hotel lobby bar/lounge again offered that old air elegance of an era almost lost but can be found here at Hotel Vancouver. Would I stay here again- Yes!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel rooms in need of makeover”
Reviews.Author: ABtraveller
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights at Fairmont Hotel Vancouver, but wouldn’t likely return. I agree with the reviewer that said it’s like staying at your grandmother’s. Furnishings are old. Bathroom is downright ugly – just screaming for a makeover. Wallpaper and shower curtain definely not pleasing to the eye. I'm not sure why, but my room didn't have robes. Towels were of good quality. I didn't care for the soap. The covered area for car drop/pickup is large and well-lit. I found staff to be very good. One thing the check-in agent warned me about: their new sensor system in the barfridge. If you move items, the cost will appear on your bill. Public spaces are old classic and beautiful. You need your access card to ride an elevator up. The conciege dog during the day is certainly cute. Hotel location dowtown is very good; Art Gallery is next door. Fitness area and pool/hot tub, open till 10:30pm, is fine. They really should consider an adult-only pool time after 9pm. (I had to endure young screamers twice). The pool isn’t as close as I’d like from the changerooms/fitness area. As others have stated, join the free President’s Club if staying at Fairmont. I enjoyed the free room upgrade, free internet, and free local and toll-free calls. Loved the comfy bed! There is a large gap under the doorway (both the adjoining door to next room and the hallway). I could clearly hear laughter and the tv in the next room.

Reviews.Title: “Can't hide quality”
Reviews.Author: Brian_from_Scotland
Reviews.Content: For our first 3 nights of our vacation we chose the Fairmont Vancouver based on previous good experience with Fairmont elsewhere. This is one of the traditional older style railway hotels from the early 1900's and it feels like a 5 star establishment from the moment you walk up to the front doors. The ornate period architecture and furnishings let you know this is a classy hotel. All staff were very helpful from the check-in to the dining room, cleaning staff to the consierge - they were excellent. Rooms were of a high standard - well decorated and furnished. Breakfast was excellent, with buffet or full menu available. The hotel ambassadors (two golden labradors) are regularly in attendance in the lobby and can be book out for walks, which was great touch. The location is good as it's a 10 min walk from the waterfront, main shopping malls and Robson St etc. All things considered, we would have no hesitation in staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms need refurbishing”
Reviews.Author: planned
Reviews.Content: We were staying at the hotel as part of our anniversary celebration.With taxes of 16%, our room came to almost $400.00 US. We were given an upgrade(Free to join President's club) to a two room traditional suite but in an older area on the 5th floor. The carpet and furnishing were very worn in the room and the drapes looked sad. Bath adequate(no counter space) but small( plumbing moaned loudly when turned on). It appeared the renovations bragged on were put into the large, marbled floor lobby, bar lounge, etc. The highlight was the 2 dogs who are dressed in Fairmont vests and who lazily welcome guests by the consierge desk. Staff not plentiful or seeing to the personal touches we have had at other hotels, including Fairmonts. Walked to the indoor pool and fitness area just to see. OK. Ate dinner on the main shopping street and enjoyed a walk down to the water...but due to construction, you will need to walk around it. If time Stanley Island, a long walk or short cab ride, highly recommended. By the way, all our taxi drivers were very courteous. Fare from airport to Fairmont was $28.00 US . Very expensive shops share the city block with the Fairmont and Tiffany's is right across the street. I commented at the President's desk as to the very worn furnishings as we left and she said she would make note of it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: spot2
Reviews.Content: My mom and I spent two nights at the Fairmont Hotel Vancouver before our Alaska cruise. This was our first stay there, and we were very pleased. The hotel is very clean, and our double room, #709, looked out over the front of the art musuem. The beds were very comfortable, it was easy to adjust the air conditioning, the room was very quiet, high-speed internet access is free if you are a member of the President's Club (free to join), the bathroom lacked storage space but the amenities, nonskid bath mat, robes and hair dryer were very much appreciated, and because we booked through a Virtuoso agent, we were able to get a great rate with breakfast included (normally $26 per person). There is a coffee maker in the room and a large, flat-screen television. My mom especially enjoyed the dogs, Mavis and Beau, who hang out in the lobby during the day. The hotel is well located near Robson Street and only a few blocks from Canada Place. The airport shuttle bus stops at this hotel (we took a cab). I would stay there again if I could get a similar or better rate.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy and upscale, but outdated”
Reviews.Author: skeletoncrew
Reviews.Content: Personally, I don't like Fairmont hotels, but rate of 107.00 was pretty good and location is excellent. I don't like their English elegance , "Ms. Marple" style with flower wallpaper and matching bedding, lemony shampoos and body lotions. Speaking of bedding, that was incredible! Down pillows and comforters, great mattress, I slept like a baby. Hotel is little bit run down considering their Fairmont name and I don't understand who pays 300$ per night to stay here. I forgot my digital camera, they did sent it back, but they charged me 20$ for postage when actual postage was 6$. Very classy.

Reviews.Title: “A classic hotel ideally located. Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: bonjovirock
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights here in late June. We printed the driving directions from the hotel's web site and they were very easy to follow, on our arrival and departure. There is almost no difference in cost ($2 CA ish) between the Valet parking and self parking so I recommend opting for the Valet service. Check in was quite busy in the middle of the afternoon but the line moved quickly. Our travel agent had booked us a twin room despite us requesting a king sized bed and sadly the hotel would not move us from the twin room. They did offer us one of the Club rooms though, at standard advertised price! We declined. Our room was very comfortable and clean. To be honest we spent so little time in it as there is so much to do in and around Vancouver. The hotel has a perfect location, next to the shops and restaurants on Robson Street and just a short walk to the Harbourfront Centre in the opposite direction. We did not eat in the hotel but did have drinks several times also and treated ourselves to the speciality chocolate fondue one evening (an indulgence not to be missed). The swimming pool and gym were well equipped. All the staff we encountered were polite and helpful and the hotel's dog in the main lobby was a hit with most guests! Overall this elegant hotel offers quite good value for money and is ideally placed for exploring all that Vancouver has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a capital "S"”
Reviews.Author: BILLJ_GA
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very nice and the service it out of this world. I was very impressed with the level of service from everyone. They were always very nice, helpful, and friendly. One tip is to go online and register for the "president's club" before booking as you may get upgraded to the club level floor when you arrive if available. You also have a special check in desk. The rooms are nice, but they are a bit smaller than one would expect for the rates. The beds/pillows are terrific. I slept so well every night. As other people have stated, the location is terrific. I would stay at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fenway7
Reviews.Content: Such a beautiful old hotel! Great location, beautiful, comfortable rooms, very helpful front desk and concierge service. The pool/spa area is clean, spacious, and well-kept. The hotel has two adorable dogs that wander the lobby, and you can even take them on walks during the day! Professional, helpful, friendly staff. Comfortable, clean, and spacious rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely lived-in luxury”
Reviews.Author: tcook052
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying one night at this downtown Vancouver institution on 4th August and enjoyed my stay. It offers enough luxury perks for me in a great downtown location without the much higher costs of newer ultra-luxury hotels closer to the waterfront. The Fairmont room I booked wound up on 13th floor, room number 1303, and was a larger standard room than you'd get a most other hotels as it features a huge king bed, sofa and two comfortable sitting chairs, a work desk with internet hook-up plus a dining table with seating for four. The bathroom was just off the main room entry way and was on the smallish size, which didn't surprise me having stayed at several other vintage "railway" hotels in the past. The bonus feature I was surprised to find was the 32-inch flat screen TV on a faux antique set of dersser drawers that housed the mini-bar. When I checked the front desk advised this room is a smoking king Fairmont room, which was the default room type requested I suddenly recalled since I'd forgotten to update my profile with Fairmont's guest loyalty program called President's Club as I'd quit being a smoker within the past 6 months. The clerk was very polite and offered to change rooms and I wanted the king bed and said I'd give it a try and the smell never bothered me. It's the little things I find at Fairmont as the same clerk when I said I'd have to go online when I returned home and update my member profile to change my room preferences said they could do it for me and it would take only a few seconds, which they did. I can't admit to trying all the hotel ammenities as the location lends itself to walking to nearby sights, shopping and restaurants which I did. The location is hard to beat as roughly 4 blocks in any direction puts you at Canada Place where some of the cruise ships dock, the art gallery or downtown shopping with Stanley Park and historic Gastown only another short distance beyond. To each their own and if you are a guest who likes new, chic & hip hotels then this Fairmont may not be for you. However, if you like a historic touch with quiet, elegant luxury then this hotel fits the bill and I can highly recommend it. And if you do opt to stay at any Fairmont I would recommend signing up for the guest loyalty program, more details of which can be found in every room.

Reviews.Title: “Classic that stands the test of time”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryTraveler77
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Hotel Vancouver is much like many of the other classic Fairmont hotels--the rooms are often a bit small, curiously furnished, but the service, location, and ambience really can't be beat! When we arrived, there was some momentary confusion while they located my reservation (as a Fairmont President's Club member, this is definitely unusual). However, once we got into the room, it was well-appointed with (a first in my Fairmont experiences) a flat-screen TV instead of the usual 25" fuzzy tube TV. The bathrom was the smallest of any Fairmont property I've stayed in, but was functional. Our room overlooked Burrard Street, but wasn't high enough up (3rd floor, which seemed to be about the 6th "real" floor) to entirely block out traffic noise. The location really can't be beat, with the shopping of Robson Street only 1 1/2 blocks away, and a short walk from most other major downtown routes. The only minor glitch was readily remedied--we had neglected to remove the privacy sign from our door as we headed out for a day of sightseeing; upon returning, we realized housekeeping had (rightfully) not been into the room. We took the privacy sign off the door and laid back for a quick rest, and were going to call housekeeping for an evening refresh when there was a knock on the door. A small army of three housekeepers offered to clean the room in 10 minutes, so we took them up on their offer and stepped out for a quick walk to Pacific Place mall and a smoothie. We returned in 15 minutes, and, true to their word, the housekeeping staff had completely turned over the room...stunning! Outstanding service, superior location, and a charming ambience you just don't get in the concrete 70s monstrosities or the glass and steel monoliths make the Hotel Vancouver a locaton of choice for me.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for anything more”
Reviews.Author: specedu
Reviews.Content: From the moment my husband and I arrived for our one week stay to the last day I felt that we we movie stars. Every single person that worked at this hotel was nothing short of courteous,professional and over the top friendly. We travel extensively and don't always pick the top of the line hotels because we think that they are overrated mostly, but we had to attend a financial symposium and will always go back to the Fairmont. I worked out daily in the gym and never got tired of roaming through the shops at the hotel although I think the only things I bought were some postcards. I agree it is quite expensive especially the bar and food prices, but it was worth every penny,plus we're a little older and like the convenience of staying downtown in the heart of the city. Vancouver is truly a livable community. I would love to retire here. Thank you again Fairmont of Vancouver. Adina & Steve ,Temecula, Calif.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: glasshut
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. It was old (historic), but well taken care of and charming. Our room was much larger than I had expected. I was disappointed that they charged to use the business center. Shame, shame! The cheap hotels offer free internet. You should too! That aside- we loved the dog in the lobby. What an interesting aspect of the hotel. Beau was there the day we stayed and he was not too ambitious, but awfully cute. The restaurant in the hotel was pricy, but the food was good. We ate breakfast around the corner at The Bellagio and it was tasty. There is a market nearby so it makes it easy to buy snacks and water and such. We would stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: TAMember11
Reviews.Content: The only positive thing about this hotel is the location. It's only half a block away from Robson, a major shopping street and the Vancouver Art Gallery is right across the street. The beds are uncomfortable....they sag terribly and the mattress isn't of the highest quality. Bathroom is pretty outdated, can definitely use major updating including the lighting which is florescent....not good for as much as you pay. Also, there is a big gap on the bottom of the door and you can hear every conversation people are having as they walk past your room, not to mention every time someone's door opened and closed. I woke up every single time someone opened and shut the doors because the doors are quite heavy and it sounds like you are slamming the door even though you don't intend to. Concierge, although knowledgeable, definitely have attitude. After a while, I felt uncomfortable enough to not ask them any questions and just used the laptop I brought to find out information feeling like I was bothering them. To me, this was the biggest disappointment since when you're staying at a four star hotel, you should feel like you're treated well. Definitely do your homework and check around before you settle into a hotel. I sure am sorry that I didn't.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: RoanokeSondra
Reviews.Content: It really is my new favorite hotel. I never write reviews but a hotel that does so may things right and is economical compared to other fine hotels is a rarity in this day and age. The rooms were elegant, roomy and spotlessly clean. I actually looked forward to coming back to the hotel at night. the whole staff was efficient and delightful. They went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed. I'm afraid we will compare all conciergefrom now on with David at the Fairmont. He could not have been more helpful,knowledgable and approachable. It was wonderful to be in a hotel where the staff truly seems to enjoy working there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: nowpetronius
Reviews.Content: Four nights at the Fairmont. Room was big, bed comfortable, bathroom not big but perfectly adequate. We took taxi to hotel and left a knapsack in it with return air tickets, hotel vouchers and so on. The concierge service was magnificent and did absolutely everything to get things organised and me relaxed. They also know the best restuarants, worth asking them for advice. I've marked down from excellent simply because we did not eat there - 26 dollars for breakfast when just down the road was plenty of choice for 10. If you can get a good deal, it's certainly worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Stay for the Ambiance, Not the Room”
Reviews.Author: patrickstpaul
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at quite a few Fairmont properties and the service is consistantly top-notch. For this property, the lobby and public areas are elegant and lively and if you are into shopping (as I am) the proximity to Robson can't be beat. So why am I only giving the overall experience just an average rating? The reason is the room I had wasn't anything special. I know it is an older property however the bathroom is small, the decor reminds me of staying at an old aunt's house and the room is fairly small. Even the TV was miniscule compared to the large armoire that housed it. However, you won't be disappointed with the bed and pillows as they were extremely comfortable. A Fairmont property leaves you feeling pampered and this one will also, but it's the property and the experience that is a pleasure, not the room. Keep that in mind and you'll have a lovely experience.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: trvldog
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Fairmont 5 times- each time I have had the best service than any other hotel I have ever stayed at. The rooms are very clean - we have stayed in 2 room suite and rooms on the fairmont club level that include a great breakfast. The front desk are always so friendly and willing to help with anything you need. They have a very nice indoor pool. Fitness center is not that big but does the trick I love the Yellow Labs they have that you can walk if you like. They just got a new one as the other I think is retired I think from walking but we were their May 3rd and she was downstairs taking pets & cuddles from everyone. My husband and I go up each year for a Ball that is always at the Hyatt but I will always stay at the Fairmont and walk over to the Hyatt since the Fairmont just is way above in service than the other hotels in the area!

Reviews.Title: “Historic Hotel in the Heart of Downtown”
Reviews.Author: GPBurdell67
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Hotel Vancouver is the third Hotel Vancouver in Downtown -- the first two were demolished years ago. I first stayed in the Hotel Vancouver nearly 30 years ago when it was the tallest building around with a great view from the rooftop restaurant. The view these days is less grand since Vancouver has had an explosion of residential condo high-rises throughout Downtown. Despite the diminished view, this is still a fine hotel in a prime location -- close to transit, at one end of the main shopping and strolling street (Robson Street), and near many fine restaurants. The hotel has top-notch public areas and the staff is quite helpful and courteous. Elevator service was good, with secured access to residential floors. Our room was OK. It had an updated but somewhat cramped bathroom, a small TV in a armoire, comfortable beds with good linens, high-speed internet access at $14.95 per 24 hours, and not-so-good sound transmission to the next room. The Globe & Mail newspaper was delivered to the door every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: QuebecChic
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel March 30 - April 3, 2007. Our room was on the 7th floor. Both the room and bathroom were quite roomy and comfortable with a king bed that was out of this world (probably the most comfy bed I have ever slept in!). Breakfast buffet in the hotel was great but pricy - $50 + taxes for 2! The hotel was in walking distance or next to public transit services. Just a block from busy Robson Street.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel in a Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Nicf78
Reviews.Content: A very grand hotel with an old colonial feel. Stayed here for 3 nights at the end of skiing holiday in whistler and found it to be very comfortable with great facilities and a fantastic location for shopping and sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: jaffacake1
Reviews.Content: Went on a tour of Canada for two weeks and had my last night at the Vancouver Hotel and I have to say it was my favourite hotel of the lot. Couldnt fault anything. I didnt want to get out of the bed which was the most comfortable I think I have EVER slept in. You wont regret staying here

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous staff in a charming hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jewelsmum
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 10a and were pleasantly surprised to be told that our room was ready and we could check in immediately. The hotel common areas and room was spotless (in fact probably the only room I've ever felt comfortable walking barefoot in!). We didn't have much of a view (honestly, we were gone most of the day so didn't miss it). The rooms are a bit on the small side compared to modern hotels, BUT we had a large walk in closet as well as a separate "dressing area" next to the bathroom which more than made up for the minimal square footage. The room had been recently renovated including new paint and carpet but it still retained it's antique charm and features (the desk had office supplies, as well as computer ports and electrical plugs that you didn't have to rearrange the furniture to access) . The bed was comfortable and featured excellent bedding. The bathroom towels were changed daily (w/o the guilt-inducing note about "saving our environment - hang your towel if you want to reuse"...for me part of the fun of a hotel stay is fresh towels daily!), and the toiletries were pleasant smelling and of good quality. A full sized hair-dryer and robes completed the amenities. The staff were top notch, from the doorman, to the bell-hop, front desk and restaurant. The hotel was elegant and high class without being stuffy and formal. They welcomed our 7yr old daughter with a voucher for room-service milk and cookies and she was delighted. The pool was closed, but we were able to make use of the pool at the Four Seasons less than a block away. The change rooms and amenities were very nice, but the pool wasn't as clean as I would have expected. I tried the breakfast buffet (it seemed good value compared to ordering food, coffee and orange juice separately), but my initial trip up yielded crunchy pancakes, soggy waffles, limp hashbrowns, and dried up cheese. By comparison my husband's Eggs Benedict were excellent (and made me very jealous). Skip the buffet and order what you want. Better yet, head over to the Days Inn a couple of blocks away for a coffee-shop style breakfast that won't break the bank.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel - Great Lunch Buffet”
Reviews.Author: Koppit
Reviews.Content: My wife and our 18 month old daughter stayed here for 11 days as part of my wife's conference in March. The weather was terrible - I think we had record rainfall for March. Anyway, our room was just a basic room on the corner of the 6th floor, but it was much better than we expected, very spacious and clean. The decor is old fashioned but we didn't mind as we had lovely views of the mountains toward Canada Place. The breakfast in the hotel was not included and very pricey ($25). I suggest going out for breakfast and save yourselves for the hotel lunch buffet ($20) with a wide selection of salads, fish and meats which begins at 11.30am. The swimming pool is fine and there is a kiddies paddling pool which was great for our daughter. Unfortunately it will be closed for 2 weeks from the 26th March. Otherwise, the staff are very friendly and helpful and we would highly recommend staying here. I also recommend registering for the Fairmont President Club membership online which is free and entitles you to express check-in/out and free internet access in your room.

Reviews.Title: “I'll come here again”
Reviews.Author: QueenCamilla
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at the Fairmont Hotel, Vancouver (downtown) just before Christmas. It's a lovely place with style and history. Our room was large and immaculate, on the 6th floor overlooking Robson Plaza and the Vancouver Art Museum. The weather was filthy, but we're from the Seattle area, so we're used to it. The hotel location is terrific - central to everything. The staff were all very courteous and professional. My son used the gym and pool facility and reported that it was "just fine" for his requirements. I won't hesitate to come back for a stay with my husband during some lovely spring or summer weather.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ChunMingYang
Reviews.Content: I headed Vancouver in the December and my friends suggested me to stay in the Fairmont Hotel Vancouver. The hotel is very nice, though the room is a little bit small, but it's warm, comfortable and clean. The employees are very nice, polite, and willing to help you solve your problems. Hotel Vancouver located in the heart of Vancouver city, so it's quite convenient. Bookstore and coffeeshops are around the corner. I would like to recommend this hotel to people who wanna enjoy some european elegance.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel (but we were in upgraded rooms)”
Reviews.Author: Sleepless_Travelers
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel in a fantastic location. Just steps away from the main shopping streets and restaurants in downtown Vancouver. My wife and I were staying there in their "Gold/Platinum/or whatever other precious metal" floor :) This floor has its private concierge, lounge, computer terminal, cd/dvd check-out. The staff is extremely helpful and very attentive, professional and courteous. The lounge has free breakfast, and then coffee, drinks, snacks throughout the day and appetizers in the evenings. All you pay for is the liquor. Got to meet several nice people in the lounge and also spotted a few well-known US/Canadian celebrities. The rooms do need updating if you like rooms with a contemporary feel. But they are quite nice and spacious. The gym is also quite adequate. We stayed for 6 nights and it was one of the most pleasant experiences in stays at 5 star hotels in the US and Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Great Restaurant but Noisy Room”
Reviews.Author: coupletraveling
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a Saturday nite in mid-September before taking a Rocky Mountaineer Tour. That nite we ate in their Brasserie, Griffins. We had made reservations in advance and at that time let the staff know of our special dietary needs. We had an exceptional meal which met both my needs as a vegan with allergies and my meat-eating husband's special dietary needs as well. We were able to eat healthfully but have a special meal too. In fact, we found that just as in every Fairmont Hotel restaurant that we ate at on our tour, Griffins, was extremely attentive to and aware of our needs. At this restaurant and Fairmont Hotel restaurants in Jasper, Lake Louise, Banff, and Calgary, our dietary needs were marked right on the list by our names. Our room was fine. Clean. Nice king-sized bed and a good sized room. However, there was a gap below the door and being a Saturday nite there were a few people partying or returning from partying until the wee hours. Since we had to get up early in order to board the Rocky Mountaineer train for the start of our Rocky Mountaineer Canadian Rockies at Leisure tour, we were less than enthused. There are fancy shops in the hotel and when they didn't have the item I was looking for, they hospitably referred me to a nearby shop that did. I really appreciated that. We had joined the Fairmont President"s Club online before we left. This really helped us with check-in and check-out at the various Fairmont hotels on our tour. There are no income requirements, etc. to join. You just need to fill out an ap online. This hotel has a nice, central downtown location and is right across from the Vancouver Art Museum. After check-in, we ate lunch there in their rooftop garden cafe and enjoyed a great exhibit on Inuit art. We even took a guided tour of the exhibit guided by two very informative young women, one of whom was a native Inuit. It was a very nice afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Service is top notch!”
Reviews.Author: travel-lover71
Reviews.Content: The best parts of our stay were the service and the Sunday brunch! They truly are welcoming and pay attention to detail. Everything was how we expected it to be, if not better. Room was very clean and comfortable. And we got such an excellent rate of only $120 -- and it included a buffet breakfast. It was a steal! We actually live in Vancouver but stayed at the Fairmont to treat ourselves to an in-town get-a-way weekend. It really felt like we were away. Hotel staff just seem to go out of their way to make you feel welcome and special. Sure the hotel decor is a bit dated, but as others have said it is part of the charm. The comforts and service more than make up for the tacky wallpaper in the washroom. Really, unless you are one to always find something wrong, a stay at the Fairmont Hotel Vancouver will truly be a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience.”
Reviews.Author: Jason9613
Reviews.Content: We quite enjoyed the Hotel Vancouver and it was refreshingly different than the usual Vancouver hotel experience. The hotel is not brand spanking new but that's part of the charm. The corridors are very, very spacious, the rooms while old fashioned are roomy, clean and have character (lots of crown moldings etc.). While one of the oldest hotels in town, the rooms are actually larger and more comfy than the Bayshore and the Vancouver Four Seasons which I don't recommend BTW. The experience is warmer than the Pan Pacific and Sunday Brunch at Griffin's was superb. As with most Fairmont properties, it probably would suit "old money" types more than "new money" types in terms of taste. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary Service”
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Hotel Vancouver for 4 nights before embarking on an Alaskan cruise. It is about 6 blocks from the cruise ship dock. We decided to stay there instead of the Fairmont Waterfront because of all the construction in the immediate area of the dock. We made the right choice. It is a beautiful historic hotel in the Fairmont tradition. We were warmly welcomed and our room was ready upon arrival. The room itself was a bit small but very clean and comfortable, most important to us. The reason I selected the Fairmont was in order to utilize the services of their concierge desk. Their services were extraordinary. They made reservations for us at Cloud 9, a revolving restaurant in order to view the fireworks on our first night. They arranged an entire day for us in Victoria, from rental car, to ferry reservations, to sight- seeing suggestinons. They gave us suggestions and directions to hiking locations. Staying at the Fairmont was like having my own personal travel agent for Vancouver. This service is what made my Fairmont experience worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location!”
Reviews.Author: tamsha
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights August 4 weekend in a regular double Fairmont room. I can't say enough about the location of this property. It is right in the middle of everything, just steps away from the shopping and excitement of Robson street and within walking to distance to English Bay and Canada Place. Perfect for sightseeing! The hotel itself is beautiful and historic and the staff are more than accommodating. The only negative thing I would have to comment on is the bathrooom in our room. It was very dated and needed major updating (wallpaper peeling, tub needs refinishing). The shower pressure was also low and the water wasnt very hot. Other than that I would recommend this property to anyone. Worth the money and as I say, the location cannot be beat!

Reviews.Title: “No longer the gem it once was”
Reviews.Author: ScottC
Reviews.Content: Once a princess of the CP fleet, this hotel is now a mediocre hotel in the Fairmont stable. Not only is the hotel tired but the staff also seemed tired, bored and disinterested. If you get a deal that competes with mid range hotels in Vancouver this is a safe bet but if you are paying for and expecting luxury accomodation there are far better choices.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: EdmontonMarc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont to attend a conference here. The check-in was super quick & easy as I have a President’s Club membership, which you can get for free online. All the staff I encountered were professional. I had a room on the 13th floor, which was nice. I had a SW view looking out onto Robson St and the gargoyles on the corners of the hotel. The room was quiet. The bed & chairs were very comfortable, and the bathroom was very roomy for a hotel. They had nice white bathrobes available as well. Everything was immaculate; just what you would expect for the price you’re paying. The free tea & coffee in the room was good, however the mini-bar offerings were horribly expensive. I had dinner & breakfast at the restaurant in the lobby, Griffins, and the prices were a little pricey. The food, however, was excellent. Included in the price of a dinner entrée is a wonderful desert buffet – nice touch. The location is right in the middle of downtown Vancouver, just off Robson St. Very busy and very close to shopping. Good for a business traveler, but not exactly a romantic setting. This Fairmont hotel is quite nice, but not as special or spectacular as other Fairmont properties I’ve visited such as Jasper, Banff or Quebec City.

Reviews.Title: “okay hotel, nothing great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: signed up for president's club online, which may have only gotten me a free newspaper. also got the hotel thru my corporate rate of $172cad a night. when we checked in, i self-parked my car at a rate of 27 cad per day. when i checked in, i went to the regular line and they told me iw as a president's club, so my info packet was ready already. also they told me that they would give me a parking pass or else 'parking would be very expensive' we went up to our room and the keys didn't work.i had to run back downstairs. they gave us a room at the end of the hotel, on the 12th floor. it was probably meant for business persons, as there was a desk for doing work. room was okay, big bed, nice old-style bathroom. great view down howe st, i think, towards the waterfront and you could see the bay. soon after, we could smell the distinct aroma of some prime BC bud. apparently the ppl in the room next door must have been smoking a fatty. we could also hear their tv thru our shared door (if it was a combined suite). we also smelled the marijuana the next day. it didn't bother me. used the gym the next day. small but ok for what it was. i liked the free coffee they gave away in the gym. concierge helped us out by printing out our boarding passes the morning we left, but as we took our bags outside, none of the bellhops offered to help with our bags. parking ended being 27cad a day. i thought it may have been included or cheaper than the posted rate, but that was not the case. hotel is convenient to robson st shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Hotel Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: rose in woods
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend in Vancouver BC. We have stayed many times on the Fairmont Hotel Vancouver and really love it! The building is historic,and in beautiful condition. Join the Presidents Club(free) on the web page and get extra information on packages and deals. Our room was a king suite at $120.00 CA about $100.00 US including lavish buffet breakfast! Wonderful service and nice spa/ pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Really Average Old Grand hotel”
Reviews.Author: orcas33
Reviews.Content: My second stay this trip in a Vancouver hotel (the other being the Westin Bayshore), I was disappointed with this hotel. First, checking-in took really long, about 5-6 parties waiting with only two attendants. No convention or any special events going on, that's not a good first impression. The Gold Floor, which is where you want to stay, was closed for refurbishment. I got a room on the 3rd floor with "city views". Ok, I wasn't expecting anything special, not being on the waterfront, but all I got was a view on the other wing of the hotel. The room in itself was ok, but the bathroom was a terrible experience. A real stink hole and it seemed like it was original to the construction of the hotel. Lounges and dining room are very nice vintage areas. Breakfast was nice but staff invisible. On the whole, it was just OK, a bit disappointing for a Canadian Chateau hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location!!”
Reviews.Author: innharmony
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel and an Excellent location. Super Friendly staff. Rooms are slightly small and lack decor for the age of this hotel. We were hoping for less modern furnishings and more "Old world charm" Ordered from room service, Excellent Food! Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: hammerthrower
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed here for three nights as part of our Canada vacation. This was the beginning of our holiday and our first stay at a Fairmont hotel. Very plush entrance lobby. We arrived early and were told our room was not yet ready. Reception were very friendly and stored our luggage for us while we strolled down to the harbour front to chill out after the long flight from London. When we came back the room was ready. Baggage was delivered to our room by a very jovial bell hop who gave us a rundown on where everything was and how it worked. The reception staff were extremely helpful when we had to ring up our tour provider who had made a mistake on the booking of our subsequent onward Rocky Mountaineer train journey. The concierge was also very helpful in booking a couple of trips. We enjoyed a day at Grouse Mountain/Capilano suspension bridge, and a city tour. The whole hotel has a very traditional feel to it and this is reflected in the furnishings and decor. It is ideally located for exploring Vancouver. We were given a very big room on the seventh floor. Big bathroom with nice bathrobes and toiletries that were renewed each day. The decor was a bit drab. Huge, comfortable bed. Had a nice meal in the restaurant on our first evening - we were very tired and didn't want to eat out. Breakfast was okay with a good choice on offer. We ate out for the rest of the time - there are several nice restaurants/cafes right nearby, so not far to walk for a meal out. The hotel provided a perfect start to our holiday and we will forever have fond memories of Vancouver and the Fairmont Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Attentive Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 20th Wedding Annivesary in Vancouver, staying at the Fairmont Hotel. Overall, our experience was above average. The central location is excellent. We attended a theatre performance only blocks away. The room was spacious, fresh, and had a nice view. The bed was very comfortable. The hotel staff attended to our request and concerns quickly and professionally. Roomservice was timely, and food was very good. Checkin was delayed at our arrival, as housekeeping had not yet prepared our room at 3:30 pm. Parking is adjacent to the hotel, but at $26 a day. The room did show signs of age, and needed work. I was very dissapointed with bathroom. The toilet fixture was a purely functional, public restroom style, bowl with visible plumbing. It could not be flushed without closing the lid. The grout in the bath/shower was discolored. The 19" television was already small enough without the problem of the brightness setting being very dark and nonadjustable without help from a hotel technician. The wastebaskets were all stacked together in one place, and not lined. The guest services offered additional services to compensate for the few concerns we had with our room. Overall we had a very memorable stay in vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndrewMichael
Reviews.Content: If you like old-world luxury, the Fairmont Vancouver downtown is definitely for you. My Fairmont room was very clean and pristine.. smelled so fresh + new. I had no problems with housekeeping or the front desk. The hotel is perfectly located near public transportation (bus + subway) and the shopping center of Robson St. There is also a Louis Vuitton store at your lobby! Wished I ate at the restaurant or ordered food service to see if it was up to par with the excellence of the rest of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTE-ly horrible spa experience”
Reviews.Author: ChrisC100
Reviews.Content: Did not stay at the hotel. Went for the ABSOLUTE spa experience. It was horrible. For a hotel of this caliber, the spa was inattentive and the amenities were seriously lacking. 1. No locker rooms to change. This is a small facility. 2. No robe and slippers were given. Had to actually ask for these. The robes are paper thin. One person from our party never even got a robe after she asked for one. 3. The service was inexperienced--after our massages, the staff just assumed we were ready to leave. They either do not realize or anticipate that most spa goers like to shower after a massage so you don't feel greasy from the lotions. We had to actually ask if they would let us use their showers. And the separate rooms with the steam/shower combos that they had were small so you have to change in those rooms; also difficult to change into your clothes if you're sweating from the steam. The only positive note was that the massage therapists were good.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: coldweathergirl
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Fairmont Hotel Vancouver for 3 nights and found the service to be outstanding. I am a Fairmont President club member and on check in I was upgraded to a junior suite and sent chocolates with a welcome card. There was a bedroom separated by french doors from the living room. It was extremely spacious. The furnishings in the room were beautiful. Very classic upscale decor. I had read a couple of other reviews that said the rooms were musty, but that was not the case. My only complaint if I had one was that the bathroom was tiny. The location of the hotel is great. The Presidents Club front desk staff were extremely helpful for any request and the concierge was very helpful in obtaining tickets for me for that evenings opera. I ate in the dining room and the serving staff were very good. I will definitely stay at the Fairmont Hotel Vancouver on any further trips to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Gold Floor is the way to go!”
Reviews.Author: shif
Reviews.Content: So glad our travel agent suggested the Gold Floor when we planned our trip. The room was huge and we walked in to a plate of cookies and a plate of 6 different fruits that were dipped in chocolate. The entire concierge staff was wonderful- extremely courteous and helpful. They planned a few outings for us as well as recommend excellent restaurants for dinner. The "continental" breakfast was more than ample and the afternoon hors'doeuvers were fabulous and different every day. Staff was constantly refilling platters of food not to mention asking us if we needed or wanted anything. The weather in Vancouver was very rainy and cold(though it didn't stop us from exploring the city) but we enjoyed our few days at the Fairmont so much that we forgot about the weather once we returned to the 9th floor! Would definitely stay there again and especially on the Gold Floor.

Reviews.Title: “We did not want to leave”
Reviews.Author: Gayle74
Reviews.Content: Another luxury hotel which lived up to it's name. We enjoyed staying here so much we did not want to leave! Staff were very helpful and we were told that we did not need to tip anyone which makes life simpler. We just had a standard room but it was very spacious and had a grest view over the city. Only negative was the changing rooms for the swimming pool which need some modernising.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: paularc
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Vancouver enjoys an excellent location in downtown Vancouver, within easy walking distance to great shopping and restaurants. The rooms are nothing specially and certainly not up to the standard of most Fairmonts, but the staff make it up - everyone, from the front desk to the maids, is exceptionally friendly and helpful. I also like the pool (2nd floor with a nice rooftop view of the city) and the rest of the health club. Again, not amazing, but very adequate. The bar and casual restaurants are also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service and Accomidations”
Reviews.Author: bosanova99
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the Concierge Level and it was fabulous! Our cruise ship docked at 7am and we were at the hotel by 8am. They offered us breakfast while we waited to see if our room was ready and 15 minutes later we were escorted to our large beautiful cornor room with 2 queen beds. It is very difficult to find a room in this city with 2 queen beds, most of the hotels only have 2 doubles. The Concierge Girls (as we refered to them) were knowledgable and always friendly. When they made restaurant reservations for us twice, each time the server brought over an appetizer from the Concierge. Even the doorman, Dustin, helped us plan our only full day in Vancouver. I would dedfinetly stay there again and it is well worth the extra price for the Gold Level. Although it was only $260 american dollars per night for three of us. That included a european continental breakfast, snacks in the afternoon and cheese and horsd'ourves in the evening (one day it was crab legs!). They also have complimentary water, coffee, tea and sodas and an honor bar in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “TRIP OF A LIFETIME”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience at the Fairmont, Vancouver. Four adults with an infant. We had two rooms. We needed a crib and humidifier for the baby. We stayed on the Gold level 9th floor. The staff was terrific! Tracey was the one who greeted us upon arrival. We knew when she greeted us that everything would be okay. Tracey made our stay there a dream come true. We noticed that all staff members greeted the guest by name and treated all guests very well. It was our first experience staying on the Gold level. The rooms were big, spotless and beautiful. The complimentary breakfasts and afternoon appetizers were delicious. It truly was a hotel within a hotel. Mavis(dog) greeted us everyday. Our only complaint is that we had to leave this wonderful hotel.
